description:
I'll never say I'm an expert of shabu, but this place is DOPE.

The place gets crazy poppin' for dinner, so if you can get a reservation, do so.

I personally found the food to be tasty, but shabu is all about the vibes. At Kufuya, the vibe is awesome. Loud, it's bustling, sports going on in the background. It happened to be a friend's birthday the night we went, and when we started singing THE WHOLE PLACE joined in and it was a loud awesome ruckus of happy birthday. 

All in all, I'd come back in a heartbeat. Get the all you can eat service, it's worth it.

Finito
author: Aaron C.

description:
Went there on Wed night, not as many people as we expected.  

My girlfriend and I had the Shabu Shabu with spicy miso soup. you can ask them to adjust if you can't take the spiciness but still want to try the miso soup.   They don't have too many choices on all you can eat menu, but the lamb slices are quite awesome.  Btw, the sauce is also pretty good.
author: Jay Y.

description:
According to Yelp, this restaurant is much more popular than the exterior would suggest. The interior is in need of some dusting and maybe some air fresheners but its cozy and the service was prompt. I can't comment on the shabu, which I look forward to trying. The sushi was fresh and tasty, definitely the best dish of my meal. The karaage chicken was good, as most fried things are, but definitely not prepared in the traditional way I'm used to. The batter was very thin, like tempura, rather than thick and flavorful. I ordered the tonkatsu don and the tonkatsu was a bit soggy and tough with over cooked egg. On the bright side, I did appreciate that our meal came with a side salad, miso, and hot green tea. 

Overall, mixed feelings about the non-shabu dishes I tried. Would come back to try the AYCE shabu.
author: Melissa T.

description: The best all you can eat shabu shabu and all you can drink sake. The sauce is unbelievably delicious and you get a variety of add ins. We also always get oysters and sashimi. There's free parking in the back, you just need to move it when another customer needs to leave. It's a family feel place and the hosts are very welcoming. We love coming here with friends and family. Also kid friendly, my one year old loves the udon noodles with meat.
author: Jinnie L.

description:
TLDR; WOW! The beef quality is really nice, service is AMAZING, price is very reasonable, and THERE IS A PARKING LOT (to the left side)!

~~~

When I first drove by the restaurant, I thought I was at wrong location because from the exterior and interior looks more like a Japanese restaurant. But after a closer look the restaurant sign, you can find "shabu shabu" in small print on the right.

When you face the store front, there is a small parking lot to the back left (34th Avenue). 

I came here for their all you can eat shabu shabu.  
After we placed our soup base and meat order, the servers started putting the stove on our table, the ladles, the sauces, the vegetables, the meat, and lastly the soup. The soup came out a bit later than the rest of the items, but the wait wasn't too bad. 

What SURPRISED me the most was that once we finished our plate of meat, a server immediately came and switched out the empty plate with a new plate of meat!!! This didn't just happen once...they kept switching out our meat once our plate was empty! I didn't need to flag someone down, wait for them to take my order and then wait for the meat to come out. The SERVICE that we received was BEYOND AMAZING! (Please note that I came on a Friday night, and there were no empty seats, so they amazing service was not due to the lack of customers)

When we asked for the check, they told us that tax and tip was already included! It was $61.75! $30.88 for AYCE shabu shabu with great service and tender meat in the Bay Area is really rare!
author: Amanda L.

description:
This was one of my many stops on my San Francisco trip, I just had to get some sushi! When you walk in, it's very plain, simple, but modern. 

Seated quickly but no greeting, no smile, there's confusion between the two types of menus. One is an à la carte menu for the sushi, another is for the hot pot (which is AYCE) -- looking through reviews, no one mentioned it, so I figured this was AYCE.

Anyways, it was fine - we ordered sushi and sashimi. Honestly, quite fresh the sashimi, not the best I've ever had but not bad either. The sushi was rolled well and had a nice combo of rice and ingredients - enough to be memorable. But it wasn't good enough to justify the price tag on the food - which is one of the reasons for my 3 star rating.

Second reason why is because I called in advance and they had told me that it was AYCE. They should've specified what was and what wasn't.

Overall, I'd suggest not going here unless you're really hungry and out of options.

2.5/5
author: Aaron J.

description: We got the all you can eat and drink here for dinner.  The meat and veggies here were really fresh and the soup and sauce was excellent.  They have beef and lamb.  Noodles were the clear and udon noodles.  The thing we liked so much was the service. The staff here are so friendly and they are quick with your requests.  They are one big family and treat their customers like family.  Its a fun place for groups and I'd definitely recommend!
author: Anna J.

description: We are visiting San Francisco from Albany, NY and saw this place and decided since we have no place like this in New York we would give it a try and we are so glad we did, it was amazing!! We ordered the Shabu Shabu, which is all you can eat Japanese food that you prepare. They bring you all the ingredients, we had spicy miso soup with beef and lamb and they bring you and bowl of fresh uncooked mushrooms, tofu, spinach, noodles and bok choy which you cook in the spicy miso broth that is sitting on a burner boiling. It also comes with a lot of seasonings so you can make the bowl of soup to your liking!! This place was the best choice. The service was perfect, very friendly and helpful! Will definitely visit again if we return to San Francisco!!
author: Stephanie W.

description: My favorite AYCU shabu shabu in SF. The ponzo sauce is solid here as well as the spicy miso soup. More affordable than some other options in the city and the service is great. The family speaks Chinese and was particularly friendly to our party! After a solid experience, I've come back multiple times and recommend this spot to friends.
author: Sophia L.

description:
Fantastic little family restaurant. Very personalized service. Very caring and most importantly excellent food.  Sports fans you can  watch the game on their supersize TV. Highly rec
ommend
author: Eric B.

description:
One of my favorite AYCE shabu places in the city.
Went here for dinner on Saturday night. It can get very pack on the weekend. I made reservation the same night with Julie, the boss lady, told me up front if they have table available or not. Which is great cause I hate it when the restaurants lie and keep you waiting. They were pack with other birthday parties but made sure to refill our meat and veggies quickly. They also had a new item in their regular Japanese menu, wagyu nigiri! Melt in your mouth status. 
Great quality of meat. Great price. Great service. And has a parking lot!
author: Suzy Z.

description:
SOLID 5 star. Why? Value. Service. Quality. Service. Parking. Service.

I was introduced to this place last weekend because my friend apparently loves hot pot. This is nothing new since my best friend also loves hot pot and I've probably been to every hot pot restaurant in South Bay. That being said, when we were on our way to Kufuya, I thought it would be like every other hot pot meal. I was wrong.

Honestly, the best way to eat shabu is to eat AYCE shabu. With a price tag of $25 (before tax/tip), it's honestly hard to beat. The downside is that you're limited to a few options (Beef, lamb, veges, clear noodles, and udon) but honestly all I need is one solid cut of meat and I'm golden. Spoiler, the beef was great quality! It also helps that their sauces are super good, it's still DIY here but they pretty much bring everything to your table in separate dishes so you can adjust it however you want.

Now let's talk about the service. At first I thought all the workers were super nice to us because my friend goes there often but then I could tell that they were just genuinely nice people based on how they treated the other guests - verdict, they treated everyone like family! That's what I'd call a homey restaurant ;D To call out a specific event, a small family came to the restaurant and had a tiny baby with them. It's a little hard to explain, but have you ever met a person that was extremely good with kids? Ya, that person was going out of their way to make sure that your baby was having a good time at this noisy restaurant. Please take my money.

*NOTE: They have their own little parking lot in the back, I believe there are spots for 7 cars and if your car gets blocked in, you can just tell one of the people at the restaurant and they'll make an announcement for you.
author: Wiseley F.

description: ALL YOU CAN EAT Japanese Shabu Shabu. Make sure you order the SPICY pork soup, delicious. I m a sauce girl and I can drink their house dipping sauce. So yummy. The beef is good, not too fat but tender. Order more of their Napa cabbage and clear noodle, very match the soup with beef.
author: Katie M.

description:
$25 AYCE Shabu with amazing service?! Oh hell yea. 

Yesterday was my second time here and I can confidently say I will come back! They have a side parking lot for their customers. This place serves Japanese food as well as AYCE option for Shabu. I really loved the spicy miso soup base with the beef slices. The servers always comes back with a big smile and a new plate of meat right after you finish your previous plate!! Probably the cheapest AYCE Shabu in the city if I'm being honest.
author: Stephanie W.

description: This is best Hot pot restaurant in SF. I have been to many but this one has many other beat. We had the beef tankatsu with veggies, beef, rice noodles, tofu and veggies plus we had crunchy unagi. The service was exceptional. My daughter and I came in kind of late but they accommodated us and gave us plenty of time to finish. Plum wine was delicious and I can't wait to go back!
author: Ahna B.

description: There are quite a few Shabu restaurants in the Richmond, but if you really want an authentic experience you must make it out to 34th and Geary. We've come here a few times and Eric has served us regularly. The thin slices of lamb are endless, the sake pitchers never stop, and we always find ourselves leaving full and happy with the savory spices of Japanese cuisine. Come hungry to Kufuya and leave happy, because the food is just as good as the company.
author: Cody W.

description:
I love Kufuya. The shabu shabu is delicious, the service is wonderful, and I always end up coming here for AYCE more times than I'd like to admit.

For shabu, the broth is subtle yet flavorful, it doesn't feel overly salty or masked with spices to cheaply "season" the meat and veggies. The quality of the meat is also excellent, it always comes out looking and tasting fresh, something most places sadly have a hard time achieving. 

As many have mentioned, refills come FAST. Unlike other AYCE places where you feel like people are moving at a snails pace and wonder "Are they doing this to be cheap save money?", at Kufuya they make you feel welcome like they want you to eat and enjoy.

The one thing you absolutely have to come here for is their dipping sauce, it works with everything. From the meat, to the veggies, tofu, and noodles, this sauce delivers the perfect bite each time. Make sure to mix in the extras they give you before the meal starts!

Aside from the great food, Julie and Eric always make us feel so welcome! They're always lively and keep the party going when you come in large groups.
author: Nikki L.

description:
This is the place to go for ShabuShabu. The beef is so good that it melts in your mouth. A quick dip in their tasty broth and a another dip in their so secret sauce. Been asking what was in there for the longest time. Still no ingredients given. Try to get the owners drunk to spill the beans, but nope. 
Sushi there is always fresh. Just ask to know what they have first. 
The con about this establishment is parking. Yes there will be space. I am always block in. Have to wait for the people to move before i can get out. 
Overall good food and good atmosphere.
author: Phil T.

description:
Parking on the side of the building, catch is that if you're blocking someone, you'll need to move which beats circling around the neighborhood for parking. 

1 pot for 4 people which was insane for a party of 8 adults so we opted to pay $5 for an extra pot which turns out made life so much easier. 

The beef was thinly sliced and broke a lot of the times when picking it up into the pot. But whatever. It held together for the most part. No enoki mushroom. Shitaki and white mushrooms only. The udon is really good here, it has a nice chew texture to it. 

Service for turnaround meat plates was quick. 

I would recommend making reservations for large parties even on a weekday.

$25 AYCE (no ice cream, no appetizer) which is totally fine by me.
author: Jess W.

description:
Super cozy Shabu place! I came here for the ayce Shabu and it didn't disappoint at all.

For the ayce menu, you have an option of 3 broth flavors: chicken, spicy miso or tonkatsu. I thought the tonkatsu broth by itself was just okay and could have used more flavor. Before they bring the broth, they set up your table with bowls, your dipping sauce and add ins for your sauce like chopped garlic, onions, horse radish ? And chilis. Then they bring out your veggie/noodle plate and meat! 

What I really liked was how fast their service is. Once you finish with your plate of meat, they almost immediately come to bring you another plate! Best service ever! I hate whenever I have to wait a long period of time before the server will come to take your order here. They're super attentive and friendly here! Love it!
author: Sherry L.

description:
Review is strictly about the hot pot.

Low-down: $25 dollars will get you ayce shabu. Choice of beef or lamb.

My boyfriend and I came for dinner one night after hearing rave reviews from our friends and came away unimpressed. Shabu has got some hot competition in the city and while the price is surely competitive, the quality is only so-so and the broth is not remarkable. Also, we were really not fans of the dipping sauce at all. I think it's an acquired taste because some Yelpers seem to ADORE it. 

However, I did like that they included the korean glass noodles in the vegetable platter. Also, this location has a parking lot (though you'll have to move your car if you're blocking someone), which in the city is always a plus. Service is SUPER friendly and vibe is definitely cozy.

Nonetheless, I'd prob go elsewhere for my shabu cravings and pay a few extra bucks.
author: Josephine T.

description:
Place wasn't fancy, but who cares when you give 5 star service & serve 5 star food! BTW the sauce is amazing & parking isn't as bad as others have made it out to be! 

Not the best photo but the food was so good I forgot to take some when it first came out.
author: Saundra M.

description:
Their sauce brings all the boys to the yard.

AYCE shabu for $25, yes please! This place is wild n lit n always offers a grand time. Sauce is dank and service is just as great.

I've been here twice now and both times have been solid. They have their service down to muscle memory because we didn't even ask for more meat but they knew each time to bring out the beef! They offer beef and lamb, no pork :(. Their noodles (udon and potato noodles) and veggies options (button mushrooms, shiitake, napa cabbage, spinach) are pretty good! We had spicy miso, but when you come with a large party of boys the soup flavor barely matters. Their brown sauce comes with all you feel like adding chili, green onions, radish, and garlic, yum!

Their service is lit, our waitress, Julie, is always down to take a shot. So get our girl a shot cus she's a lot of fun! A lil wild, but aren't we all?

If you haven't been, you should definitely try Kafuya! It's a great spot for affordable ayce shabu! So come hungry and come all! They are really accommodating for large groups. Party on y'all!
author: Eva C.

description:
If I'm craving shabu and sushi this is def. my go to place.They have fast service and just when u think you gotta order an extra plate of beef the staff is one step ahead of you. You'll think we just eat the hot pot when we go but their sushi is really good. My husband loves the crunch unagi roll and kids love it too, so it's a win win situation. 
It gets really busy here, so make sure you call and make reservations
author: Hoa T.

description:
The cheapest all you can eat shabu shabu I've ever had. $25 for all you can eat is cheap.

The quality of the meat is not the greatest but it's not too bad it's OK.  Honestly my main complaint here is the service,  and is the reason why I'm giving 3 stars for my review. I understand it can be really busy but they need to be more attentive. Being busy is not an excuse for slow Service since they be do have a lot of staff.  Other than that  I wouldn't mind coming back since the meat is OK like I said at the beginning and they do give a lot of veggies, they're very generous with the portions but honestly I don't care for their sauce, it's on the sour side, it is not the authentic  Shabu shabu sauce. I have also tried the kufuya shooter,  It was OK nothing special about it, I would come here for shabu shabu not sushi I don't think it's worth it. 

 If you'll come around 7:00 p.m. You definitely need to make a reservation since it gets busy around that time. I'll definitely come back here again and will make sure I did not eat the whole day so I can eat more.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
Came with my best friend Rachel on a Monday night. It was cold, and shabu sounded perfect. She recommended this place to me because she loves it. Got here and there was a small parking lot in the back. Got seated right away and we decided to do all you can eat. We also got a couple plates of appetizers. 

I'm not really a big fan of shabu, but I love hot pot. Mainly because shabu is only meat and vegetables. The meats here I felt were of high quality. I loved the lamb. I also love udon. My only complaint is the mushrooms weren't enoki mushrooms. We didn't end up finishing our plate of vegetables as well. I also did not like the house special sauce. It was too sour for me. I just opted for regular soy sauce for the rest of my meal which wasn't a big deal. 

$85 dollars for all you can eat shabu? Not something I would get all the time, but definitely if I am craving.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Omg! This is my favorite Shabu place for the sauce. I don't know what they did with their sauce, but I love it. The broth and meat are similar to other Shabu places and the service is okay. They do replace your meat plates pretty quickly, so you won't be too starving.

I am able to make reservations through text a couple of before, so that is great. Before when I went without reservations, they are able to seat us in a timely manner... but we would be asked to eat within 1.5 hours, which is okay as well. We don't take that long to eat.  

The pricing is pretty cheap compared to other Shabu places.  The parking lot can be a bitch sometimes because we have to move our cars if someone is blocking or if we are blocking them, but at least they have parking! It is better than circling around to find one.
author: Kimberly D.

description:
My fellow gluttons can rejoice! I absolutely love everything about this place.

Well, I've specifically only come here for the AYCE (all you can eat). There's a choice between beef or lamb, and I just prefer beef because of how quickly it cooks. When it comes to AYCE, it's $25/person. For the price you're paying, it's worth it if you come ready with a strategy. You gotta be ready to scarf down all that food. 

The beef itself is thinly sliced, which is great because then you definitely know it'll cook instantly. There's a pot of soup that you have three options for. I always go for the spicy miso. If you can't really tolerate spicy, it's recommended that you opt for one of the other two options. In my opinion, though, it's not spicy.

The pot of soup has a side bowl filled with spinach, tofu, mushrooms, udon noodles, noodles, and lettuce. Throw it all in and let it simmer! Super good. 

THE SAUCE IT COMES WITH IS WHERE IT'S AT. I don't know exactly what it consists of, but that's what really sold me about this place. There's also four tiny dishes of add-one for the sauce (green onions, garlic, chili peppers, daikon radish). I only use garlic to give the sauce that extra BAM! Apparently, if you want to use the chili peppers, feel it out. Don't add generous amounts of it right away because it's too spicy and you don't want to be miserable. 

The service is exceptional. They treat you like you're family and they check up on you often. They'll refill the broth, constantly replace the plate of meat, the side bowl, and even your sauce! 

So when it comes to paying the bill, they will automatically add in the tip if it's AYCE. I'm not upset at that because I feel like they work really hard and they deserve to be tipped well. I feel like for those that have an issue with tipping, don't eat out if you're not going to tip 15 or 18% for exceptional service, you know?
author: Rachel M.

description: One of the more disappointing restaurant that still finds its way to survive in the bay area. The service was poor. We had to flag down the servers at least four times before we got our orders. While they would always have the alibi saying they are busy, but all I saw were servers flirting and taking shots with their  friends/customers. Ironically, the busser was more attentive than the two servers running around like a chicken with its head cut off. The raw meats were presented on the table 10 minutes before the broth was delivered lukewarm(so did they boil new broth or just plain forgot we need broth to cook???). In the mist of the bad service, the food was below average. The beef was tough and the sauce was this creepy combination of creamy vinegar. All in all, the restaurant is fortunate to find its fan base and returning customers (mostly middle men who like to holler at the female server), but if you are new in town or trying out shabu for the first time, there are way better options such as Shabu Club or Shabu House.
author: Jerry H.

description: We ordered some sushi for dinner, and it was delicious. The people next to us had the hot pot option and we will definitely be back to try it. The service was great and everyone was very friendly!
author: Michael W.

description:
This place is always my go to spot for me and my friends whenever we crave shabu. The spicy miso soup is the best soup base of the three. It is not spicy at all and is nicely blended for a good kick to your meat. For only $35 a person (tip and tax included), it is a steal.

Their selection of meat cuts is limited down to only lamb and beef but their cuts are of good quality. You also get unlimited spinach, tofu, mushroom, udon and vermicelli. 

Staff has superior service with their fast pace and friendly vibes. Meat comes out super quick unlike other shabu spots. You definitely can eat your money's worth easily here:
author: Ada H.

description: Some of the best Sushi in San Francisco. Fresh and amazingly tasty.  Not to be overlooked, although you easily can as they also have Shabu Shabu at $25 all you can eat! On a cool night this just can't be beat.  This might not be as popular as Pho, but by golly it's better!
author: Bill S.

description:
Great service. Great food and selection. Excellent house sauce. Killer uni shooter. Fresh sashimi. It was super busy, but we got everything we wanted in a friendly and timely manner

Docked one star for parking. Being in sf , it's expected, but still took me 30 minutes to find a space. They have a mini lot for customers, but you will have to move if you block someone else. 

Recommend
author: Angela K.

description:
My go-to shabu spot in SF.  Why? Because it's $25 for AYCE shabu shabu. They also offer all you can drink for an additional $10 pp. They offer beef, lamb, and a side of veggies (mushrooms, tofu, spinach, napa cabbage, udon, and yam noodles) with your choice of broth (miso, tonkatsu, spicy miso, or spicy tonkatsu *my fave*) You really can't beat that price anywhere else. There is a time limit of 2 hrs. Their meat is pretty good quality, thinly sliced with a good marble, some days were better than others and some plates will be better than others. Their veggies bowls aren't always consistent either, sometimes there was tofu and sometimes there wasn't. 

Tips:
- watch out, those red peppers are spicy!
- they do have ponzu sauce, just ask for it
- eat the lamb as soon as you get it, I noticed it doesn't taste as good if it sits for a while on the table

They do have a parking lot in the back which is nice since parking can be a b**** in that area, the only downside is if you parked on the outside, there's a chance you have to move your car.

I do recommend making reservations, especially for a big group. The few times I walked-in I ended up waiting about 30 mins and this is for a small group of 3 or 4.

Service is quick. If you need anything just let them know and they bring it right out to you. If they're super busy, they might not be as fast, but they try to accommodate you as best as they can.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Great place for all you can eat shabu. Very reasonably priced($25/person) and with an additional $10 you can enjoy all you can drink as well!

Pros
- Super efficient service.
- Customizable dipping sauce. Love!
- Thinly sliced shabu meat!
- Nice and casual environment with TVs and air is well circulated so it doesn't get all hot and steamy.

Cons
- Meat quality was great at the beginning of the meal but as the meal went on the meat quality worsened.
- Only 2 meat options (beef and lamb). I personally don't mind though!
- Not a whole lot of non-protein shabu items. It comes with a bowl of noodles, mushrooms, greens and tofu. Would love to have more items!

Overall had a satisfying experience here and would come back again :)
author: Mandy H.

description: My friend recommended this place to me and all I can say is WOW. The service was phenomenal and the shabu shabu was great. It was $25 per person and $10 for all you can drink Japanese beers and sake. Julie and Lisa were extremely welcoming last night. I will definitely be coming back when I come back in the city. Even my friends said they'll be coming back as well.
author: Cyril C.

description:
AYCE Shabu on Friday night $25 + $10 AYCD!!! So crowded and loud filled with Warriors fans!!! Go Warriors!! 

Satisfied my TASTE BUDS!! 

They provide shabu one plate at the time. 

Alway call and make reservations ahead of time!
author: Joan K.

description:
My favorite shabu place in SF! We always get the spicy miso broth (not spicy at all and super flavorful) with all you can eat beef. 

We empty these plates of such thinly slice tender beef so quick and the servers always give us another plate so promptly. 

Another thing that makes this place so good is the sauce! It's like a ponzu-sesame mix that's so perfectly balanced. 

10/10, always recommend especially since we always take our friends who have never been to this place.
author: Kathy N.

description: Best value hot pot experience in SF? Yup, that's Kufuya! $25/pp with tvs for sports fans.
author: Joshua F.

description: First time trying this place. I really enjoy the service. Fast in delivery food back to back to hungry people. It was very nice they cleaned up after the kids mess. You know kids will be kids. Tips automatically added and small parking behind the building for kufuya customers. The only negatives is that I'm not a fan of their dipping sauce. Seems to be already combined both the sesame and ponzu together. I ask for just sesame so it won't be so tangy which they didn't have it. So I assumed pre combine sauce.   Lamb is not all that but the beef is good. Very thinly slice. Food I would rate 3 star but their service is fast and nice so extra for that-4star. Now would I come back? Yes but only if I'm in the area. I don't think I would go out of the way to drive that far since I live on the other side of frisco.
author: Christy V.

description:
Good shabu shabu place in the Outer Richmond district of SF. 

I met up with my former coworkers for dinner here a few weeks ago. I found parking along the streets nearby the restaurant. I noticed they have a small parking lot where people would parking behind other people so often while you're dining there... You'll hear them call out license plate #s out so that the car owner will go out to move the car if it's blocking someone in.

It seems funny whenever they're yelling out the numbers. It's like playing lottery, but you don't get a prize. Lol.. also, it interrupts your dinner so it can be annoying. 

They have a spicy or non spicy option. Unlike other shabu places that offer the split pot, this place does not have that. I could see why after they brought out the pot since it's like made out of a different material rather than the pots that most other places have. This is like some hardcore cauldron or something. lol Anywho.. service was fast & friendly. But it could be since one of my former coworkers goes there often so she's close with them. They bring out a plate of meat immediately once it's empty.  

I didn't get to try the different sauces while I was there though. I see the staff would drink with each table which is cool. Makes it more cozy, I guess?

I think I remembered it being about $35 per person for AYCE&D which seems right.

I would say this place is 3.75 stars. More than 3 which is average, but not quite a 4 which is considered a fave.
author: Amy C.

description: Great find in walking distance from where we stayed. Go early and avoid the crowds, or reserve a spot; it gets busy in there! The ayce/aycd Shabu and drink deal is unbeatable. Excellent meats and broth & everything was very fresh. Sushi was great as well. Thanks Kufu-Ya!
author: Mike G.

description: This review is long over due. Seriously Kufuya is my favorite shabu place in SF. All you can eat for $26. Tips are included if you do order all your can eat. The staff is great and super friendly. Never need to ask for beef or veggies. Great service. Free parking available, first come first served. I crave it every week because the sauce is AMAZING!!
author: Sandy B.

description: Food was okay in terms of taste. Definitely get a bang for your buck in terms of quantity. The staff was really nice as well. I ordered a dinner bento box with a spicy tuna roll, California roll and salmon teriyaki. However, about 10 minutes after finishing my meal, I began experiencing stomach pain and nausea. Unfortunately, I ended up with a bout of food poisoning that lasted the whole night.
author: Rebecca L.

description:
I love this place! I noticed I am always greeted with a loud hellos and big smiles from everyone! How sweet. 

I only come here to eat shabu, and it's the best you can get for the price. It's so much cheaper than other shabu places and it's amazingly good. Maybe their awesome service adds more to it. 

I always get the spicy miso soup with beef and lamb, but I will to their tonkatsu broth next time. 

You need to go try if you haven't! You'll get hooked on like me, and will find yourself wanting to go every week or other week like me and perhaps gain some weight as well..BUT ITS STILL SO YUMMY!
author: Elaine C.

description:
Kufuya! What can I say? For the longest time I was obsessed with KBBQ until I was introduced to Kufuya's shabu and now I'm completely hooked!! Confession: I have eaten here almost 4 weekends straight on Saturday evenings. How embarrassing! So embarrassing that the staff here remembers me and my boyfriend. I guess it works out because they always give great service and are friendly and courteous. They are always smiling and are happy to see their repeat and regular customers. I like coming here on game days because they have multiple TV's where they show the games.

FOOD: On to the food...."straight fire" as the cool kids say or it was "hella lit"! Stick to the AYCE shabu shabu with spicy miso broth (not spicy at all and you can ask them to spice it up). They also have tonkotsu broth and chicken broth. For meat, they have either a choice of beef, lamb or both. They have nicely marbled and thinly sliced meat. The mushrooms are deletable as well because they have spinach, lettuce, two types of mushrooms and glass and udon noodles. Better yet, wait until you taste the dipping sauce!! I like to add diced garlic, onion and spring onions to it. Its savory with a kick to it! I'm currently salivating as I type this out just thinking about the sauce.

PRICE: $26.99/person for AYCE Shabu. The only CON is that they add gratuity automatically on your bill. Service is great so it ends up working out in the end.

PARKING: there is a small parking area on the back of the building however if you are blocking another car, you might be asked to move in the middle of your meal which could be very inconvenient. 

TIPS: Avoid peak times 7-9pm. Call ahead to make a reservation.

See you all there on the weekends :) I'll for sure be there!
author: Sandra P.

description: Some of the best sushi rolls we've ever had.  Sashimi that melted in our mouths.  And, the Shabu Shabu was fantastic, with a house sauce that is a perfect balance of savory and sweet. We found this little spot while on our way back from the VA med center and are so glad we did. Mostly locals, but with a very welcoming friendly neighborhood vibe.
author: Michael L.

description: Simple shabu place with a very extensive japanese menu. I came here with a few friends for the AYCE shabu and really liked it for the most part. We got the spicy miso soup base with plates and plates of mostly beef. Why not 5 stars? Because they did not have enoki mushrooms and I find the meat sliced too thin to the point that it was not even holding up. It would melt away in the broth and you would have to fish it back out. But other then that the pricing was good, and the sauce was good.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Less is more at this place.  AYCE Basic Shabu but everything tasted great together

The sauce is super good.  The meat is fresh.  The service is fast and friendly.  I hate flagging down servers for ayce.  These guys checked up on us the meat plates kept coming :). 

It's basic for $25 plus tip and tax but it was a good hearty simple meal.  I enjoyed it

I will be back!
author: Pin C.

description:
Got here during the evening and surprisingly it wasn't busy yet. My boyfriend and I were seated right away. This was our first AYCE shabu shabu experience, so we weren't sure what to expect.

We received out first round of rib eye and lamb. I filled the pot up with some vegetables in our tonkotsu based soup. As it started to boil we would only grab a piece or two of each meat so it wouldn't overcook. Just swish the meat in a few times and it'll be cooked. We were only given one sauce, so we weren't able to experiment with sauces sadly. I definitely enjoyed the rib eye steak, as for the lamb, I'm not a fan of lamb in general so I barely ate it. My boyfriend enjoyed the lamb more though! We ordered around 3 rounds until we were stuffed.
My boyfriend ordered the dragon roll I believe, and it was yummy!

During our meal it got super packed since it was dinner time then. There were so many workers while we were there, and now we know why they needed so many! The price seems average for an AYCE shabu shabu place. Very yummy place, and my boyfriend absolutely loved it there!
author: Maribeth M.

description: If I can give the the staffs a 10 star..it is still not enough! The foods is amazing and the dipping sauce is to die for. I have came here at least 10 times and every time is so good. The beef is so fresh and don't forget the uni shooters. (trust me) HAnds down the best Shabu please in SF!
author: Jess T.

description:
When your friend lives a few blocks away from you and decides to make reservations to a restaurant nearby the both of you and you've been eating healthy for the past few days and the thought of meat brings satisfaction to your taste buds, you take on his invitation and join him and his friends.  We came here on a Friday and it was a packed house but luckily we had reservations.  We got the AYCE and AYCD(rink) but I used the pregnancy card because I knew I wouldn't be able to enjoy my meal after a few drinks.  

The dipping sauce is on point.  Beef is amazing.  Tonkatsu broth was flavorful.  The spicy miso broth was bland; we had to add a few chili flakes to give it a kick.  I will admit, if you can handle your alcohol, the AYCD option is worth it.  

Service was great.  One server was enjoying herself a little way too much hopping from one table to the other taking shots and sipping on wine while shouting across the room.  She was reprimanded a few times but gave zero f*cks and continued drinking.  Good entertainment.
author: Linda N.

description:
Are we here for the Shabu or the sushi? You can do either or. We chose to do shabu since we haven't had it in a while. AYCE was $25 per person with an automatic 15% gratuity added to your bill at the end. You can order individual orders of the meats if you don't think you're up for AYCE, but AYCE is definitely a much better bargain. Individual meat plates range from $14-16 each depending on what you get. 

They don't have much of a selection here in comparison to hot pot...you can only choose between beef or lamb or both. You're served a bowl of veggies which come with tofu, udon/vermicelli noodles, spinach, etc - your typical stuff. They give you sides of garlic, green onions, some sort of chili, and I'm not sure what that other thing was. They serve you unlimited hot tea, water, and rice. One thing they don't have here is ponzu sauce, but the peanut sauce made up for it w/ the yummy spicy miso broth. 

We started off with a huge round plate of beef slices and a small plate of lamb. Finished that and were immediately served another round without being asked. They kept doing that for a while... but eventually asked if we wanted more. I'd say we had about 5 plates in total!

We didn't know there was a parking lot for the restaurant until we got there.. but you're probably better off parking on the street! 

Overall a good experience. Service was quick and friendly. My tummy was satisfied :)
author: Sydney C.

description:
Don't care to get into it. But waiter was so rude and the food was not very good. 
Will not go back.
author: Hardin K.

description:
This was my first time trying shabu shabu. We had the spicy miso as our soup base, which was ok.

The beef was pretty good. The servers were very attentive and gave us more beef, water, and tea whenever we ran out. 

Most people there came in big groups. Our group had around 10 people and we each paid $32 (including tax and tip).

Overall it was an ok experience. I think I just personally prefer hot pot over shabu shabu.
author: Julia C.

description: I love this place! I never knew the difference between hot pot and Shabu until I ate here. The staff is super friendly, willing to show you the ropes and the lamb is bomb.com.
author: Victoria B.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for Kufuya yet! Kufuya is my go-to shabu spot. 

One of the best things about Kufuya is that they accept reservations in advance. This definitely makes it a lot easier to plan things with friends in advance. They also have a small parking lot where you can park. However, when the lot is full, finding parking in the area is a bit tricky.

For all you can eat, it's $25 per person. Very reasonably priced for good quality meat (ribeye steak and lamb). They offer two kinds of broth which is the spicy miso or tonkotsu. I've had both of the broths and you can't go wrong with either one. Along with the meat and broth, you get veggies and noodles on the side as well. If you want to do the all you can drink, it's an extra $10 per person which includes beer, cold sake, or hot sake. I really enjoy their sake, so I find the all you can drink to be very much worth it. You have a 90-minute window for the all you can eat and drink.

Kufuya's service is on point. When the servers see you running low or running out of anything, they'll come check on you and will even take the initiative and bring you what you need without you asking for it. All of the servers are very friendly, but a big shout out to Lisa for always taking good care of us! 

I've been to Kufuya a million times at this point, and will continue to return for my shabu shabu cravings!
author: Erica L.

description: This place is just 1 block away from me so it was an easy choice for dinner. We didn't do shabu, only their regular menu. For a drink, I got the plum wine and for dinner I got the bento box with tempura, chicken teriyaki, and avocado maki. Everything was delicious and service was fast and friendly. The portions are pretty large and yet everything tasted so good that we ate all of it! #noregrets. I'd love to come back for the shabu deal since I've never done that before (and yo, unlimited sake for $10?! sign me up!).
author: Pooja C.

description:
Very homey and busy Shabu restaurant. With so many Shabu restaurants out there, I believe this may be the best bang for your buck, delish sauce, decent quality meat and veggies Shabu restaurant in the bay. They also have sushi and a la carte items, but I try not to order much of those unless I'm super craving. Don't want to get full and waste my ayce.

When saucing, please remember to use a good mix of the four garnishes they provide: grated daikon, green onion, garlic, and hot peppers. Sauce is tasty on its own, but you add that extra oomph with the add-ons.

Great for large parties. I highly recommend calling ahead for reservations. They are pretty accommodating. The people that run the place are super friendly and moves quick! Highly recommend. 

Btw, there's a mini parking lot on the side where you double stack the cars.
author: Tina S.

description: The best shabu spot in San Francisco. Don't @ me. Meat is beautifully cut, service is quick, and I always leave satisfied. Always. If you're concerned about parking, take a Lyft.
author: Susan O.

description: Great little place in the Outer Richmond. The all-you-can-eat is more affordable than any other shabu shabu place I've been to and was yummy and filling. Service was great and atmosphere was friendly. Four stars only because the broth was less flavourful than I like - easily fixed by adding some of the toppings (garlic, onions, soy sauce) to the broth. Everything else was great.
author: Madeline M.

description:
Great neighborhood Japanese restaurant.  The owners are super cool.  They've been around for 14 years and they continue to get better and better.

Love this place!!
author: Mike C.

description:
Our first night in San Francisco and it was pouring out -- We needed something to warm us up and Kufuya hit the spot!

The all you can eat hot pot was absolutely delicious. We didn't opt for the all you can drink option, but we sure will next time.

There was a huge birthday party going on when we arrived and they seemed to be having even more fun than we were! Definitely a great place for large groups.
author: Molli W.

description: This was a great experience. Not only was the food good but the service and seating were very pleasing. Parking was easy as they have their own parking. The fish was fresh and very tasty. We will be back.
author: Colleen S.

description: I just saw a flyer in the neighborhood saying this place has a rat infestation and leaves cabbage/vegetable out in the dirty parking lot...I didn't really believe it but after walking by the lot and seeing a mouse run across the vegetables laying out and flies swarming, I felt sick to my stomach for having ever eaten here
author: Mika E.

description: Worth every penny. AYCE Shabu Shabu with the most tender slices of beef and lamb. Fresh veggies, udon and glass noodles. Spicy miso Service is excellent. Very attentive. We rarely asked for anything.
author: Mindy B.

description:
2.5 stars. This restaurant is more of a Chinese hotpot place rather than a Japanese shabu shabu place. 

All you can eat lamb, beef, Napa, mushroom, spinach for $25. With three choices of soup base (spicy miso, chicken, tonkutsu). 

Pro - Good value for how much you get, especially if you are hunky guy who could eat twice as much as I can. 

Con- I didn't love the soup base. At the end, I had some soup, with all of the vegetables and meat steaming in the soup for hours, it should be very flavorful - but I was surprised that it wasn't the case. There was only this one very salty dipping sauce for the hotpot, whereas usually there are usually several options in other shabu shabu restaurants.  

From service perspective, they have you packed one table after another time-wise. They asked us to give up the table in 1.5 hours when we arrived since there was another table who was adding additional guests to their table right after us. There were a lot of young kids doing their college gathering or birthday celebration there. 

I would call this budget buffet hotpot in a hurry. If you want to go during the weekend, make sure that you reserve a table and come hungry.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
Overall, food (sushi and shabu) is decent (nothing special, but nothing horrid). 

My only complaint is that they include 15% tip automatically for people who chose shabu (regardless of party size) - at least they calculated the tip correctly (based on subtotal).
author: Christina L.

description:
This place was certainly worth the long trek from North Beach! I really enjoyed the quaint, mom-and-pop vibe of the establishment, which is clearly set from the first step inside.

Our large table of 8 opted for the bottomless shabu as well as the bottomless booze (sake and beer). There is a time limit for the "bottomless" specials, but at a 90-minute limit, our group felt like it was more than fair. 

The service was fun and quick.  We hardly waited for our drinks. The shabu was served up quickly as well. I sincerely enjoyed the dipping sauces and the spice accessories that accompanied the hot pot. Watch out for the little red peppers! Wowza. Our group had roughly 5 rounds of beef and veggies. The flavors were nothing short of delightful and it was fun cooking our own food to our textural liking. 

Our total was under $47 per person. That is not too shabby for bottomless food and drinks in SF!
author: Andrea H.

description: Japanese shabu shabu I really like this place because the workers there are very friendly making you feel welcome... their beef are average. It's all you can eat so you get for what you are paying for.
author: Nancy W.

description:
My first time coming here was yesterday. I called before coming to see how long the wait was, which was about 7PM. It took us forever to find parking! There parking lot was too small so we had to go find parking down the block. When we arrived, we only waited for about 10 minutes, it was already getting really packed so come a little earlier than 8PM. 

We did the AYCE, $25 per person. 
For the soup base, we got the spicy miso soup broth.
The options of meat were just beef & lamb. 
Their homemade sauce was definitely bomb!!
Cut up spicy red peppers & green onions were served as a complimentary for our broth.
There was also veggies, such as fresh spinach & cut up cabbage, two different kinds of noodles, udon & thin vermicelli noodles, mushrooms, and also soft tofu in a big bowl that was served to us. 

I love kufuya! Our servers were really friendly and nice. Every time we were done with our meat, 
it was replaced without asking. They would come 
around a lot to pick up empty dishes, replace meats,
and refill soup or water. 

The bill come out to be $60, which includes 15% gratitude tip. I really wanted to try their uni shooters 
but I'll wait until next time. 
This is seriously my new favorite go-to hotpot spot in San Francisco. I definitely recommend coming here and I'll surely be back soon! Other than that, the parking really sucks though.
author: Tracy N.

description:
I'm going through a few places that I often frequent but have yet to leave a review and Kufuya is one of them. First off, parking here can be a pain especially during busy times and diners often have to get up during their meals to move their cars due to the layout of their tiny parking lot. However, besides this minor setback to some... food wise, this place is pretty damn good!

Every time that I come here we always opt of the all you can eat shabu, so I can't judge their other dining options. As far as shabu goes, Kufuya has always been consistent and good. One of my main reasons for choosing Kufuya for shabu is due to their dipping sauce. It's basically a sauce base where you can customize with as much red peppers, garlic, daikon, and green onions as you like. Another great thing about Kufuya is their service which is usually pretty prompt. This is important because as a mainly AYCE shabu joint, refilling meats and vegetables is perhaps the most essential part of their customer service.

So, if you're looking for some great AYCE shabu option, Kufuya is the place to satisfy that craving!
author: Marco M.

description:
Very nice people here, excellent service. 
The food is not what it is in Japan, but it is interesting and tasty, nevertheless. 

Coming from rural Japan, it does seem pricey, but quality is there and care is taken.

For the area, I don't think that you will find a better option all around. Very intelligently put together and presented. If I liked shabu-shabu, it would be 5 stars.
author: George T.

description: Shabu shabu!! This is my favorite place for shabu in the city! Their all you can eat/all you can drink deal is literally unbelievable and you can eat yourself silly and they will keep things coming. My husband has an impressive eating capacity for a skinny man and they were able to feed him to his capacity... and some! Their spice is on point, their meat is delicious, their beer is great and the service is even better! Super friendly, a great atmosphere, all in all a HUGE rec!
author: Roya H.

description:
3.5 stars

$25 AYCE hot pot
$10 AYCD alcohol

RESTAURANT
Service is surprisingly good for AYCE. They are attentive and keep bringing out food. Service is better before 7:30pm though. After 7:30pm, it kind of becomes a party place with large groups doing both AYCE and AYCD alcohol.

FOOD
Limited options, but it's AYCE. Don't expect the flavor and quality of a non-AYCE place.
Meat options are beef and lamb. Both are fine. Not sure about quality.
Veggie bowl includes tofu, shiitake mushrooms, button mushrooms, napa cabbage, spinach, udon, and thin vermicelli noodles.
Sides include green onion, minced radish, minced garlic, and red chilis.
You can choose the broth flavor. We got spicy miso, but it just tasted like regular broth.
Wasn't a fan of the sauce. It's like a tart soy sauce that is kind of thin. I would have liked to have a peanut sauce or satay sauce option.

PARKING
Lot behind the restaurant. Double parking, so if you are trapped in, you go inside to tell the staff and they call out the car so the driver can move it. Can be annoying, but having available parking is so convenient that it's worth it.
author: Alice T.

description:
It's such a bittersweet feeling about this place. They probably have the best sauce in the hot pot game right now. My wife and I come here about 3 times a month.
There is a server named Eric who is the sweetest and the most attentive out of the whole staff.
Although this place is one of my favorite hot pot places to go to, I rated them a 3 star. 
If any of the owners take the time to read up on how the public views your restaurant, I really hope you see this and work on these issues. 
I believe this restaurant is family owned by a group of siblings. But there is one specific lady who is the most unprofessional business owner I have ever encountered. 
One of the sisters yells at the workers in front of customers, regardless if it's in Cantonese or not. Customers understand what is being said. But not only does she yell at the workers, she can have a pretty nasty attitude towards her customers. IMO as a business owner you would think they would take pride in customer service. I know that's such a high expectation, considering Asians have the worst customer service. And I say that with confident being that I am Asian. I truly hope the Kufuya owners see these type of reviews and access how to better run their business. I refuse to come to a restaurant as a paying customer, only to be treated with disrespect and attitude. The customers are what keeps your business running. So the least you can do is treat your customers with the respect and great customer service.
author: Ritchey B.

description: Dipping sauce is bit too salty. The meat quality is average. The only good thing is that the service is very quick and price is inexpensive ($25/person) comparing to other hot pot places in sf, which is $29-$33/person
author: Jenny W.

description: Kufuya is my go to AYCE shabu restaurant for dinner or special events. The owner Julie is the best. Seriously the sweetest person ever! I come here all the time whether it just be me and my family or me and 20 or more friends (yes 20+!!!) for birthdays/grad parties/fun nights out. Julie and the Kufuya staff never fails to accommodate us even when we have large parties. The service is phenomenal and food + drinks are awesome! My friends and I joke around and call Kufuya our Home because that's honestly that's exactly what it feels like!
author: Mimi N.

description: Tonkatsu broth has zero flavor.  Staff is exceptional rude and dismissive.  Otherwise it's fine.
author: Alex S.

description:
I been here one too many times.  The first couple times I compared to Shabu House. I love shabu house because of their sesame sauce but I always thought it was too expensive for the amount I could eat. Now that I actually know how to make that sauce, I don't crave for shabu house anymore.  

Kufuya is a great place for get-together with friends.  The waiters are pretty friendly; Their tables are usually filled so they do get busy and tend to forget what you ask them for. Like I'd ask them to refill our veggies and meat and water and they just bring the meat and veggies.

I love Kufuya now! I love their sauce and I always leave with a happy tummy!
author: Emi K.

description:
Wow really good
$25 ayce 
The beef and lamb were good
Even the veggies were excellent
Great quality
My fav hot pot in sf so far
Small tandem parking lot in the back
author: Jones T.

description: It's ok. The service is pretty good as far as refilling the meat and vegetables on our table. As far as taste, I'd rather go somewhere else however I do like that they accept reservations. The sauce was not spicy enough.
author: Sofia B.

description:
My Uncle and Aunt and my little cousin are regulars here and I can see why!
They treat you like family, and they are all so bubbly and friendly. 

It was my first time here visiting from Southern California, and my Aunt raved about the shabu here and basically said, "You will not find anything like this down south", and boy, was she right! 

The plates of meats, the udon noodles and the broth was so delicious. 

My Uncle showed me his technique to get the perfect bite of protein where we wrap up the sliced meat into a pocket and cook it medium rare to the point where the meat cooks and the fat melts into a butter fat pocket with the bite of meat. 

Simply delicious, and worth every bite.
author: Meesah T.

description: On a rainy Saturday night around 7PM there was no wait. We came just for sushi and they had a good selection. We ended up ordering a Rock n roll, Rooster, California, Spicy Lady, and a Dragon roll. For the two of us it was a perfect amount of food. I know it's weird, but I prefer cooked rolls over raw. The Spicy Lady roll was probably our favorite and even though it had...I think raw tuna on top I still enjoyed it. Special rolls were mainly 8 pieces and regular rolls were mainly 6 pieces. Overall, I've had better but this wasn't terrible. Prices are pretty reasonable and service wasn't too bad. I know many people come her for shabu though. I'd come back again if I wanted to...Maybe to try other stuff, but sushi was just decent since it wasn't anything mind blowing
author: Maggie W.

description: AYCE lamb and beef thin slices, udon, glass noodles and rice, Napa cabbage, spinach, white button and sliced black mushrooms, and cubed tofu.  No pork nor chicken.  Tonkatsu broth and spicy miso were flavorful, but the dipping sauce was already premade with sesame paste and ponzu.  All in all, not too bad for $25 per person and $8 for a short kid.  18% gratuity automatically added for 5 or more sucks but then, there"s a small parking lot in the rear - so that makes it better.
author: Kid N.

description:
THAT SAUCE!!!!!!!

I always leave here happy and full! Spicy miso broth is what I usually get (although it was lacking flavor on my last visit here), but the tonkotsu pork broth is delicious too! They also have a chicken broth which I never tried (and I don't think I ever will ahaha). The main star here is their dipping sauce! I can't even describe it, but it's FREAKIN' DELICIOUS! I always end up asking for a refill because it's that good. You can add garlic, daikon, chili peppers (they're strong for me!) and green onions to the sauce. 

Veggie bowl comes with napa cabbage, spinach, tofu, both udon & glass noodles and two different mushrooms (no enoki though!). Meat choices are beef or lamb... both are cut incredibly thin and cooked tender! 

They raised their price to $25 for AYCE, but I don't blame them. The price is still cheaper than a lot of their competitors, especially around the area. For AYCE, automatic 15% tip is included with the bill, and they usually always remind you about it. Service has always been friendly... they often refill your meat plate before you even ask, but when it gets super busy feel free to flag them down. There's a parking lot right next to the restaurant, so that can be realllly helpful in this neighborhood!
author: Kris C.

description: I really didn't like the shabu here. Yes, value-wise it's much cheaper than other places, but this is like eating a "denny's steak" in japan and calling it a steakhouse. They also give you a salad dressing instead of real shabu sauces. The quality is terrible. I highly recommend you go to a better shabu joint like Shabu house or Nabe if you're a true shabu fan. This place can only be considered if you want to eat large amounts of subpar meat.
author: Annie Z.

description:
Outstanding AYCE Shabu and service! I've tried a few different shabu places around the area and even San Mateo, but by far this has had the best quality and taste! You can tell that it's good quality meat. The dipping sauce is to-die for! Like others have said, you don't even have to ask for a refill most of the time, they bring it right out for you! 

Also, on a side note, a 15% service fee is added to every check, so keep that in mind!
author: John H.

description:
Food is still great and service is still awesome after all these years of coming time and time again! With the Warriors playing, it was pretty busy but it didn't stop the service from being just as courteous and swift as usual. 

Not sure if I mentioned before but you can do shabu or Japanese. There's alcohol for the drinkers and a tv for the sports fans.

Great spot for a solo dinner or dining with a group of friends! 

Thanks for another great visit!
author: Krystal T.

description:
First things first, the food was okay. I mean, can't beat $25 AYCE. There was only a limited variety of meat but our party mostly refilled the beef and lamb. There was also a bowl of veggies on the side consisting of tofu, cabbage, and vermicelli (forgot the other veggies heh). We also got the spicy miso as our soup base. I don't think it was flavorful enough for my liking, couldn't even taste the broth after cooking our meat/veggies in for a while. As for the dipping sauce, I didn't think it was that great either. Not quite sure what the hype is about the dipping sauce. I added everything including garlic, chili peppers, and green onions but the taste was just okay. In fact, It was a bit sour too...hmm..a very interesting dipping sauce..

As for service, they're fantastic! They come by so quickly to refill the plates even before we ask them. Super nice and refilled our water a few times rather quickly! There is sometimes a wait, so definitely make an appointment before coming especially if you have a larger group of people.
author: Eva C.

description:
The shabu is pretty good. It's not Japanese run if that matters to anyone. Instead, there are Chinese owners, which isn't a big deal to me. 

Pros:
-It's all you can eat where they give you an abundance of spinach, glass and udon noodles, button and shiitake mushrooms, and cabbage.

-Spicy miso broth is good, and they give you an extra big pot of that.

Cons:
-I don't get pork, but for those that look for that at shabu, they only have beef and lamb. 

-They seem to overbook their reservations leaving very little room, if any at all, for walk-ins.

-Servers neglect to check up on smaller parties because they're so busy accommodating extra large parties. Thus, it makes it hard to get refills and/or the check every time. It feels like I'm trying to hail a cab. On at least 2 occasions, I've had to just walk up to the counter to ask for the check. 

-They automatically deduct a 15% tip. This is usually the standard practice with large parties, but not for a party of 2. I always tip well, and find it hard to tip anything less than that even if service is poor. However, something about forcing it on a party of two while not consistently meeting all basic needs is off-putting.

I've been here several times, but over the years, less and less. The service and accommodations seem drastically biased toward wanting to retain large and extra large parties as customers. Maybe it's more profitable that way, but I prefer a business that will value all customers the same. They're not mean, but I notice the difference when it's just me +1 versus me in a party of 4 or watching the party of 10+ get all the service.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I love this place!! One of my fav places for ayce shabu for sure! 

Parking - not too bad....it's mostly street parking but they do have a mini private lot on the side. Downside to parking there is having to get up and move it if you're blocking somebody. 

Service - really good!! They're always really nice and on top of their stuff! Lemme tell you, the meat plate is never empty for long because they get you a new one right away or as soon as they can! 

Food - loveeee it! I always get the spicy miso broth with ayce beef and lamb. The cuts of the meat depend on the day and can be fatty but it still hits the spot on a cold evening. Not gonna lie but the broth does get oily real quick so you would have to skim it every now and then before it gets too oily...but for the ayce price, you can't beat that! You can tell that the veggie bowl with spinach, lettuce, mushrooms, glass noodles and udon are fresh as well! I love using the dipping sauce that they provide and you can also add ginger, green onion, grated radish and/or red chilis in it to your liking. I think it pairs really well with the meat. 

All in all, I def will be back :)
author: Coco L.

description:
This is one of my favorite Shabu/hot pot spots in the city! I love that their AYCE option is cheaper compared to most ($25 I think??). They charge an 18% gratuity/service charge already on your bill when you do AYCE. 

The meat quality is not bad too. I loveeeee that they serve those Thai chili peppers that you can either mix with your sauce or into your soup if your into spicy(; ASK FOR PONZU SAUCE AND IF YOU LIKE A LOT OF IT, ASK FOR A LOT. They tend to give you a little at a time? Not sure why? Is ponzu super expensive or what? LOL. I've had their lamb and their beef and the beef is great but the lamb is a little too gamey for my taste but I'm not much of a lamb fan though so maybe that's why. Their broth is not bad either. The service here is somewhat good! When they're super busy it can be slow but that's with all food establishments so understandable!(: the guy worker though is a little bit rude sometimes...overall, I really love this place and frequently dine here often with both family and friends. I wish though that in the future they'll serve enoki mushrooms cause that's my favorite veggie!

TIP: call in for reservation just in case, they take rsvp of all sizes I believe!
author: Kaman C.

description:
I tried the Dinner Box / Bento Box and thought the portions were on the small side especially for the price $16.00 I usually get this much from other Japanese restaurants for a more reasonable price or Lunch sized Bento box,  but the quality was pretty good and the service was not too bad for being so busy. This place does fill up fast, people were practically lining up to get a table, probably waiting for the all you can eat Shabu Shabu hot pot style dinner, because thats what most people were having

This appears to be a Chinese run / owned Japanese restaurant. I would recommend the All You Can Eat Shabu Shabu.
author: Mr Bolo B.

description: Excellent everything. Reasonable prices. A breath of fresh air in a town full of pretentious, overpriced eateries.
author: Delia M.

description: Great food, tried the tiger roll- shrimp was very sweet, and the all you can eat beef shabu with chicken broth. Food was good, didn't even have to wait in line. However, they do factor in a 15% tip on the bill which they didn't tell us about and the service wasn't even that great, but the food made it worth it !
author: Alison S.

description:
Bless my work family for wanting to take me to Shabu. T___T

They ended up taking me to Kufuya and I have to say... I was very pleased. I've driven by this place a lot whenever I go to Japantown and it just looks like a regular ol' sushi joint from the outside. Never did I imagine that the inside of this place would contain a hotpot galore. The inside of this place is pretty decent. A good amount of tables and I saw a lot of people just get the AYCE shabu for $23. 

Service is ridiculously fast! As soon as you finish a plate of something, the waiter is already there to switch the plates. Either their meat is gonna go bad in the next 20 seconds or they are just on top of it with that AYCE, hahaha. And the quality of the meat isn't really all that, but you do get what you pay for here. And after my friends ate 11 plates of meat, they definitely made it all worth the money. They're quick to refill water, too. Definitely a big plus in my book. 

For the AYCE, you can choose between 3 different soup bases - spicy miso, chicken, and tonkotsu which is pork flavor. And with the AYCE, you get a big plate of beef, a small plate of lamb, a bowl of veggies that includes lettuce, mushrooms, clear noodles, udon... It's awesome. 

Parking is a sort of a pain because they're located in a residential area in San Francisco where some spots aren't long enough for a car to fit, but you can definitely find parking if you try hard enough or just get lucky. They do have a small parking lot on the side, but it's one of those parking lots where you'll end up blocking a car and it can be a pain because they will call you to move your car if you end up blocking someone who needs to leave. 

Overall, would definitely definitely oh please let me come back here again! I want shabuuu!
author: Venus L.

description: Love this restaurant. Every time I went to San Francisco, I must go there. All the servers are so nice and friendly. Foods are so delicious! I like their shabu shabu in most. I also recommend all my friends who will visit SF to go there. Haha.
author: Allison T.

description: Anyone who gave Kufuya below 5 Stars should have their taste buds checked by a doctor. After trying every Hot Pot restaurant in SF, this is BY FAR superior. The sauce, the meat, the service, it's an INCREDIBLE dining experience that no other restaurant is SF can match at their price point. I wish I could give this place 8.5/5 stars. DELICIOUS.
author: Ted B.

description:
HANDS DOWN one of the best shabu restaurants in San Francisco. Not only do they offer AYCE, they also offer sushi, bento boxes, ramen, and other japanese dishes to go along with your hot pot!

Service here is superb. Literally every time they came to pick up our empty plate, they dropped off another plate full of meat. now THAT'S getting your money's worth!

They are very accommodating and the waiters/waitresses here are extremely friendly. 

At ~$32/person after tax and tip, this place is definitely worth it.

Will be back soon.
author: Johnny G.

description:
LOVE Kufuya, as a matter of fact I'll be going again tomorrow!  Their staff is always friendly, come here often enough and you'll feel like family! Almost every birthday or get together we have is at Kufuya, AYCE shabu of course (there's also the option for all you can drink beer and sake)! Don't feel like having shabu? They have a sushi menu too which is just as good!

Really though, get the shabu!
author: K Y.

description:
Came for the AYCE hot pot ($25.99) and between the four of us, we went through 18 plates of meat. Yes the stomach pains were real afterwards...

Came on a Friday night and there was no wait! You can only choose one hot pot base and we went with spicy miso. I'm so used to having bad service for AYCE places but man the service here was top notch! Each time our meat plates were empty they'd come back with another one and we only had to ask for things once and it'd be brought out really quickly! Definitely helped us get our money's worth haha.

The first few plates were soooooooo good. The meat quality here is so good, although you can only get lamb and beef. The dipping sauce and soup were also really good. They don't give you much of a selection of sides - tofu, mushrooms, udon noodles, clear noodles, spinach, and cabbage but hey, that's all you need right?

The only thing is the soup gets really gross after a couple plates of meat and I don't think you're allowed to get new soup (we asked and they said it's an additional $5) so towards the end it just tasted like meat and water and lots of oil. But that's what the dipping sauce is for!

They add an automatic 15% tip for AYCE orders, which I think is fair and their service was probably at least 15% worthy. The total for each of us was $31.65, not too bad for AYCE in SF! 

I'll probably need some time to recover before my next AYCE meal but I'll definitely be back!
author: Jingxi Z.

description: This restaurant is okay for me. The meats and vegetables of all you can eat are good, but it too limited, only beef and lamb. The sauce is too sour, and soup is too simple, and the price is too expensive.
author: Lan H.

description:
I think people come here for one thing: all-you-can-eat hotspot. Heck, you can even add all-you-can-drink beer on top of that.

My friend and I came here a few months ago to try exactly that. Meat quality isn't premium but acceptable. Sauces tastes a bit off, not my favorite. Services are ok and they do bring additional meat out quickly. Nothing jumped out as particularly delicious or noteworthy though.

Overall verdict: come here if you are really hungry and want to eat lots of meat. It's a decent deal overall and will fulfill that objective.
author: Joseph L.

description: Giving them a 4 star cus i already gave the one in san jose a 5 star an the one in union city a 3 star cus their rice was super not cook.
author: Billy S.

description:
This is a Chinese owned Japanese shabu place in the city.  It is an all you can eat place (AYCE), and I enjoyed it.  You don't find many AYCE shabu places around nowadays even in Los Angeles. I think it was about $20-25 per person to eat there which realistically I think is inexpensive especially if we have hearty appetites.

Yes, they have all the varieties here such as the beef, lamb, vegetables including cabbage, spinach, tofu, mushrooms, Udon noodles and clear noodles.

The meats are very thinly sliced and it's served on a large plate.  The veggies are fresh and also served similarly.  The broth is fine and it's hot enough to quickly cook the food. There are two dipping sauces to use for the meats. I can't recall what the sauce is, but it was kind of sweet.  I liked the taste of it but it's not really necessary to use it. 

The service is great.  The waiter/waitress was attentive and kept checking on our needs.  

For some reason, this AYCE shabu place was not that crowded.  I would think it will be packed since it's AYCE and it was during dinner time. Anyhow, no big deal for us because what counts the most is the food quality.

The restaurant is small, and parking is a bit hard to find.  There is a parking lot in the back for customers, but the spaces are limited and cars had to park behind other ones to accommodate.
author: ED L.

description:
They are overpriced 
And their fish was dry
Their spider barely had crab. 
They charged extra for rice
author: Nina S.

description: After a long day of not eating, my friends and I came here for their AYCE shabu shabu. It was worth the $25. The place is a little tight but it's okay, it's really more about the food. The only reason I didn't give this place a 5 Star is because the water containers looks like it can use some cleaning. You can see mold growing near the top. Other than that this place is great for a group lunch. We had a group of 7 people and they were able to seat us quickly when we came in. But I think it's best to reserve a table before walking in since they did seem to be really busy after we sat down.
author: Rayne V.

description:
We were deciding which place to go for AYCE Shabu.  So this place seems to be the best bang for the buck.  First impressions arriving was that it look like a sushi joint.  It wasn't that busy at all until later.  

We end up doing the AYCE and had the spicy miso soup as the broth.  We got a big dish of sliced beef and a small dish of lamb and a large bowl of vegetables with udon and noodles.

The meat was alright, I've had better, but like they say, "You get what you pay for,"  so nothing i can complain.  The lamb was alright as well.  The meat was alright because there wasn't much marble, but it was tender if you cook it medium rare.  Well done, and it will be rough.  The vegetables were alright pretty standard

Overall, its good for AYCE, but the quality isn't superb.  Good to get full.  Other than that the service was excellent.  They got us a new plate after we finished and i was impressed with the service here.  The staff is good and one thing they do here is they'll add the gratuity to the bill if you do AYCE.

Cash or credit.

parking only street.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: Okay - hands down the best shabu sauce I've had. My friends and I are regulars and constantly crave their sauce! The owners are so friendly and really make our experience extra special. Convenient free parking lot as well!
author: Kim M.

description:
Located in outer Richmond, this place is sort of a hidden gem. It's located right on the corner and easy to spot but from the outside looking in, you would never think that this is a delicious hot pot restaurant. They do have the option of AYCE for $23, which is slightly cheaper than Shabu House. The meat is fresh and the servers are quick to bring out more meat once you've finished a plate. Unlike many other places where you would have to flag the waiter down, these waiters have a quick eye. The beef slices come out on a large plate, but if you order lamb, it comes out on a much much smaller plate. They give you a giant bowl filled with veggies and noodles as well. We ordered the spicy miso soup, though I wish we could've tried the pork soup instead. The broth was mediocre, nothing to brag about though it's the most popular choice. 

Overall, we got our money's worth of food and will be back for more!
author: Ava F.

description:
Love it here! Good service, and a ton of food.

I went with a pretty large party (7 of us) so I called in advance. I would recommend making a reservation because they are always crowded. 

My friends and I all got the all you can eat deal ($25). Some of my other friends got the all you can drink deal as well ( I think it's $10-20, I can't remember). It's totally worth it! The meats included beef and lamb, as well as a ton of vegetables (mushrooms, tofu, spinach) and udon noodles. Even though it's a lot of food, the broth is clean so you don't leave feeling gross. There are various types of broth, we got the miso and the spicy one. Both are really good!

Can't wait to go again!
author: Jenna N.

description:
I would give the food five stars.The Kobe beef and lamb was great as well as the other meats. 

The disappointment was that the cabbage that they gave us was so bitter and when we asked for another plate of vegetable it never came. 

I understand they were short on staff (one waiter had told a table next to us) but it was so rude of the waiters to forget to bring our food. If it was one or two times I would be ok but they constantly forgot to bring us our order. It took them 20 minutes to bring us one plate of meat (which we had to ask all three waiters on duty twice) the waiters continently forgot about what we had ask them for and they constantly ignore us when we tried getting their attention. Was very bad service overall
author: Kelly C.

description:
AYCE for under $30? Yes, please! I believe their base price starts at $22 or $23, while all other shabu places get you at $29.95+. Kufuya is great whether you come in a small or large group, but if you come on the weekends be assure that there will be a wait. 

Their spicy miso broth is good (not spicy enough in my opinion), but Shabu House's definitely wins over Kufuya. After a while, the Kufuya broth loses its flavor. This place doesn't do split pots, just one big pot so you can only choose one broth. If you have a large enough party, they'll give you more pots. The selection of veggies is the usual with cabbage, enoki, etc. The qualify of beef is good, but the lamb is a bit weird. It's thinly sliced and looks great, but the texture is grainy versus smooth. As for their sushi, it's nothing spectacular but it's good. The rolls are huge--not as in they give you a lot of pieces, but a single piece of sushi is quite big. Still tasty though.

Anyways, service is really attentive for such a busy place. They refill meats fairly quickly when you do AYCE and actually, they refill everything in a timely manner so you're not stuck waiting around your pot for food.
