This place is great for AYCE, but if you're just looking for a regular shabu dinner, go to Shabu House instead. Kufuya is definitely more for larger parties having a party or celebration of some sort so it does get pretty loud in here, especially if there's drinking too.
author: Doris K.

description: Last night was our first visit to Kufuya, and it was a real disappointment: both for the food and service. This is a small restaurant, drab with not much ambience. I gather people come mostly for sushi or shabu shabu and we had neither.  We started with a mixed tempura appetizer which was just OK. 1 shrimp, 1 broccoli, 2 slices of sweet potato, and 1 of potato. The waiter must have misunderstood us because instead of a seaweed salad, he brought a western style salad of lettuce and tomato, also just OK. We each had udon bowls, mine was mixed seafood and my friend's was eel. With both the broth was tasteless and only slightly improved with soy sauce and nanami togarashi. Bowls were medium sized and inexpensive - $12 and $15. Mine had a lot of seafood, but not much flavor. The grilled eel was nice. Things were delivered from the kitchen as they were ready, which was OK for us. The people working there were nice, but not particularly efficient. I let them know we needed to leave at a certain time. When we couldn't waive them down for our bill, I went up to the counter to pay it.
author: Donald O.

description:
My favorite place for shabu shabu by far. At kufuya, they offer the best deal- $25 AYCE. Can't beat that! They offer three different broths- chicken, spicy miso, and pork. I always go for the spicy miso since I like a little spice in my life hehe. The deal also comes with a bowl of veggies that includes cabbage, spinach, two different types of mushrooms, udon noodles, and glass noodles. Yum. 

What I must highlight is the amazingly attentive service here. I don't know why but whenever I come here, I feel like family. They refill your tea, delicious dipping sauce, and plates of meat without you ever having to ask them. It's truly wonderful.. If only it was like this at other restaurants. I will definitely continue coming back here. Keep it up, Kufuya!
author: Marny N.

description:
Kufuya was always one of my favorite shabu spots. The food along with the sauce is delicious, but service also plays a huge role in the restaurant industry.

Came here with party of 3 and they seat us right away. Throughout the WHOLE meal though not ONCE did they come to our table, we had to flag them down every single time.
- No water refills after asking 4 times
- Messed up our vegetables 2 times
- Forgot our meat
- Forgot our sauces

Being a server myself I'm typically extremely understanding... Especially if it's busy, BUT they were just drinking with friends/maybe customers when tables needed to be serviced... I even ask for everything at once so they don't have to constantly come back... When we recieved our bill one of the servers(tall man with glasses) was nice enough to apologize because it was busy, but we've been neglected for so long that at that point it didn't matter anymore. Needless to say, we did not tip the 15% that is already added to the bill. I don't usually have bad service here, this being the first time, but 1 time is all it takes.
author: Amy W.

description:
One of my FAVORITE AYCE shabu places in the Bay! And it's only $23 per person! 

Everything about this place is on point. The MEAT is fresh and their lamb doesn't even have that "lamb-y" smell! AYCE comes with the assortment of vegetables that include my favorite tofu, mushrooms, and UDONNNN !! 

Their service is super friendly and always ready to fill up your next platter of meat the moment you're done! 

I'm definitely a sauce girl when it comes to shabu, and I appreciate their finely chopped green onions and minced garlic. Not to mention the spicy flavaaa' from the chili peppers too!

Parking is a bit more convenient because they have limited-spaces right behind the restaurant, on the side of the corner. It's not such an issue though because there's street parking everywhere, but it is San Francisco ... so prepare to hunt around.

I don't even live in San Francisco, but I'll be coming back to this place whenever I crave hotpot :) !
author: Jackie H.

description: Had two Udon soups and both weren't super tasty. We had to pour peppers and soy sauce in them to have it taste something. Would go back to try the all you can eat option.
author: Nicolas B.

description:
Someone please explain to me why a shabu place charges a service fee?! We're cooking our own food. Sure you're bringing it to us but isn't that your job? Why add a service fee on top of tax, and also ask for tip? (note: it was a two person dinner not a table of six or anything) 

The food was good. Service was horrible. It wasn't even busy, the waiters were just not paying attention. That's probably why I was even more upset- because I was forced to pay a service fee for bad service. It's probably the most affordable shabu restaurant, yes. But I'd rather pay a couple more dollars for better service.
author: Dara S.

description: Been coming here for the Shabu for years now. Extremely generous with their portions and will not cheap out on you when ordering AYCE. I'm from LA but I constantly think of this place! A must try!
author: Bryant T.

description:
Come for the AYCE and stay for the rolls?

Apparently, this place is know for its AYCE shabu, which I cannot speak to as my wife and I decided to try the rolls instead. After ordering we noticed that everyone else was ordering the shabu and began to wonder if we made a mistake. Absolutely not.

We ordered the volcano, tiger, and red dragon roll along with maguro nagiri and an order of goyza. All of which was fantastic. The fish was very fresh and the rolls were expertly prepared.

The restaurant was clean and the service very good and the staff fantastic and attentive. Keep in mind that this is more of a family restaurant, so it would not be considered quiet or intimate. However, even on a busy Saturday night, the noise level was fine and much less than what you find at many trending hot spots.

We will definitely return although I will be hard pressed to chose between the AYCE and the other menu items. (Based on our experience and the other reviews, I do not think either is a better choice.) Probably will try the AYCE and take some rolls to go for that midnight munchie madness.
author: Bruce L.

description:
Called several times trying to make a reservation but they never picked up the phone. I guess they're just that busy. 

I walked in there and there were no parties waiting  before me. The server looks right pass me and seats the two parties that walk in after me. When I attempt to tell her that I arrived first, she tells me that the other two parties have a reservation. But how would she know that if she hasn't even spoken to them? 

She then hands me a menu and tells me I have to wait, doesn't say how long though. When another table finally opens up, the same server was hesitant to seat my party. She just waves us off to the table and comes back 10 minutes later to give us the rest of the menus. When we tell her immediately that we're ready to order she disappears for another 10 minutes before coming back to take our order. 

We all wanted to do the ayce shabu and she took about another 10-15 minutes to bring out the meat and veggies. And another 10 minutes after that for the soup pot. Service was extremely slow. I understand they only have 2-3 servers working but I've been here a few times before and had better service. The servers are also very forgetful. I had to ask several times for the same item multiple times. 
1/5 stars for service. 

Moving on to the food, we got the spicy miso broth. It wasn't too spicy, some of us who didn't like spicy really enjoyed it. They also give you dipping sauces with plenty of garlic, green onions,  red peppers, and daikon for you to add together to suit your liking. They don't have much variety for ayce but the quality of the meats are pretty good. They give you about 2-3 plates of meat at a time and a bowl of veggies with udon and glass noodles. They refill your new plates of meat on request, which took a while for us. 
4/5 stars for food. 

Ayce shabu is $25 per person which is pretty decent for shabu. They also have a 18% service charge added onto the bill which I really wouldn't mind if they actually had good service. Probably wouldn't be back. There are other shabu and hot pot places in SF with much better service. 
2.5 stars overall
author: Lushi Z.

description:
The Shabu meats were A+PLUS. We did the $25 all-you-can-eat (auto gratuity added) and stuffed our faces off. The meats included beef and lamb with udon/glass noodles, spinach, mushrooms, tofu and sides of garlic, chili peppers, green onions, peanut sauce. I've also had the ramen and it's quite tasty.

Parking can be hard to find. There's a small parking lot on 34th if you can find a spot, though since it's double parking, you may have to get up in the middle of your meal to move your car, but NBD for close parking.
author: Kim L.

description:
0o0o0ooooooo I LOVE THIS PLACEEEE!!! Although I don't to AYCE shabu a lot (so expensive, and I only really need one plate to get full), if I were to ever do it again, I would do it here!!! The price is niceeeee ($22), the service is awesome, and the food is delicious!!

I came in with 4 of my girl friends hoping that they would let 3 of us do ayce shabu while 2 of them would order off their normal menu even though we were sitting at the same table. Our waiter Simon let us know that it would be fine, so we were happy about that because we know at a lot of shabu places, the whole table has to get ayce. 

Our dipping sauces and its toppings came out first. Right off the bat, you'll notice that it's not the typical goma and ponzu sauce, but it's some miso based dipping sauce that is DELICIOUSSS (I even had to ask for a second bowl after I finished the first). We were wondering if they had ponzu and the waiter overheard us, and he even asked us if we wanted some (good customer service!!!!). He brought us three bowls but we still decided we liked their housemade dipping sauce better. The toppings they give you for the sauce are garlic, daikon, peppers, and green onion!  After a little bit, our veggies came out. The veggie bowl comes with udon and glass noodles, napa cabbage, spinach, tofu, button mushrooms, and shitake mushrooms. My friends and I were wondering why they didn't bring out the pot and soup first to let it boil, but I think they heat it up back in the kitchen first so it's hot and boiling already when you get your meats (pretty convenient for people who don't like to wait... kind of). We ordered spicy miso and it wasn't that spicy, but honestly I wasn't really focusing on the broth because that dipping sauce was just... amazing. Our meat finally came out and us three started to dig in!! We only got the beef (we don't really like lamb haha) and it was so tender!! The meat quality here is really good, and the servers are super quick when refilling them. Most times, we didn't even have to ask and a server took the empty meat plate and brought out a full one. Also when you refill on veggies, you can let them know which veggies/noodles to leave out and which to bring so you don't waste any! They're super accommodating. At the end of the meal, we were all super stuffed (pretty sure us 3 had 5 plates of meat I think??? Impressive.... I know hahahaha).

OH and just an fyi, try to park in the front spots of the parking lot, so you don't have to move your car during your meal!! My friend warned me because if you park in a back space and you're blocking off someone's car that's trying to leave, you're going to have to get up (no matter what stage of the meal you're in), and move your car so they can get out. Just a tip! :)

OH OH and another thing. They automatically add a shabu tip of 15%..... Have no clue why.. Kind of weird lol
author: Tara A.

description:
ok so I have been going to Kufuya for several years now.   I thought I had written a review for them years ago.  When looking at my old reviews I noticed to my horror that I never gave a review for Kufuya.  Lisa and Julie will be so mad at me for that one.  But much like another reviewer whose review I read earlier, what makes a great restaurant? it starts with the people working there.  Julie, Lisa, Eddie and the rest of the crew are the reason why I keep going back. always smiling,energetic listening to my witty comments and then dishing it rite back at me.  And they seriously get the whole restaurant involved. complete strangers at the other end of the restaurant will be joining in on all the fun throughout the meal.

The food is always amazing.  The broth for the shabu is amazing.  Endless trays of meat and veggies.  And if you are craving sushi instead they got you covered there as well.  Bottom line is shabu places in SF on Geary street are not hard to find anymore.  But try one of those places and then come eat at Kufuya and tell me which experience is better. I only write 5 star reviews but I only write them for places I think earned being considered as one of the best.  Kufuya has never disappointed.
author: eric t.

description:
I definitely enjoy the shabu here and the service is great.  All you can eat shabu is the only way to go if you come here for that.  It's $23 and includes all of the usual fixin's: glass noodles, napa cabbage, udon, mushrooms, tofu, and of course your choice of meat.  The non AYCE option is more expensive so don't do that: $13/plate meat + $11 plate of veggies.  The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because they only have 1 dipping sauce that tastes a little like a mix between the ponzu and goma.

If everyone at your table is doing shabu, everyone has to get AYCE.  Otherwise, some people can order regular Japanese food from the menu and others can do shabu.

They have a small parking lot behind the restaurant around the corner but I generally don't like to park there.  You have to park tandem style where you're either blocking someone in or you're getting blocked in.  So you'll have to be prepared to interrupt your meal to move your car.  Best to find street parking if you can.
author: Alice L.

description:
I swear. Every time I come here, there would be a group of adult asian fobs talking loud, here and there with some curse words. This time, owner were taking shots with them. Yeah.... Wish I got some service here. 

$23 all you can eat plus 15% tip added.
author: Jasmin T.

description:
I've been coming here for years and I'm surprised that I haven't even wrote a review yet.

It's $25 a person for AYCE shabu. They offer only beef and lamb and your typical veggie bowl. The beef quality stays consistent and the veggies are always fresh! The servers never lag on bringing you new meat or more veggies. And that sauce tho. Its so good and they give you chili peppers, garlic, and daikon to add to your sauce. Be careful of that chili pepper because it's actually really spicy. You do not want to accidentally swallow a pepper like how I have done so many times. It hurts lol. The only con about the food would be the soup base cause the spicy miso is pretty bland. 

The servers are always super nice and I love how this place is run by a family. It's such a comfortable and inviting atmosphere, makes me feel welcomed every time I come. There is a 18% gratuity and the servers DO deserve it for how hardworking and friendly they are. If you're going to complain about it, then you're just a cheap tipper. Servers work hard and DEPEND on tips. So like I always say, if you don't have money to tip, stay your ass home! Go to McDonalds or something. 

Anyways, this place is bomb and you can never go wrong with Kufuya.
author: Brenda K.

description:
After the Chipotle Cultivate Festival in GG Park, I had a hankering for some shabu. We came upon Kufuya, which has shabu and sushi. We did the all you can eat with the all you can drink. We had to keep asking for more sake. They only gave us one big bottle of Sapporo. We ended up asking for more beer, but they only gave us one small bottle of Sapporo. Plus, they added a "shabu tip" to the bill. My friend took over the bill so I never saw it and he didn't even bother looking it at, which I wish he did or at least let me see it. For the both of us, we paid $41 each. This didn't make sense to me because the all you can eat/drink shabu was around $30.

No thanks, Kufuya. I'll go elsewhere for my shabu fix.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Horrible service and horrible prices.
If you're getting the shabu shabu that is NOT an all you can eat plate then don't even bother going here. 
- you can only order an all you can eat plate if your whole table orders it for $25 a person (which is difficult with a party of six) 
- if you want a single plate of shabu shabu you have to order beef and vegetables separately which cost around $27. On top of that they won't refill the broth for you if you do. 
- single serving shabu doesn't include rice or salad. 
- tonkatsu broth tastes bland and really needs salt. 
- On top of that the waitress didn't refill the water and seemed irritated that we even asked. 
-Spent $200 and all we got was mediocre food and rude service. 
Shabu House on Ocean ave is way better and I would recommend it over this place.
author: Jade C.

description:
amazing shabu, and the rest of the food is great too!  

happened in here without any expectations and was pleasantly surprised - energetic, happy service, plenty of delicious food, speedy service - highly recommended!

reservations are helpful on a busy weekend night.
author: Elizabeth C.

description:
First off, the all-you-can-eat shabu shabu is a fair value. You get two choices of meat - beef (rib eye) and pork. We had the beef, so can't comment on the pork. The beef was pretty good quality, a good balance of meat and marbling. The servings per plate were pretty generous, but you'll get more slices each time around at other restaurants. Getting more was easy and quick, requiring only that we put our empty plate in the edge of our table, with waitstaff replacing it within a minute or two. There were some nice veggie accompaniments, too - tofu, mushrooms (both shiitake and button), spinach, Chinese cabbage, udon and glass noodles. All were pretty good, standard for shabu shabu.

Now the kicker for us - this didn't really seem to be Japanese shabu shabu. This was more a Chinese style hot pot. First off there's no choice of a regular dashi stock, only chicken stock, spicy miso broth or tonkotsu broth. To me, that's super weird. Secondly, the sauces. There was no ponzu sauce, only a salad dressing-like sesame sauce that seemed way heavier than you would usually want/find at other restaurants. The sauce accompaniments were good - sliced chilis, green onions, minced garlic. But only one sauce was disappointing.

Overall it's a good value, although not at revolutionary one.
author: Chris C.

description:
I'll choose this over Shabu House any day! Perfect sauce with garlic, chili, onions and radish. 

Their green tea ice cream is delicious too.
author: A W.

description:
Came here for all you can eat! So it's 23 a person and you get to choose what soup you want and they offer beef lamb veggies and noodles. The menu isn't too big for it but it's still pretty good and filling :) the dipping sauce they give you is fantastic ! There's a base for the sauce and then after you can add onions Garlic chilies and daikon, which they give you in seperate bowls so each person gets to mix it to their liking. 

If you don't want all you can eat they have another side of the menu where you can order sushi and other rice platters or noodle dishes ! 

There's variety but I usually just come for the all you can eat !
author: Vanessa L.

description:
I can't believe I haven't tried this place until this past weekend, but I will never go to another shabu place again. This is it.

The broth, dipping sauce, meat, veggies, and noodles were really fresh and delicious. I thought the sliced shitake mushrooms were a nice touch as most places do not give you that. The garnishes to add to your sauce for your dipping pleasure were fantastic. The sliced, hot chilis and grated daikon were also nice touches that most other places do not give you.

The service was fantastic. They are really friendly and attentive. They regularly came by to check on us, and refilled our meat, veggies, sauces, etc. without being asked!

Lastly, the price for all you can eat is phenomenal. Such a good value for great quality. Love love love.
author: Jessie L.

description:
If you've had Kufuya before you know it's a different environment than your typical "Shabu" ITS BETTER!!!
Everyone here that complains about slow service yall need to chill out because I've never had such great workers constantly bringing meat to my table once its done. Tell me shabu house/way/club has ever done that.. 23$ AYCE no one can compare. And the best part about kufuya is how they remember their customers and love taking shots! 

Shabu house recently started adding service fees so I dont understand why people are acting so appalled. 18% is nothing when you're experiencing nothing but good food & comfort! 

Kufuya has been getting so crowded lately I highly recommend making a reservation before coming! Also double check the day of too to avoid any mishaps. This is my forever shabu home as long as I live here. X3
author: Melissa C.

description:
I've really had a better experience. And although I am fairly new to shabu, I could tell that this place wasn't trying hard enough. Overall I would recommend Shabu House as the main place to get shabu, don't get me wrong Kufuya had decent shabu, this review is mostly based on work practices. 

I had made reservations but their was possibly a 10 minute wait that I really didn't mind. Ordered...got The food...you Know the deal. Anyway, it wasn't till I received the bill...you See it wasn't itemized, which means you really don't know what you are paying for, it just a total. And although the amount sounded fairly correct, I could have easily paid for the table beside me, this is not the first review regarding this business practice; lets hope its the last.
author: Abraham A.

description:
At $22, this is quite possibly the cheapest all you can eat shabu shabu around. (Shabu House is $31). I came here with my cousin from Switzerland and one of my boys for dinner. 

I doubt that they have the all you can eat drink option here like the other Shabu places. I'm just saying because there wasn't any of that that loud, frat house, ruckus going on. Or actually, WE weren't that loud, frat house, ruckus going on. It was actually normal inside with alot of couples! 

What I liked about Kufuya was their menu. Besides having Shabu, they had a full Japanese spread - sashimi and sushi (didn't try), teriyaki plates (for the folks visiting from Wisconsin), and even ramen (only served during week day lunch). I did try some chicken karaage which was doable and their grilled squid which was tender and tasty. 

* After reading a couple other reviews below, I must say yes -
- Service can be up and down, but the place was busy and the waitress/hostess/water refiller/busboy acknowledged they were busy and and apologized. Cut slack! 
- Yes, it is kinda chilly inside. (surprised it was a guy who complained - man up or put a scarf over your blouse)
- Yes, inside it's mostly Chinese customers, with Chinese folks serving Japanese food. I find it ironic because aren't these two ethnicities suppose to hate each other? 

Anyways, the food's good with a different experience from your typical Shabu joint. They even had a tv with the Warrior game on. Overall, my cousin had fun. Closest thing to shabu they have in Switzerland is fondue. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/XqusjspR2LGsm33BBBJkmQ?select=4ZoZsXmS2jodG91YSOwqGw)
author: Earl G.

description:
Been here a few times, but yesterday will probably be my last time going here. The only thing that really stands out to me is the dipping sauce, but even then, yesterday it was very vinegary. I like that there's chili peppers, daikon, onions and garlic that you can add to your sauce. The service was medicore. They refill your meat when they see its finished, but they dont seem to ask to refill anything else.  Before you can finish asking what else you want, they're walking away, rushing to only get one item for you. 

They also got a lot more stingy, as I asked for both the lamb and the beef, but they only gave us one at a time, but before they gave us both at once. The man took away our beef when we asked for the lamb too, and vice versa, never both. They raised their prices of shabu to 25, it used to be 22, and now they even include 15% tip (including tip on your tax too , which is clearly not right). I would be more inclined to tip more if they didnt force it. I dont like the idea of not having your own option of tipping based on the service that we think we received..   Overall, it isnt worth it, I rather take my shabu craving elsewhere.
author: Cindy D.

description: Good price, good food, great service, great attitude, what more can you ask for? Haha
author: Mary K.

description:
While everyone is hogging up the gym and eating less as part of their new year's resolutions (that they'll only break might I add...), I'm doing all you can eat dinners...

Two friends and I came on a Monday night.  We arrived a bit after 6pm when there were only one or two parties there.  Keep in mind that this place does get busy as the night goes on.

ALL YOU CAN EAT: $22/person
*Broth: Choice of spicy miso or chicken
*Meat: Beef and lamb
*Veggies: Mushrooms, spinach, lettuce
*Noodles: Udon and vermicelli

We ordered the spicy miso soup broth.  Although it was flavorful and had the miso taste, it lacked any kind of spiciness.  Their meats were sliced thinly but were on the fattier side.  I personally prefer leaner cuts of meat.  Whichever types of meat you decide to order, make sure you toss in garlic, green onions, and a pinch of peppers into your sesame sauce.  It's delicious.

There's also has a sushi menu available as well.

SERVICE:
A bit spotty.  There were two waitresses who seemed like they didn't have a designated area so they were a bit all over the place.  At times, we had to sit there waiting for an additional tray of meat to get to our table.  It seems Chinese owned, not Japanese, so expect similar service as you would at a Chinese restaurant.

PARKING:
A private lot is located behind Kufuya on 34th Avenue which fits about 10 cars or so by parking one car behind each other in pairs.  If you park her, try to park behind your friend so you're not left walking asking who drives the ____ car.  Metered and non metered street parking is available but usually difficult to find.
author: Nicole S.

description:
I came here this past winter break for a big all-you-can-eat shabu feast with about 15-20 or so people. I really liked their service here! They kept bringing out many plates of meat because the majority of people in my party were guys. Good quality beef, lamb, vegetables, noodles, and tofu but this doesn't beat other all-you-can-eat places like hot pot garden or some in the south bay because there are more expanded options and their menu here is more limited. I remember liking their dipping sauce a LOT, and they have some green onions and peppers to dump in for your liking. REALLY good spicy miso broth.. mm. You also had to ask for rice separately, but it still comes with the all-you-can-eat price. 

Parking is pretty easy to find because there's lots of residential options. No meters hooray!

I wouldn't mind coming back here again to try other kinds of dishes here besides the shabu. But it's perfect for a cold SF day and if you're in the area.
author: Kathleen S.

description: My favorite Shabu spot period. My wife and I have been coming here before your fish daughter was born and still love. It home away from home!
author: Steven N.

description:
Came here for a surprise birthday party! The reservation was for a group of 15...but more people actually showed up. Whoops. The waitresses were friendly about adding more people! They added more chairs and another table for us. 

Everyone got AYCE! Unfortunately they don't have the "half" pots so you can't get two types of broth at once. This was kind of a problem for those who did not want the spicy broth. The waitress (I think she's the owner) will take shots with you haha. Definitely a fun environment for birthdays! 

THE DIPPING SAUCE. OOOooOo this was so good! It was probably the highlight of my night :). I threw in tons of onions, green onions, and red peppers! (try not to choke on a pepper like me LOL, my throat was on fiyaaaa)

I like how the meat just keeps coming! You don't really have to order until it gets busy, then you just have to ask for it. You have the option of beef, lamb and pork! The portions for the beef are big but kinda small for the lamb. 


P.S You may want to do street parking if you don't want your meal to be interrupted! Their parking is "tandem" style.
author: Fanny H.

description:
This is my favorite place for shabu!! And for $21 AYCE how could you go wrong?! I've lived two blocks away from kufuya for the last 15 years and only discovered it this year.  My boyfriend is going through a hot pot phase so We always try new shabu places that just end up being over priced and mediocre. We've been to kufuya probably over 10 times in the past couple of months and they never dissapoint. 

There's always a table available for us and the service is great. Once we get our pot boiling the meat just keeps on coming! You don't even have to ask they'll bring a brand new place once they see you take the last slice. Their meat is so thin it just melts in your mouth! And it doesn't come frozen solid like at other shabu places.  What I love most about kufuya is their sauce! It's like the perfect mixture of ponzu and sesame. Their shiitake mushrooms are really good too, I use to ask for more all the time and now they just give me a bowl or plate full of it.
author: Linz C.

description: The dipping sauce is freaking BOMB! The first time we came we did AYCE shabu for a really good price $25.99 which is cheaper than most places in Sacramento. We had a party of five so we got to choose two soups since we had two pots. We chose the tonkotsu and spicy miso but both were a bit on the bland side but I guess their dipping sauce made up for it since that was one of the best dipping sauce i ever had at a shabu place. We chose beef and lamb as our meat choices and the beef was pretty good, thinly sliced and was of an okay quality and I didn't try the lamb because i hate the gaminess of lamb but the rest of my party said it wasn't all that, so we just stuck with the beef for all our other rounds. I semi like the fact that they keep refilling your meat without asking and they were pretty attentive with refilling the items. They also gave us a bowl of mix vegetables that had really good clear kind of noodles. The second we came we just did a Shabu by the course and some sushi and appetizers. The rolls were pretty good. Overall the food here is pretty good and the service is good too.
author: Maybeline C.

description:
Of all the shabu places I have gone to this one is the cheapest one and one of my favorites. At $22 for ayce shabu it's a pretty decent deal. The meat isn't the best quality but it's decent. I love that the veggie bowl is also ayce and you can request it to be refilled as many times as you want. I always get spicy miso as broth and it's not too spicy but you can def taste the miso and spice. There is lack of ventilation in here so you will definitely smell like your food. I also love the dipping sauce they give you, it's their own house made sauce. I also love that once you are done with a plate of meat they replace the place with fresh meat right away. I will definitely be back here again! 

Total for 2: $55
author: Stella J.

description:
The best all you can eat shabu place in the city!! It costs about $25 and for an extra $10 it's all you can drink too! Their broth and meat options are above average but what makes this place so unique and addicting is the special dipping sauce. The atmosphere is pretty laid back. I like how they have room to accommodate big groups. I've been here at least 10 times and never had to wait for a table. Also there is a small parking lot around the back which is very convenient because street parking can be difficult in that area. 

Definitely a must try if you like shabu shabu!
author: Heidi Q.

description:
Once in a while...Mr.MC and I will have sudden cravings for getting our shabu on..especially on those nights where it is gloomy and foggy out..Just thinking about it makes me drool.
 
You guys are absolutely amazing! For $22/person AYCE shabu in the city, it can't get any better than this. Unlimited plates of beef and lamb, veggies platter which includes udon, mushrooms, lettuce, spinach, and vermicelli. You get the choice of a few different types of broth. We always go with the spicy miso and never regret! They have also recently upgraded their stoves to electric, so now you don't have to worry about your shabu experience being disturbed by gas running out from the gas stoves. The house-made sauce here is delicious and it is what keeps me coming back! Be sure to add some garlic, chives, and the diced up red peppers and you are ready to go!

And may I just please rave about their service here...Kufuya ladies are absolutely awesome! Our plates of beef and lamb were constantly refilled. I mean, isn't that the best part? Going through plates and plates of thinly sliced beef without having to wait for more? That's what I am talking about! Now if you wanna bond with the ladies here, buy a few rounds of sake and they'd be down to take some shots with ya!
author: Stephy L.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!! My friend brought me here for the Shabu because he knows the owner - like really knows the owner. So we naturally got the best service in the house. But the owner is super fun and sweet!!! She's just so cool.

Anyways, we got the Spicy Miso which was delicious - not too spicy but noticeable. They originally brought 2 plates of beef, 1 small plate of lamb, and a bowl of veggies - mushrooms, noodles, spinach, cabbage (?). We finished plate after plate and they just kept bringing plate after plate - there wasn't a second that we were left meat-less! They were on top of that! The sauce was delicious too...mmm yumm...

We also had a beer and a small thing of sake - 3 rounds of shots split between 4 people to finish the night.

All in all, about $30 per person. It was delicious and I'll definitely come back!
author: Athena C.

description: This is my favorite go-to shabu around the area. The staff is always friendly and the meat dishes are always replaced as soon as you finish the one at your table. I have never waited to be seated and I appreciate that the staff reminds you that the gratuity is added when you pay.
author: Joan T.

description:
After a friend of mine introduced me to this place, and realizing that the owners so happen to be parents of one of my former students,  I'm down, anytime, for coming whenever someone suggests (or I suggest and everyone agrees).  In the beginning half of the year, I wondered why I was here so often for shabu, even on Valentine's Day.  Now...I can't help but be here; and when I don't go, there seems to be something missing.  Recently, I brought a couple of friends and had around 5 rounds of shabu.  Seriously...$22 AYCE, thinly sliced meats, a bowl of veggies with veggies I actually eat, good variety of sauces & "sides" (ex: onions, radishes, peppers etc.), and an I'm-treated-like-family feeling!  It doesn't get any better.    

Comfortable atmosphere, they have a small parking lot, and they don't kick you out when you're the last group there!  

Keep up the great service & yummy food!
author: Jessica S.

description: This is perfect on a cold chilly night at SF! I called and made reservation on the same day at 8:30 and we were seated right away. They have a small parking lot behind them. The staffs were very friendly! We decided to get the 25$ AYCE! It comes with beef lamb and a bowl of veggies along with mushrooms and udon! That's all I really get whenever I go to any other hot pot places! Also their sauce is soooo addicting!! Their service is top notch because once they see your plate it empty they automatically help you get another plate without asking. I will definitely be returning soon! This is my currently my favorite shabu place way better than shabu house. Ps they automatically charge 15% on your bill already!
author: Tina C.

description: This place is convenient and right around the corner from my house. I would definitely call in a reservation because they fill up quickly with larger parties on the weekends. My favorite part is their special sauce that you can customize to your liking with unlimited amounts of fresh chopped garlic, daikon, scallion, and Thai chilis. For only $25, this is definitely a steal for AYCE. The meat quality is decent. The service is decent as well, but can definitely start to taper off when there's a rowdy/demanding crowd sitting next to you (the second time we went we were sitting next to a huge party that would explode into cackles/slam the table every so once in awhile, which is a shock when you are trying to just enjoy your meal in peace). All in all though, a solid neighborhood joint to go to for shabu. At some point, I will have to try their sushi options too.
author: Mel I.

description:
How can I describe this glorious place??... Okay you know at hogwarts (HP fans stand up!) where the food magically appears after you finished your plate and just has more goodness on it. It's like that. But with AYCE beef, lamb or pork. I swear our trays are never empty when we come here! It's magical. That's how good the service and the food is. Try all 3 meats in the spicy miso broth, you will not regret it! And it's only $22 per person and the check at the end already has gratuity included! Whaaaaaa!? Yeah. 

Parking is kinda hard, but after eating here you won't mind the walk back to your car. They have a small parking lot on the side of the building but it gets packed and fills up quick, and usual someone blocks you in so your better off parking on the street! 

Wish they had something like this in AZ, I would be there every night! 

Apart from being a shabu house they also have yummy sushi and other dinner plates, but can you tell what I really come here for? That's right, Shabu shabu baby! Lol ;)
author: Miriam H.

description:
I've only been here twice, but I hardly remember the first experience so I'll speak solely on my my recent visit. 

They have a small tandem parking lot next to the restaurant, since the restaurant is a corner spot. The spots were a bit tight, and I don't like tandem spots much, but way better than looking for street parking around Richmond district. 

Came here with a party of 8, we made reservations so we got seated immediately on a Friday night. We all ordered All-You-Can-Eat shabu for $22 ($28 plus take and gratuity). I find that price quite decent for the way my friends and I ate that night hah. The meat dishes came in huge plates and thinly cut (which I liked) and the soup boiled pretty quickly; since they were probably warming it before they brought it out. We had unlimited supply on clear noodles, spinach, tofu, cabbage and mushrooms too. The sauce they provide you with is also very flavorful -- I loved it! They also give you sides of red peppers, daikon, green onions, etc to add to your sauce too. I would say we got our money's worth and it was delicious.

The service here is super friendly! They conversate with their customers and are very attentive and quick with reloading our veggie dish and meats too. Definitely will be back again someday when I'm ready for a huge meal.
author: Amanda C.

description: I LOVE shabu, but this place does not do it for me. First off, I don't like peanut or sesame sauces and that is their only type of sauce. Second, I personally don't feel like the meat quality is that great.
author: Chantel H.

description:
It's really sad that customer service can ruin an entire experience this bad.

My sister made reservations a week in advance for a birthday by calling in. The entire family travels from two cities away to get here and after finding parking FINALLY, we arrive and the waitress says we don't have your name down, accusing my sister of not making a reservation and that's that. No apology, only an abundance of dismissive attitude as she moves on to the next party. Incredibly infuriating.
author: Sandy T.

description:
I've been a customer at Kufuya for over two years now and I still find myself craving it every weekend. 

AYCE SHABU at $23-25/person (plus 18% gratuity) includes lamb, beef, veggies, noodles, and your choice of broth. My personal favorite is the spicy miso broth. The broth lends a light, clean flavor while the sauce they provide adds a tangy kick. I LOOOOVE the sauce and always load it up with garlic and daikon! The chili peppers are hot as balls though so proceed with caution. The meat can vary between very lean and slightly fatty but I love it all regardless!  I think that if you are someone who is very particular about the fat content of your meat, maybe you should go to the store and buy your own meat... stay your ass at home where you can pick and choose whatever you please instead of going out and complaining about how you once went to a shabu place that served you fatty meat. 

I love everyone who works here, from the servers who see me almost every month to the servers who have only seen me once or twice. They're always kind and smiling and never, ever lag on bringing a fresh plate of meat to our table. That being said, beware of the time limit! They handle a high volume of customers so they will enforce their time limit when they have to. During this time they do their best to rotate in as much food as possible to your table so coordinate wisely, my friends. 

I always leave happy. I don't mind the 18% gratuity; after being a server in the city for several years I understand the struggle! So maybe if you do not believe in tipping your servers, go elsewhere. They are amazingly patient and hardworking here even with the hordes of drunk assholes and impatient snobs. Kufuya consistently provides great service and good eats at an affordable price. Call ahead to arrange for seating, especially if you have a larger party. Also make some time to find parking! 

Why I prefer Kufuya over other shabu restaurants? 
- Servers are friendly and quick and do not avoid making eye contact (I HATE servers who do this, and for some reason so many shabu places are staffed with people who walk around staring at the ceiling or walk right past you when you're trying to get their attention).
- Broth is flavorful but still light, not overly spiced (some places go crazy with the herbs and I find that it makes their broth taste almost medicinal)
- Their sauce makes my tastebuds tingle with happiness and I can put as much garlic in there without being judged hehe
author: Patricia P.

description:
4 star for food and 1 more star for excellent service.

came here with a group of ten and made reservations ahead of time. felt a bit bad since I called in an extra 2 times to add some people, but the workers were always friendly about adding a few and it wasn't a problem.

came in at 7 and there were a few people here and there. most for the ayce shabu.  they set up the fire pots with all the sauce garnishings on the side. it included radish, green onion, hot peppers and minced garlic. all were yummy, but be careful of those peppers, they are HOT!!!

AYCE $23 comes with option of lamb and beef.  veggies on the side include cabbage, spinach, mushrooms, udon and glass noodles. I must say this was a fairly good deal and all the meats were excellent quality. you can choose from spicy miso or tonkatsu broth. I didn't taste much in the tonkatsu but definitely made a difference when I added some peppers in it to kick it up a notch. my friends liked their spicy miso broth, but I think everyone was more amazed of the yummy dipping sauce!!! it's a bit different, but very delicious. we all also asked for ponzu on the side, which the waiter was glad to bring out.

service was excellent. everytime a meat platter or veggie bowl was devoured, they kept it coming and I was throughly amaZed!!!! it was a little bit awk in the beginning because the servers were really precise of where each meat platter and veggie bowl goes. it was funny when they told my friend to move their sauce closer and leave everything exactly as they placed O.o  little bit weird but I see what you guys were doing now! they were really quick in setting up and changing empty plates :)  

bill came out with added gratuity already so just beware!  parking can suck because although they have a parking lot in the back, it's spaced out weird so you would block another person if you were the 2nd car parked behind. so if you can find parking around, it would save you a lot of trouble from disrupting your meal and moving your car.

overall, awesome experience and blown away by their service, food and price. will definitely go back here again!
author: Josie L.

description: Shabu is good but the atmosphere and staff are why my family and I make Kufuya our regular Shabu stop. I recommend  calling in and making a reservation, weekends are busy.
author: K H.

description:
Food: 4/5
Price: $$
Portion: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Appearance: 3/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
OVERALL: 4/5

Speedy service! Friendly too! Our plates of meat are always refilled, they check on you consistently. Flavors of meat and sauces they provide are tasty! Great way to start my first shabu ever trip! Will be back in the near future!
author: Eva H.

description: I had dinner at Kufuya for the first time on a rainy Friday night in the middle of October. Two of my best friends were in town, so I wanted to treat them to something different. We did the all you can drink and eat hot pot for $35 per person, which ended up being a great deal! It was everyone's first time experiencing hot pot, so all the staff was super helpful when it came time to cook/eat.There was a 90 minute time limit, so the waiters/waitresses were very attentive but we didn't feel rushed at all. Overall great experience, would definitely recommend!
author: Costa A.

description: I'd give them 6 stars if I could! Kufuya is one of my favourite restaurants in the city - I come here almost on a weekly basis. Their AYCE is so affordable and to top it off, their dipping sauce is DELICIOUS. I'd definitely recommend coming here for shabu.
author: Katarina D.

description:
Love AYCE Shabu Shabu!

Came here on a Friday Night for a girls gathering for 9 people, I pull into their small little parking lot and spotted my 2 friends, we were so hungry, the owner was nice enough to let us start our pot first before the others show up. Their Spicy Miso broth is the best (I don't eat spicy, but it was to my liking) the meat is fresh and thinly sliced, the dipping sauce they provide is this peanut and soy sauce, but they do have ponzu, upon request. We all order the AYCE and my other friends order Warm Sake to share. $25 for AYCE is pretty good for pricing I think and you get 90min but the owner is nice, she will spare some time and I've never seen them subjected to kicking anyone out of the restaurant. 

This place brings back memories cuz we use to come here, eat and just hangout/chill. It's a cozy place in the Richmond area, parking can be tough but they do have a small lot can fit probably 6-8 cars, but watch-out you might have to move your car if your blocking someone.
author: Mel L.

description:
All you can eat Shabu with spicy miso broth for the win!  For $10 more make it all you can drink Asahi and hot sake. Pretty much a no brainer. 

The meats are delicious, especially the lamb. Chunky mushrooms, thick noodles and fresh spinach make up the veggie portion. 

I didn't realize they added an automatic service fee so I accidentally tipped on top of everything else. Kicking myself today but oh well. My fault for not looking more closely at the check, but don't make the same mistake! 

The tables don't have the hot plate built in, so if you're doing Shabu and all the hot plates are being used you may have a bit of a wait. The staff is super friendly, though, and they don't rush you if you want to linger over a long dinner.
author: Terrence M.

description: I used to dine here regularly before I had a baby. Unfortunately now, I don't eat out as much because I rarely have time. Anyways, Kufuya is one of my favorite shabu place (after Shabu Club). Good service even when it's busy. Awesome price, cheaper than all other shabu restaurants and the food is just as good. I love that they have a small parking lot cause parking is difficult to find in that area. They also have a a la carte menu but most people come here to eat shabu.
author: Joyce C.

description:
I love going to this place! 

They offer good prices and amazing service and food!

I always get the spicy miso and the beef unlimited shabu!

Its super yummy here! The sauce is so good but if you just like ponzu sauce, you can ask them! I love mixing garlic in my sauces because it enhances the flavors!

I always make sure I come super hungry and get tons of beef, veggies and noodles!

Great for super cold days!

Careful though, you will smell like meat after leaving the restaurant, I recommend leaving bags and jackets in the car before going in!
author: Kelly L.

description: Best AYCE Shabu ever!  Also parking lot is a plus in SF. The service is also amazing as well. Great price and food would definitely recommend coming here for AYCE Shabu.
author: David S.

description: Let me start off by saying the sauce is AMAZING! Every time I visit a different shabu place I'm hoping it compares to kafuyas sauce. So far none have come close! The only complaint I have about this is place is that they only offer AYCE for shabu. I wish they offered it by the plate. I'd be here in a heart beat if they did. They have a wide variety of veggies and the meat is decent. I only order the beef and the quality is pretty good. The waiters are very friendly and attentive. They always bring out another plate of meat before I'm done with the first plate! I'll always come back for the sauce! You gotta try it!!
author: Kelly S.

description:
The location is random and far from other food business. Ayce shabu shabu was only 23 dollars with a couple of selections of meat and three types of broths.  

I wished they had more varieties of vegetables, like enoki mushrooms. There was only spinach, mushrooms, tofu, and cabbage in the bowl.  Overall the food was excellent, the broth (we had pork) was delicious. 

15%~20% Tip is also included in the bill...
author: Michelle N.

description:
$23 for AYCE Shabu!.  The meat quality is pretty good considering it's unlimited.  This goes for both the beef and lamb.  Veggies, udon, and glass noodles are also a nice addition.  Service here is perfect for Shabu.  As most people indicate, servers come by frequently to check if you need additional food refills.  They automatically include tip in your bill.  I was recently here on a Friday night with a group of 4 and our total came out to around $160 after tax and tip, but this included a bottle of sake and quite a few bottles of beer.  

They also take reservations!  I would recommend this as it's been quite busy each time that I've been here.  

There's a private parking lot but the spaces are tandem, so you may need to move your car if you've blocked someone in.  Otherwise, you'll have to find street parking.

I will definitely be coming back.
author: Matthew C.

description:
I've been here a handful of times and honestly this is one of my favorite AYCE shabu places ever! I actually only go here whenever my friends and I decide that we want shabu because it never fails. I always recommend this place when my friends ask for any recommendations. 

The staff is super friendly and they're pretty good about replenishing the meat, sauces and soup bases. They give you a good amount of meat on a giant plate. The sauce is delicious! It's definitely one of my favorites. 

I always leave this place with my stomach bursting out at the seams! Super full and satisfied!
author: Michelle F.

description: Good customer service and their sauces complement the meat well. Will come back again.
author: Mary T.

description:
They do have a small parking lot, the only issue is that people can park behind you so that you're locked in. They should probably get a better system than yelling your car's type so that someone has to get up and move their car in the middle of dinner.

Otherwise, we got the spicy miso which was supposed to be their most popular, and the beef/lamb option.  They did not offer pork. The soup and dipping sauces/sides were amazing. They did refill promptly after the first round, but after the second, no one to be heard from for awhile. Good thing we were full after the second! They also give you a bowl of veggies and noodles, which wasn't anything crazy extraordinary but did add to the balance. The servers were SO friendly, and refilled tea pretty frequently. This place gets pretty buzzing, we were there at 7pm on a Wednesday and it was somewhat empty, but got a lot more packed towards 8pm. 

They also serve sushi, which I saw others eating and it looked decent!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
This place is great. I have been to different places for A.Y.C.E. shabu and this is easily the best by far. Ace and I had a 6:30pm reservation and were seated immediately. Our waiter was friendly, attentive, and efficient. We did not have to wait long for refills on vegetables, meat, or even that delicious dipping sauce! In all I had a wonderful experience for a belated Valentine's dinner date with my Ace.

The meat slices were fresh and thinly cut. The lamb here was the best I have had, and it did not have those little bones that many other restaurants' lamb cuts had. The beef cuts were marbled to perfection. We ordered the tonkatsu broth and it boiled quickly, we cooked our meat through within seconds. Great vegetables as well. Oh, and THAT DIPPING SAUCE WAS F-ING DELICIOUS*

I cannot even complain about the 15% tipping charge. Why should I? The waiters did not stop us from eating just because there were other customers waiting. After three bowls of veggies, two plates of lamb, and three plates of beef to share between us, I say the restaurants deserve the tip. We gave a little more on top of that. We shall be back next week.
author: Janelle M.

description:
Not too shabby shabu shabu. :D

Come early because it gets busy. 

Can order extra noodles when you do "all you can eat". Even if you haven't finished all the vegetables. 

Excellent service. It's an Asian restaurant where when you do "all you can eat" you don't have to flag someone down desperately every time you need something. I didn't know these existed.

Tandem customer parking.

Green tea ice cream comes with all you can eat shabu.
author: Gee H.

description:
My go-to AYCE (all you can eat) beef and lamb shabu shabu Japanese restaurant for $23. They include tips in your check so it comes out to $28/$29 per person. 

Love their house sesame sauce. They have ponzu sauce too, you'll have to ask for it. I always add radish, green onions, garlic, and extra extra chillies into my sauce. 

Pretty fast customer service. As soon as they see your plate of beef or bowl of veggies and noodles empty, they will refill it. Not so fast refilling the lamb though.
author: B. R.

description:
This place is a solid 4.5stars!!! I drive all the way from Daly City to eat thier ayce shabu and it never disappoints. Veggies and meats always fresh and service is awsome. They only have beef and lamb but its aight cuz I like it simple anyways. Veggies are mushrooms,  spinach, napa cabbage,  udon and clear noodles. At $23pp every day, its the cheapest in the city! Attn!! The tip is already calculated with your bill!! Its all good for me cuz when I came yesterday with my 2.5yo, they didn't charge him a thing. I ordered a bowl of rice for him and he eat some of our shabu stuff too!!! Gave him ice cream for dessert!!! It was an Awsome meal and experience.

The only reason its not 5stars is the parking. Parking can be pretty crazy and if you park in the lot, its tandem parking so you might have to ask people to move their car to leave. Other than that!! Thumbs up bro!!
author: RICKY C.

description:
When it comes to shabu I'm usually not adventurous. I tend to stick to what I know and love, Shabu House. I've been hearing good things about this place so I was willing to try it out. 

My friends and I made reservations for 15 and had no troubles. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. 

Not the best quality meat, but cmon $23 for AYCE that's not bad at all. Whenever there's an empty plate on the table, the server replaces it right away without having to raise a hand. Their service is really fast, but maybe it's because we came on a Thursday night and it wasn't busy..? 

I would definitely go back, but im sorry it's still not as good as Shabu House.
author: Krystelle D.

description:
Came for AYCE ,for the food , I would rate three stars. People keep saying their sauce is good , but I don't find it special and I think other shabu places have better and more sauce options. Meat is ok, and I like the veggie bowl the most because it is fresh. We ordered pork and spicy miso broth ,both has no flavor. 

Why I only rate then 2 stars ,I have to say the customer service is really no good , or I will say bad. Not friendly at all, my friends came before me said both waitress and the waiter were being rude to her. We are party of 5, and need to flag them for water few times. We asked for more sauce two times and they forgot about it. When the bill came ,15% tips is already added. We paid with 2 credits card and somehow the total charge was higher than the total. We just didn't get get it but we didn't bother to argue or question. Bottom line , we will never come back. There are so many shabu shabu out there..... With better service and better food.
author: Lu W.

description:
ACYE Shabu for only $22!

I came here with my best friend earlier this month for dinner. We both ordered the ACYE Shabu, and a big cold one of Sapporo. The meat was very thinly sliced and delicate but lacked that delicious flavor. We also got the premixed dipping sauce which I enjoyed.

The staff here were very nice and friendly. I recommend coming in early, it can get quite busy.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Me and my friends love coming here for all you can eat and drink. Staff is always friendly and welcoming and even joke around with us even if we get too loud. Plus that sauce they give you for the shabu is out of this world!
author: Matthew S.

description: Had such a great time at dinner here tonight! Service was fast, and the food was delicious. Will definitely come back when we are in the city.
author: Tara P.

description: Another restaurant with delicious sushi will go to a list of my favorite places. Perfect service and very tasty and fresh sushi. I will definitely come here again. Thank you very much!
author: Anasmokra S.

description: Love love love this spot. Very good AYCE shabu shabu spot. The waitresses are great! They're very friendly and attentive. Can't wait to go back again!
author: JungHyun H.

description: We have only tried the AYCE here, but the service is excellent.  Before you finish off a plate another arrives.  Food was great and absolutely love that sauce!  We'll be returning soon.
author: Miriam V.

description:
All you can eat beef for $23! Delicious meal with noodles, vegetables and they come with a small cup of red Thai Chili!! 
I love spicy food so the spicy miso sauce and I add the Thai red chili makes the soup super spicy and delicious!
We came at 5:30 and no line then but half and hour passed we saw more and more people coming in and started a line. Reservation is not needed but highly recommend if you arrive after 6pm. And make sure you get the name of the person who took your phone reservation because I saw one group of 7 people got turned down saying that they didn't have their reservation and they stormed out mad!
Overall the meal is great and I love shabu2, so I will be returning! They also kept the meat coming!!
author: Ty N.

description:
Great food, very Chinese atmosphere. The servers were a bit cheap- meaning they serve small(tiny) portions at once. However, if you order AYCE, you keep asking, they come by sporadically. The soup is bomb, real spicy miso, and not water like mums. 
Meat are sliced super thin and fresh, vegetables are plentiful and shiitake mushroom are yum. They are the first place with no enoki tho. I will def. come back.
They totally deserve a 5 star, but minus 1 star for the horrible parking, and another for charging my 2 year old 6.00 for eating 2 pieces of meat and less than 1  serving of noddles. Blah
author: Monika T.

description: When I went back to my hometown for a family visit. This is the go to spot when I crave for shabu. Is pretty far out in the Richmond district but I don't mind the drive for their super awesome shabu sauce. That what  make the whole experience heaven. Is their sauce. And the two sister bubbly personality. Their thinly slice meat with marble. Oh I wish I can have them right now. Is melt in your mouth. Is all you can eat with simple side in a bowl, spinach, mushroom, udon, tofu, and clear vermin chilli the thick kind with a little grey color. Trust me is totally worth your money. You can also add all you can eat sushi to your package for a up charge.
author: Linda T.

description:
All-you-can-eat-shabu for $22 for dinner! Not too bad of a deal. That being said, two girls really can't eat THAT much.  Lol.  We realized that after we finished our 2nd plate of meat.  It comes with beef and lamb and assorted veggies.  I found the lamb very gamey and didn't like it too much.  

Their sesame dipping sauce was delicious!  I didn't see the Gatorade bottle that everyone has been mentioning...

Oh, and there is parking around the corner.  It's always nice when a restaurant in SF has parking.

PS.  They open at 5pm for dinner, but don't come in around that time, cuz they are just opening the doors and just getting ready.  I'd recommend coming in at 6 if you don't want to wait a long time for them to get the food out to you.
author: Jenny L.

description: Been coming here for over 7+ years and will continue to do so as long as I live in the bay. Best shabu place around (and I've tried most) with their special sauce, not too salty soup, defrosted meats and great customer service. I love this place.
author: Ms. T L.

description:
My favorite shabu place in the city, by far. Possibly my favorite shabu place, period. The service is great, the spicy miso broth is great, and their dipping sauce is AMAZING. 

Remember to wear your stretchy pants!
author: Chau T.

description:
Curiosity got the best of me, and I'm attracted to Japanese cuisine.  That plus I'm moving to the neighborhood- this created the perfect storm for me to try Kufuya...

Well....lunch was totally A-OK- but nothing amazing.  I had a rather lackluster but adequate tonkatsu ramen- tasty enough broth, mixed with stringy ramen noodles, plenty (maybe too much tonkatsu) and various veggies.  Edible, and fundamentally sound, but not something I'm likely to order again.  If you are accustomed to eating ramen in Japan, you will be disappointed- but without that reference or expectation- its a satisfactory meal (and a large portion).  My lunch companion had the more impressive score- a massive combo platter of chicken teriyaki, gyoza, and tempura shrimp and veggies.  All that + rice, miso soup, and salad- this lunch special was almost a feast for two at a price of around $10.  The total damage was something like $25 combined, so we got decent enough food at a value which can't be found on the other side of the city.  That said, I wouldn't drive across town for this, but I can see myself eating here sporadically when I move 8 blocks away.  It seems from many many yelp reviews that the shabu shabu is surely the way to go here, and I am definitely going to try that down the road at some point.  I'll be back when I move to the Outer Richmond 'hood (but probably not before then...).
author: Andy S.

description: A great simple all you can eat shabu place in my neighborhood.  The all you can eat comes with beef, lamb, noodles, mushrooms, spinach & napa cabbage.  They unfortunately don't do the half and half soup pots since we wanted to try the pork and spicy miso, but we ended up picking the spicy miso.  I've never been here to try the sushi, but the shabu is a great deal!  I definitely be back during my next shabu craving!
author: Elena N.

description: Been coming here for years and will continue to come here to Shabu. Love the sauce and they serve sushi too. (Best of both worlds )
author: Jen C.

description:
Considering I'm not a super Shabu lover, this place makes me one for sure!  The sauce they serve here is DA BOMB ! It is so delicious, you'll for sure be begging for more. I have no idea what's in it or how to describe it but just go there and you'll see what the hype is about.  You should definitely go for the all-you-can-eat special. It's totally inexpensive and worth every penny. 

My friends suggested this place for dinner on a Saturday night. Be forewarned, you should make a reservation as many people got turned away at the door as they were not accepting walk-ins. It's that popular!

Considering parking in the Richmond district could be a pain, I was pleasantly surprised to see they have a parking lot around the side. Super +++

Lastly the service is fast, efficient and they replace the Shabu plates quickly (you don't have to wait too long). 

I'm definitely coming back
author: Phillip D.

description: Love this place , good food and good service , everybody there is nice and funny,but book a table ahead bexause is does get packed in the evenings.
author: Leo N.

description:
The absolute best.

I haven't been to any other places that serve shabu shabu except for this place, but I don't think I want to go anywhere else for it.

 The AYCE is $23 per person and comes with beef (or lamb), tofu, udon and vermicelli noodles, tofu, mushrooms, napa cabbage, and spinach with your choice of broth. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE SPICY MISO BROTH. They bring you a hot pot of soup quickly and everything else equally fast, getting you started as soon as you sit down. In addition, you are served their delicious goma sauce (I think that that's what it's called) and I also recommend dumping in some of the daikon, green onion, garlic, and of course some chili. When you get the broth don't forget to put garlic and stuff in it to make it extra yummy.

Kufuya offers excellent service, even at their busiest. They will constantly refill you on meat, and you can most definitely ask for anything else you want more of (noodles, veggies, broth, tea, etc). 

Great place to fill your tummy with the most delicious food to warm your soul. Top notch. Will come here forever and ever. Lol
author: Kerri S.

description: I've been wanting to come here for a long time.  I was going to order the Shabu Shabu but I wasn't that hungry so the waitress suggested that I order the beef and veggie udon.  I also ordered the combination shooters with squid, uni, scallop which were delicious.  However, once I tasted the udon broth, it didn't taste authentic.  There are many Chinese-owned restaurants in the City and I can taste it when it is not real Japanese.  Other than that, the portion is generous.  There was a lot of beef and veggie, and the quality was good.  But, hey, it is the broth that makes the noodles.  I probably wouldn't come back again.
author: Sfscubaman T.

description:
I think I should preface to say that the review is based on thinking that it was a shabu place, only to find it was more a hot pot. I actually quite liked the broth and the sauce, but I'd rather have a choice of beef and pork than beef and lamb. To each their own I guess. I had some rolls, but it was a mistake because we got too much food from the all you can eat. 

Different note though, the service is phenomenal. My water and tea were always filled, and they made sure our plates were never empty for the meat choices on our all you can eat. All in all, it was good, but I doubt I'll be back.
author: Cody M.

description:
Terrible service. I walked in and they said I am sorry we are packed! Wtf . I can't wait? 

So I ask how long is the wait and I get "well I am not sure maybe 30? "

Terrible greeting and attitude at the door. Screw u guys!
author: Gox X.

description: Really good price for ayce Shabu! The service is usually good as I come all the time. The ladies who work there are super friendly but the guy with the glasses not so much. There are times where I would raise my hand and we'd make eye contact and he'll just walk away. 30 mins before closing, he was more concerned about cleaning tables than acknowledging our table.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I would give this place a solid 3.5 stars.

Its located at the corner of 34th and Geary so its really easy to spot. I didn't have an issue with parking (came on a Sunday night @ 7:30 pm). My boyfriend made a reservation just in case it was packed but there were a couple empty tables when we came in. BF and I both got the AYCE shabu shabu for $22 each (they include the tip when you get the AYCE so the grand total was around $27 each). 

This place is NOT Japanese owned (I understand Chinese and the owners/waitresses were speaking Chinese to each other) so the flavor was a little off... The spicy miso broth was really bland so we asked our waitress to add some pork broth to our pot. Unfortunately this didn't solve the bland flavor issue so we just added some soy sauce into our pot and reduced the sh*t out of the soup. The shabu only came with a sesame dipping sauce (also bland in my opinion) and some chopped green onion, garlic, grated daikon, and chile. The quality of the beef is pretty good, although it was shaved a bit too thin in my opinion. We had an abundance of fresh napa cabbage, spinach, tofu, Korean glass noodles, udon, white button mushroom, and shittake mushroom to accompany our beef. Neither of us liked lamb so we skipped it all together. 

Service was really good! Our meat plate was never empty and we ended up with a lot of extra veggies. Not sure if I would go back because it was lacking in the flavor department.
author: Grace C.

description:
Happy 23rd Birthday Mark! 

My friend let his girlfriend plan his birthday dinner (telling her KBBQ or hot pot) and she ended up picking places that weren't AYCE.. (who doesn't choose AYCE kbbq & hot pot?!). Anyways, after she told him her choices, he was disappointed and told her he wanted AYCE. Since our group of friends normally eat at Shabu Club, she decided to try something new for all of us! To end this little short story, we had an awesome AYCE experience with our group of 6 :) 

Having AYCE hot pot, I was surprised at how great their service was. As said before, Shabu Club has always been our place to go for hot pot (if not, it'd be Shabu House). The thing with Shabu Club is that their ponzu sauce was superb and their meats were marbled most of the time, but their service was meh... Sometimes we'd sit around for 10-15 minutes with no meat at the table. We would have to order a plate in advance when we're about halfway through with the current plate and still have to wait an extra 10-15 minutes, sometimes 20! For Shabu House, it was the same thing, except their food quality wasn't as good as Shabu Club. I found the service here at Kufuya impeccable. They are always on the floor and carrying meat, ready to fill an empty plate or table. Though their meat isn't as great as Shabu Club, it is still pretty good, as well as their sauce. It is important to us that we are never left hungry, and I felt as though they are going above and beyond that. 

Another awesome thing was the cake surprise! Of course the girlfriend had to order a cake in advance, but we were having trouble deciding whether or not to eat the cake there or back at home since most of the guys didn't have room for cake quite yet. While we were close to ending the decision of having cake there (after sitting for several minutes), they closed the lights and we all sang happy birthday to our dear friend, Mark! His girlfriend wasn't even expecting it just yet either because she hadn't given them the candle, but it all turned out great, because they surprised us with a sparkler candle too!! :) Thanks for everything and making our friends birthday awesome, Kufuya!! I am definitely coming back here with the impeccable service and delicious food!! I will never go hungry :) 

So aside from the awesome service & birthday celebration, I'd like to tell you about other stuff!! I guess you can make your own stuff because the table will have little bowls of dishes that has garlic, tunip (??), green onions, and red peppers for you to mix into your sauce to your liking. AYCE hot pot is $23 and includes rib-eye steak, lamb, and pork. The meats come out on large plates, but if you order lamb, it tends to come out in a smaller plate. Also, their veggie bowl has cabbage, spinach, udon, glass noodles, mushroom, and tofu. I wish they had enoki mushrooms! For parking, they have a small private lot, and you can park behind another car, but you must move it when the person leaves (which they will announce to the restaurant what type of car is blocking the person). If there is no more space, you have to find street parking, so good luck!! 

Overall, I had a wonderful experience here and would definitely come back again with friends. Thanks for making our friends birthday special!! :)
author: Mandy G.

description:
Great standard Shabu Ingredients.
Great Service.

2 HDTVs that play sports.

$22 for AYCE and + $10 for AYCE drink.  deeeeeeeals!

There is only one dipping sauce it is awesome; sort of a miso vinegarette.  And they give you toppings to put in it (green onions, garlic, chills, grated radish)

Only tough part is finding parking.

It can accommodate big groups.  Also this place can get pretty noisy.
author: Steven F.

description: Wish I can give more star.   Tried all kind of shabu shabu around the states.   This is the only place I must eat at least once a week.   Regardless, where I've moved to.   I always try to come back to the bay just to eat here.   The two sisters are super nice including other workers.   The sauce is what it get me keep on coming back ^_^
author: KayLee N.

description: This place is so freaking awesome. Service is wonderful, very attention unless they're busy. You just gotta flag them down when your eyes meet their eyes. What I love about them is that their meat has a nice fattiness to it and their sauce is very flavorful. But when the two combine...it's like your taste buds are swimming in a sea of flavor and awesomeness. Definitely one of my go to spots in the city for Shabu.
author: Adelbert Y.

description:
I agree with other reviewers that $22 for all you can eat shabu is a little expensive, but I do think it's a fun experience to try at least once, and Kufuya is a good place to do that.  The food arrangement on the plate always looks good, and they are pretty quick with service when you're a smaller table.  There's even a parking lot around the corner, and since it's tandem parking they even help track down the vehicle owner if they're blocking someone in.  

I really like the food here and enjoy the restaurant, but it is drafty in there and doesn't feel all that clean.  On the plus side, my friend somehow got soup all over the walls (a chopstick mishap) and they were really nice about it and helped us clean up the mess. :)
author: Gabrielle L.

description:
We LOVE this place! First of all the service is amazing. All the staff are very fun, and it creates a really cool atmosphere. You can tell they're happy to be there. It's like all the staff are family, and they make you feel like a part of their family too. 

The hot pot is SO good. They bring noodles and veggies in a pretty large bowl. Fresh spinach, mushrooms, and tofu. 

I love all the garnishes for the soup, radish, onion, & chile. YUM. They're so fast with the service, always bringing out more plates of meat. 

I always look forward to coming here!
author: Michelle W.

description: I love everything what I eat there. Anything I pick is so delicious. They have nice and helpful staff. Everybody should try their Mountain and Caterpillar rolls, chicken and beef teriyaki. If you go there either for lunch or dinner you don't have to worry about parking space, they got a lot of it. Kufu-ya!!! I'm your fan. Fan of your food and homy atmosphere.
author: Christine L.

description:
Kufuya's "open"  sign wasn't on. just  the sushi sign was. looked at their hours and noticed they were supposed to be open. looked inside and saw some people. .

tried to order ramen. not served on weekends. noticed no sushiman, and no fish in the display case. should have ordered tonkatsu instead.

flatscreen: nickleledeon

sampling: chirashi(12.99)
-majority of sashimi referigarator cold : tamago(2), tuna(3), suzuki(1), hamachi(1), salmon (1). butterfish(2) size ranged from bite sized to moderate sized pieces
-lettuce salad with slice of tomato had slightly bitter tasting  miso dressing
-miso soup watery, no miso taste, just tofu and seaweed bits.

temaki:
-server who greeted me made the chirashi later
-kids running around the restaurant
-saw chinese customers only.
-service acceptable, food barely so.
author: Victor G.

description:
I LOVE IT HERE! 

Me and my girls come here all the time and the owners love us as well :) They're all siblings and soooooo welcoming and really chill! Sake bottles are never ending when we're here and it's always a joy to drink with them. 

All-you-can-eat Shabu for $22/person. Not too shabby. 
- We always go for the Spicy Miso, All beef. 
- Comes with a Side of cabbage, spinach, tofu, udon, vermicelli, and mushrooms. 
- The dipping sauce is yummy(: with your own helping of green onion, garlic, minced daikon radish, and chopped chilies. 

Definitely recommend this place if you need your fix of good shabu! Service is impeccable. You'll definitely have a good time here!
author: Anh T.

description: They actually kicked our group out at the 90 minute mark after our reservation started, even though we didn't start eating until 20 minutes in. We asked for a last round of sake before we got up, and were denied. I understand they were busy on a friday evening but I've never been kicked out at Shabu House and we have definitely taken our sweet AYCE (&drink) time there.
author: Young L.

description: Only $22 for all you can eat shabu shabu?! I hope they never raise the prices! The soup is delicious! I always get the pork bone soup and add my own spiciness level to it.
