Fresh lamp and beef. The meat quality is better than ShabuShabu. The soup was Ok. 
The sauce is bit different than ShabuShabu and G-Cubes on Taraval or other Japanese hotpot places, but it is still good.
Low services.
Cheaper than ShabuShabu. A good place for me when i craving for Japanese hotpot but dont have enough money to go to other places :))
author: IVY D.

description:
We came here on Saturday for a good friend's birthday celebration. Birthday girl is a Shabu enthusiast so after much contemplating and being so considerate of her guests, she decided on Kufuya in outer Richmond. 

I have to say, you really get your money's worth here! The quality of the beef is average and the location is a bit far but hey-- it's $20 for all you can eat and $30 for all you can eat/drink. By the way, their hybrid teriyaki (?) ponzu sauce is super yummy and the servers are very friendly. 

I highly recommend this place if you are having large dinners!
author: Cheryl C.

description:
This review is for the shabu shabu experience and the great service.

After calling our usual shabu place to see if they had any space for us at 8:30pm on a Friday (nooope!), we frantically took to the internet to find somewhere to eat. Blood sugar dropping, bellies rumbling, we came across Kufuya. I made the call, and a sweet, enthusiastic young voice told me, "Of course we have space for you!" We jumped in the car and drove across the city, hopeful that we would be promptly fed.

Let me tell you -- not only were we VERY promptly fed, but we ate like kings! The restaurant was quiet (only a few other parties, no annoyingly loud background noise), and the staff was SOOO attentive. But I'm getting ahead of myself. When we arrived, our table was ready, our server knew exactly who we were, and we were able to promptly order without even looking at the menu -- spicy miso broth, lamb and beef shabu for 4. Before we knew it the table was covered in food....and it just kept coming, no requests needed. 

At first I was a little dubious about what we had gotten into -- this wasn't just a shabu place, after all. The burner wasn't even built into the table -- it was a funny little camp stove, basically. But it was not long before I realized that this was the best shabu shabu experience I have ever had. Let me repeat that: THIS WAS THE BEST SHABU SHABU EXPERIENCE I HAVE EVER HAD!! 

And dudes, $22 for all you can eat shabu shabu?!? This place is AMAZING!
author: Liz E.

description:
My friend and I have this thing where we NEED to get our money's worth when it comes to AYCE.  It's really not enough for us to just be satisfied with the taste, quality, and amount of food.  We really just need to push past those limits.

For $22/person, we ended up polishing off four trays of beef, two plates of lamb, two orders of udon and glass noodles, two orders of mushrooms, and a heaping of spinach, all in their spicy miso broth (which, by the way, isn't spicy at all).  Talk about food overload.

I'm not a fan of shabu's dipping sauces (I much prefer Hot in the Pot's selection) because, well, they only gave us one kind - that sweet/savory/tart peanut sauce.  I ended up just using a spoonful of the miso broth with some garlic and soy sauce dumped in, and it was much better.

I'm definitely down to come back here for AYCE shabu.  We didn't really look at the other items on the menu, but from what others say, the shabu is the best thing about this place.

Service was kind of slow/nonexistent, especially since for the first half of our meal, we were the only other party in the whole restaurant.  We were getting really annoyed because we were clearly wanting more food and water, and they weren't even around (our speculation: sake bombs in the kitchen).  Finally we had to wave and flag them down in order to get more water and plates of food.

Besides the service, we had a great time here.  The food was fresh, the broth was good, and it was AYCE.  There really is no bad time with AYCE.
author: Tori S.

description:
Get ready to bring your sweat pantsu and say goodbye to your diet!

It might not have the best decor or location.. farther richmond area but it does have Great service and Cheap All you can eat Shabu.
author: Hevad Y.

description: I love this place!! I love coming here every time I'm visiting SF! The sauce is my favorite!! It's different from the other shabu places I've tried. It's a decently sized shabu place - family owned. People are friendly and the service is great!
author: Annie H.

description: Omg all you can eat shabu! Talk about deliciousness in your mouth! Everytime I come here I always make sure to stop by. Servers are really nice and friendly. Make sure you get their spicy miso soup you will not regret it. And if you don't wanna eat shabu get their rolls instead
author: Cecilia T.

description:
Kufuya! I'm so glad that I discovered this place and i came here on a weekday for lunch and they didnt have the shabu on their lunch menu.

So i asked if i can still order it even tho it was 1pm and i know they end their lunch dining at 2pm. nicely, they still allowed me to and thats def. a plus 1 on my book.

the spicy miso came out really fast, and it wasnt that spicy in the beginning, but afterwards it was a kick. 

i got about 3 plates of beef and 1 plate of lamb, but i was disappointed at how fatty the meat was on the 3rd and final plate of beef. 

regardless, the spicy miso was nicely flavored, and in my dipping sauce, i slapped a heavy dose of garlic in there so it was really good.

the service is really good here, and i can tell that its family owned, i saw a couple with a kid and i think one of their parents in the back came out as well when they were about to clean up and close. i really respect that they do all the work themselves and do the cooking themselves too.

I cant wait to come back for a dinner portion of the shabu
author: Kenny L.

description: Really good place to do all-you-can eat shabu. Price is reasonable and food is good. Meat is tender and flavorful. I want my shabu meat to melt in my mouth and it did here. The only cons are: place is crowded on weekends, restaurant is not very big so there is a wait for seating, and hard to find parking (they have a parking lot but it's consistently full and people need to move their cars for the tandem spots). Not sure if this is pro or con, but I ended up eating so much of their delicious shabu shabu, that I didn't want shabu again for over a month.
author: Ali F.

description: Love love love this place! It is hands down the best shabu place I've been to so far. They offer shabu or regular sushi. I mainly go here for their AYCE shabu. It is only $22!! For the quality of meat they serve you I'd pay way more than 22! Service was super fast they always bring you a new plate of meat once you're finished with one. Always leaving here with a super bloated but very satisfied tummy :)
author: Julie H.

description:
All you can eat shabu shabu for cheap! And it's not shitty meat either. It was pretty good. I was so happy when I left this place :) hahah.

It was really packed when we went cause there was a party celebrating someone's birthday there. They were drunk and shouting across the restaurant but its cool. They just tryna have a good time with the good food here.

I don't really remember the fine details since I ate here almost two months ago. All i really know is; meat was gooood, sauce was gooood, and service was Goood. You guys can take my word for it. It's only when  Ieat bad food, that I will remember every little thing about it since there will be a lot of complaining)

Yeah, the waitress was hella funny. My friends were placing money on whoever eats the fat and other gross shit that was left over from cooking the meat. And the waitress came over was like, "I remember doing that with my friends. I got 20 bucks!" Then someone poured a whole glass of liquified fat in to a cup. And I told the waitress to drink it for $20. She was like, "hell naw! I wont even drink that for $100!"

Definitely coming back here. Cheap unlimited food that taste good = win!
author: Ray Z.

description: Great all you can eat. Good price, great service, and everyone is so nice. This place has been here forever but I never went in. So tonight my cousin & his girlfriend asked me to go to dinner there & I said okay. Wow I been living in the Richmond most of my life, 20 or more years and never came here. I'm so happy I went tonight. Everyone seems to know each other. I run into three friends I grew up with there. So over all great food, good service, and very friendly place. I will be back!
author: Michele T.

description:
All-you-can-eat Shabu for $22/person. This deal happens during lunch AND dinner. I was craving shabu so badly that I yelped a place that was open for lunch. I saw that Kufuya was open and decided to take my boyfriend to try it. I was sadly disappointed. 

Yes, the deal is pretty awesome for all-you-can-eat, but as soon as you walk in, you hear Cantonese. Usually this is a red flag... Chinese people serving Japanese food? I don't know, my experiences have shown Chinese people are better of serving Chinese food and likewise for any ethnicity. However, I kept an open mind and decided to not let the lack-of-authenticity impart my judgment. 

I like the dipping sauce and the little additions (real garlic, green onions, peppers and minced daikon) you can put in it, especially the REAL chili peppers. We ordered the spicy miso broth and it was TERRIBLE. It was so watery with no hint of spiciness and not pleasant to sip on whatsoever. The vegetables that came with the udon were the usual: spinach, two different types of mushrooms & cabbage. The meat was sliced way too thinly that it would break before it was placed in the broth and this annoyed me to no end. 

The service was good. They were very accommodating and constantly came back to check on us.

All in all, there was nothing special about this place that would make me come back. If you aren't too much on quality (and more on quantity) than the good price and good service should be more than an incentive for you to come try this place. 

Good future tip: Chinese people should just stick to Chinese food.
author: Jessica T.

description:
My boyfriend and I are on a mission to find the best Shabu Shabu in San Francisco after sampling it in Orange County, CA with friends on a recent visit.  

So far, Kufuya is the best! The Spicy Miso is yummy, veggies are fresh (the boyfriend always wants more spinach, always), meat is great, and AYCE is the best! Although I'm sure we didn't get our monies worth because we only had two plates of meat (woof, that is a lot!), we sure did enjoy our food.  The sauce = heaven.  Service was fantastic.  I'm surprised this place isn't busier on a Friday night, but I won't complain! 

Definitely going back.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
Absolutely love this place! 
We come here religiously (we try for at least once a month). ZOMG....

Beef and lamb always taste super good. Just fatty enough and not too lean.
The broth is absolutely amazing. The all you can eat sushi is a perfect pairing if you can eat a good amount of food. We tried doing this a few times, but epically failed. We pound more of the beef down w/out the rice, but the sushi is really good. 

The service is beyond amazing. They are always really attentive of us. We usually go in big parties, but even as a small table they always are on top of things. 

The sauce is yum! Don't know what they put in it, but freaking YUM! 
The sauces come w/ Daikon, chili peppers, and green onion.

I've brought a lot of my friends here and they love it.

Definitely HAVE TO TRY!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Haven't written in a while, but really wanted to give a shoutout to Kufuya for it's amazing $22 all you can eat Shabu deal.  Seriously it's already $20 for one plate of meat & veggies at Shabu House, so this is DEFINITELY the best deal I've seen for good quality ingredients.

Their spicy miso broth is very good, not too salty at all.  Their house dipping sauce is really delicious, and they also give you all the fixings like garlic, green onion, minced daikon, etc... on the house unlike Little Fat Sheep.  

Most importantly, the staff here are all really kind and attentive, which is really hard to come by at popular restaurants these days.  I can't remember the last time a waitress would walk over to refill my sauce and meat at a hotpot place without me frantically waving them down.

Parking is definitely a bitch here, but they have a small parking lot in the back.  Try to carpooling instead!   Can't wait to go here again soon!
author: Anna T.

description:
The dinner box bento box is a great deal. For only $13.99, I had beef teriyaki, tempura (veggies and 2 shrimp) and 4-piece tuna sashimi with a bowl of rice, miso soup and salad. 

Beef Teriyaki = good, no visible fat, cooked medium-well
Tempura = small portion, but lightly battered, crispy and hot
Sashimi = I like the tuna, fresh and cold
Salmon and Tuna Nigiri = delicious and mouthwatering

The service was fine until we finished our food at about 7:30 pm on a Sunday night, when people started coming in. It took our waitress awhile to give us our check, but she apologized for taking so long.  I was really surprised to see how busy it got because the last few times I was here, it was empty. 

Location is not that great, corner of 34th and Geary, so maybe not a lot of people know this Japanese restaurant exist, but I live a couple of blocks away and I do not mind walking to get dinner here once in a while!  Also, there's free parking behind the restaurant on 34th Avenue :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
....a month late, for this review.

I really, really liked my first shabu shabu experience at Kufuya. As a first timer I was happy when a friend in our large party of 16, came over and gave me the run down of how things work. The staff were also really helpful at not allowing me to make a shabu shabu faux pas!

For all you can eat, this place is no joke...they kept us well stocked in both meats and veggies which was quite a delight. I highly recommend the spicy miso broth, it was yum. 

I would like to return soon and try the sushi as well as another round of shabu shabu goodness, especially as the San Francisco evenings begin to get cooler!!
author: Hilda Z.

description:
LOVE this place.

$22 for all you can eat shabu. Can't get better than that.

The beef is good quality (doesn't have that frozen old meat taste) and seems like they improved their lamb too the last time I went which is also great.

The dipping sauce is a hybrid of the traditional ponzu dipping sauce mixed with sesame. Another bonus compared to other shabu places is they have these really hot peppers you can add to the dipping sauce.
author: Amy H.

description:
had dinner there last night since it is like 100 feet away from my house. 
Menu:


Tempura appetizer
Hurrican Roll
Volcano Roll
49ers Roll
Rainbow Roll
Large Sake
endless hot tea

all very delicious especially the volcano roll (i think it could have been hotter)

Service was good, very attentive, seemed popular,

I noticed the people that came in were ordering the Shabu Shabu, looked interesting, have not had that before and may want to try it next time I am in

took a menu to go and will definately be calling when in the mood for sushi close to home
author: coonkitty c.

description: Best Shabu in town. The broth and sauce is authentic and D-Lish. Service is amazing as well.
author: mui d.

description:
Never appreciated the concept of hotpot or "shabu" until a year ago.

Recently wanted to try other "shabu" places besides my usual Shabu House.
My friend mentioned about Kufuya and their delicious and flavorful sauce so I gave it a try. and YESSS SAUCE WAS BOMB!

Just $22 for AYCE! I'm soldddddddddddddddd
I chose to mix the spicy miso broth with the chicken broth which did not disappoint SINCE SOUP does make a big difference in the overall experience. The kobe beef was thinly sliced just like how i like it and it tasted goood as well. You can order lamb as well. The veggies included napa cabbage, spinach, tofu, mushrooms, udon, vermicilli, and etc. 

Service is attentive as long as you get their attention on a busy night.

Only been here once, but plan on coming back if I'm around the neighborhood.

and ONE MORE THING, they also serve sushi, etc besides shabu if you aren't a shabu person ;)
author: Virginia L.

description: Legit ayce Shabu place. Quality steak cut and lamb cut with great dipping sauce and good spicy miso soup base. Cheap! And worth every penny. I will go again.
author: David L.

description: I love this place! I always come here with a large group of friends and we eat our hearts out! This place is great for big parties , They have all you can eat shabu here for just 22$! and also all you can eat sushi as well if you tack on a few more dollars! The sushi here is good , but the shabu here is even better! They have spicy miso soup here which is great with noodles! They have unlimited udon, cellophane noodles , spinach , tofu , mushrooms , beef , lamb and typical Shabu items here, They also have their famous 'crack sauce' which is a mixture of seasame sauce and ponzu sauce , great with the beef! They have a small TV here in case you watch sports. The atmosphere here overall is really great!! the servers are really nice and friendly, they always make conversation and try to make your experience as wonderful as possible! Definitely worth the 5 stars!
author: Jeffrey T.

description: I love Kufuya! After years of shabu eating experience, I've come to realize that Kufuya offers the best deal in the Bay Area. I just re-read my review from 2008 and am amazed they have not raised their price ($22 for AYCE) in 5 years!! The quality of food is the same, if not better than a lot of the other popular shabu joints, plus they have a lot more variety, including shitake mushrooms, udon, clear noodles, etc. etc. They do automatically tack on a 15% service charge regardless of party size, but the service is friendly and quick so it doesn't bother me. My husband and I moved to the South Bay but still visit Kufuya whenever we're in the city.
author: Cee J.

description: Although I've always been a loyal fan of GCube, I finally gave Kufuya a try after hearing many good things about its shabu deal. And I must say, their shabu is pretty legit. It's AYCE for beef and lamb, along with veggies, udon, and vermicelli for only $22 (tip included). SUPER JOOG. We got the spicy miso soup base and it had a mild kick to it at most. The quality of the meats is average compared to other shabu places but the service is awesome. Maybe it was a slower night when I came with my friends, but the waitress was so friendly and attentive. She already brought out new plates of meats when we got down to the last two pieces, and came by to refill our water/sauces/broth several times. Definitely plan on making Kufuya my new go-to spot if I'm feeling for an AYCE dinner.
author: Reggie L.

description:
4th star is actually for the service! The girl that waited our table was super sweet and all smiles! 
Shabu and all u can drink (2hrs max) for $32! Hell yea...well worth it! We went with the spicy miso broth, it was bland at first but after it simmered it got tasty and spicy! Will definitely come back!
author: TifFancy N.

description:
Kufuya's like a hangout for people to get drunk rather than a restaurant. Waitresses seems to now a lot of customers. Maybe their regulars? $22 for all you can eat is a great price for shabu shabu. There's an all you can eat and drink option also. Parking around this restaurant sucks since it's difficult to find.

There's a few choices in broth, which spicy miso is one of them. The broth is pretty good. 

There's only two meat options here which are beef and lamb. The beef isn't frozen when it comes, they let it sit for a bit after cutting it. The lamb is still frozen pieces of meat. This is normal for thinly sliced meat since it's very difficult to cut it nonfrozen into thin slices. The slices of meet contains quite a lot of fat. Prepare for an artery clogging night.

The sauce they serve is a bit different from other shabu restaurants. It's a bit more tangy, which tastes fine. The weird thing is like other reviewers have said is they store it in a gaterade bottle and serve it from there...

Overall, a cheap all you can eat shabu shabu without much trills, but definitely worth the $22.
author: Steven B.

description:
Been going to Kufuya for a number of years now and it has remained consistent in service, food , drink, and quantity. "Quantity" you ask? Yeah...I really hate it that once you find a decent place to eat, over time the plate sizes start getting slightly smaller and smaller. Or in the realm of shabu, I hate it when they start spreading out the meat so there's less on the plate. =o

For a mere $22/person, you can gorge yourself on plate after plate of beef. I recommend the spicy miso! Yummy! And as far dipping sauce is concerned...I love that they give you ground daikon, sliced chili peppers, sliced green onion, and chopped garlic. Enough variety to make a great dipping sauce.

We have had sushi there and while it's not stellar, it is good. I say this b/c the uni was very fresh that night. =)

As for the drinks...well...what can I say about this? They have the usual...sake (hot and cold), beer, soda, water, and tea. If they didn't have sake...then I would have something to say.

There are 3 seating sections. a couple of small table that can accommodate 4 people in the front, about 5-6 tables on the right of the front door that can accommodate group from 2-8 people. And then the larger area that can accommodate groups from 2-30 or so.

They have a small parking lot in the back. "legally" you can park 4 rows and 2 deep. However, I've seen when the lot had cars parked 3 deep. Kind of risky in my mind since the 3rd car is blocking 90% of the sidewalk...which can equate out to a VERY expensive dinner once you tack on the cost of a parking ticket! =0
author: John K.

description: This review is long overdue.  I've been here a couple times now--we always get the unlimited shabu and sake.  First of all the meat is great.  Second of all, why not mix the ponzu and sesame sauce? Makes more sense to me.  I enjoy both sauces. Third of all, unlimited veggies is always a plus.  The napa cabbage always gets me. But the number 1 thing that makes me give this place 5 stars is the customer service, which is hard to come by nowadays.  Lisa and Julie are just the best.  Their hospitality, service and overall rapport they built with my party and I are just a huge plus!  Highly recommend this place!
author: Trisha Mae C.

description:
So glad my friend introduced me to this place! I never knew they served Shabu here! 

It's like Shabu House and The Pot's put together...and better. AYCE for $22.99! They provide you with the veggies, noodles (both clear and udon) and of course, the meat! Keep eating and they'll keep bringing! And that sauce...it tastes like the Japanese salad dressing in a peanut sauce consistency, but it is oh so good or as I've read in other reviews, "crack sauce."

I've also heard that for $5.00 more, you can get AYCE sushi, but I have yet to taste that. 

The Shabu is great and yes, the owners might drink with their friends (or frequent Shabu-ers), but don't be jealous because you aren't drinking with them. Just order a bottle of sake and drink with your own party and you'll never notice.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
2 strikes and you are out in my opinion when it comes to restaurants. This place has the worst service and the food is not great at all. it is actually very sub par when it comes to Japanese food in SF ! First time I went they forgot to give me the Miso Soup that I paid for.

I thought Ok maybe it was an off night (but they were not even busy that night) So I decide to give one more shot cuz it is one block from my house and it was raining. It was worse this time

I had to wait 30 minutes for a TO GO order! On top of that I actually turned around to a table near the chair they had me waiting at and saw my food just sitting there!!!! I waited to see if it just came out but I waited three minutes before I alerted them and said is this mine?

They said oh yes we are WAITING for your Tekka Makki sushi !! what do you mean waiting?! I been waiting for 30 minutes already! Anyway, horrible sub par food anyway so who cares. I will remain a loyal customer of Sappoten Japanese which is a few blocks away even during the rain storms.
author: Mike P.

description:
Came to Kufu-Ya when visiting the Legion of Honor. Its conveniently located just a few blocks away from the park entrance for the Legion of Honor.

It was deathly quiet and empty at 2pm on a Saturday (they close at 2:30pm until they reopen for dinner later). I had never been to this part of SF and felt I was nearing the end of the world.

Was hungry, the restaurant was impeccably clean and looked excellently run. 
Decided on the Unagi Donburi. It was excellent! Lots of deliciously smooth unagi on a bed of rice. Much better than I had expected.
author: Norman P.

description:
I LOVE SHABU! & for $22 dollars? What a steal!

Obviously consuming large amounts of beef is definitely unhealthy, but sometimes I just can't help it!  Charging only $22 dollars while other places charges almost $10 more for all you can eat.  Yummy.

The waitresses here are very cute, they seem to know a lot of the customers.  Which is a good thing.  

They're parking lot is small and strange.  It's a very long slot, that can fit two cars.  So if two cars park there, how does that work?  One will have to come out of their eating time to move the car?  Just wondering!
author: Tina L.

description:
This place does not feel kosher to me!  First of all the container that their "sauce" is held in is a used plastic gatorade bottle.  Seriously?  Really, you could not spend a few dollars for a reusable, clean, sauce container.  I was not feeling that!

I came here with my sister to try it out.  It was a Sunday so the place was pretty empty.  I didn't see anything wrong with this since it was a Sunday.  I liked that the menu had sushi so I ordered a california roll, but my main objective was to enjoy the all you can eat shabu shabu.

I did not enjoy anything.  The meat looked like it sat out for a while and the sauce was not what I was use to.  The california roll was also a disappointment.  The rice was so soggy!  It was a frustrating experience, and I will not be returning.
author: Lyly P.

description:
Sushi here is just ok. Decent pricing, but there is much better around considering the neighborhood.

Shabu shabu was delicious though, will probably come back for that rather than the sushi. 

There are always a handful of children around so if that bothers anybody, you've been warned.
author: Christina R.

description:
Every time we come here, I always leave with what I call "meat poisoning"... you know, from eating too much.

We like this place because it can accommodate relatively big group of us (maybe 10 people or so).  I always look for the "in-between" spots in the long tables so that I can use both pots, one on my left and the other on my right =D

As others have pointed out, spicy miso broth is great.  Don't forget to use the "get-the-fat-out-strainer" once in a while to make your meal a bit healthier.

I think it's about $22 per person for the all-you-can-eat (extra if you want sushi too, but haven't tried it).  Decent prices, good value if you are hungry.
author: Eric P.

description:
The bento box was pretty fair. The sushi reminded me of something they'd give you on a plane, but not as good as biz class. 
The service could have been more attentive.
author: Peter O.

description: Good shabu. Wish they had more veggies. Got the spicy miso a couple times. I would try it if you haven't. Stick to the shabu shabu
author: Rose M.

description:
On Thursday morning, I was in search of a restaurant in the City that could accommodate 20 people .  Here was the criteria:

- No Chinese
- No chain restaurant
- Reasonably priced
- Stroller and baby friendly
- Good food
- Decent parking

For those of you that know the City, that's a pretty tall order, especially considering how I had barely 48 hours to make this happen.  But you know what?  Sometimes I like a challenge.  

Naturally Yelp was the first place that I turned to.  Unfortunately, the search function needs SERIOUS improvement b/c when I searched under "Restaurant for large groups," EVERY FREAKING REVIEW WITH THE WORDS LARGE AND GROUPS CAME UP!  NOT WHAT I WAS LOOKING FOR GUYS.  Come on, how long has this site been up now?  Can we do something to improve and enhance the search function?

I digress.

Anyway, another MUCH SMALLER shabu restaurant came up in the search, but I asked a friend about it anyway (before I read the reviews and discovered that it was NOT good for large groups) and he suggested Kufuya instead.  I read the reviews, trusted my friend, told my BIL about it (bday boy) and he looked it up and gave me the green light. 

We were good to go.  

My friend and I walked in last night at 7:30 and there was only one other party in the restaurant which made me nervous (this worked to our advantage since the owner/manager (?) Julie and her staff gave us their undivided attention).  Soon after the rest of our group showed up, as did other customers (which made me feel better) and we were there for close to three hours enjoying the delicious shabu shabu.

I would definitely go with the consensus and order the all you can eat with spicy miso broth. You get a large plate of thinly sliced meat, another plate full of spinach, mushrooms, tofu, glass and udon noodles, little side dishes of green onions, minced garlic and fiery red peppers that made grown men cry.  MMMMM MMMMMMMM.  For $22, how can you beat?    And for an extra  $10, you can drink all the beer and sake you want, too.  Sweet - next time.   

I don't know what is in their sauce, but there has to be crack inside b/c it is sooooooooooooo freakin' good. (I must've said that at least five times last night.)  In fact, I want some right now.   Honestly, I've never been "that" impressed with shabu shabu, but Kufuya's sauce stands out amongst the rest.  

We never had to ask for more meat.  Every time our plates were empty, someone replenished them.  It was great.  All in all, I highly recommend this place for large and small groups.  You can tell that the people running this restaurant are good people that care about their customers and I really appreciate that.  

We found street parking b/c we had drinks at Tee Off before dinner, but as some of the other reviews have stated, there is a private lot on 34th Ave.  Another huge plus in the City.

I was THRILLED that we found a place with such short notice.  Even better that it was highly recommended by one of my best friends (thx, C).  Good food, good price, great service - I will definitely be back!
author: Christie X.

description: All you can eat Shabu is a thumbs down for small selection of side items.  The dipping sauce was too vinegary. Will not go there again for the price paid.
author: Priscilla K.

description: if your looking for a good price, great food, awsome service then look no further,  this is the place for you and they will try there best in making your anything spices if you request it, you have to try jackie's spicy tuna hand roll, all in all best place to go
author: Sonny C.

description: I liked the food here, it was fairly affordable, but I felt like I sorta got what I paid for.  It was affordable so it tasted affordable... not necessarily cheap, but just affordable.  I didn't eat too much while I was here could be the reason why i didn't enjoy it like as much as the people giving reviews do.
author: John H.

description:
The location strikes you as the most awkwardly standing, 3.5 star restaurant way out in the richmond boonies. 

This place has completely changed itself to shabu shabu from a sushi joint; you can tell immediately that shabu wasn't it's first attempt by how the tables are setup and how the heat is done through portable gas.

Two major things that give this place a decent rating: 1. Service, 2. Their shabu sauce. Super friendly, always attentive, the staff were super friendly to our rowdy group of guests. The shabu sauce, although given with a limit of your choice amounts of green onion and raddish; is pretty mouth watering.

To gain the fifth and maybe fourth star for this all-you-can eat shabu shabu, they'll probably need to redecorate (out with the portable gas) and start serving more choices/condiments with their sauce.

I would come back often.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
THE MEAT:  Ditto on the prior review that said the meat was inconsistent.  Some plates were fresh and some were frozen.  However, in my opinion, the frozen meat wasn't too bad quality.  It just didn't look as nice because it had been frozen.

THE VEGGIES:  I particularly liked that their vegetable plate had spinach.  Aside from that the veggies were fresh and delectable.

THE SAUCE:  Loved the bowl of brown sauce that everyone got because it had a peanutty, vinegaretty tang.

THE SERVICE:  Service was a little slow.  There were many moments during the meal that we had to wait to eat because we ran out of meat or veggies.  That doesn't work so good when I'm trying to get the bang for my buck on all you can eat shabu shabu :(  Too much lag time means too much time for my stomach to tell my brain that I'm full!

I will admit there is the possibility that they were slow because we had a party of 24 people, and my friend --- the birthday boy that does everything at the last minute --- had made reservations late in the afternoon before our meal.

I will say that the waitress was super nice, and stayed nice and funny even as we started to get progressivley more drunk and belligerent :)
author: Christina L.

description: The best shabu place in the bay area! Staff is always friendly and the homemade dipping sauce is addicting. Great for big groups or even two people. We usually come here for birthdays but my fiance and I come here often just to grab dinner at a great price. Comes out to about $22 for all you can eat beef and lamb along with veggies and noodles, they always keep your plates full. Can't get any better than that!
author: Ariel N.

description: Good shabu place. Could use more veggies and the beef is middle of the line. For the price all you can eat it is good. The ponzu sauce is actually really good. Parking suks....
author: King L.

description: Kufuya has excellent service most of the time, and accommodates their customers to the best of their abilities. As for the food, I can only speak on the lamb and beef shabu with spicy miso sauce which is damn good. Their all you can eat shabu for 24$ a head is OFF THE HOOK! I can clean off 5 plates on my own and they probably hate me for it. Either way they are always friendly and usually check back on us appropriately. Ive been here over a dozen times and will continue to come every 2-3 weeks or so.
author: Dan B.

description:
This is my first time straying away from Shabu House!
WAIT: No wait on a Fri night for a party of 4
FOOD: Meat was presented nicely. Definitely doesn't taste as good at Shabu House's kobe beef, but that is to be expected. The main thing that stood out was the SAUCE. Omg. Shabu House and Kufuya need to partner up.  Can't tell what is in the sauce base, but it is tangy and thick. Also, beware of their chili peppers. I only put 4 and it was definitely enough heat. Unfortunately, my macho friend decided to put 1 spoonful and ending up choking on it.
VALUE: Very cheap AYCE shabu place, just a couple bucks more than other places for non AYCE.
SERVICE: Very attentive!!! It was impressive for an AYCE place. Servers came by to refill our cups and replaced the meat plates BEFORE we even asked.
OVERALL: Great value for the food and service. However, Shabu House wins when it comes to soup broth and meat quality.
author: Echo L.

description: I have to say the best shabu place in San Francisco. Me and my girlfriend are big on customer service and this place provides what we demand. HAHA I simply love their miso broth and home made dipping sauce. Price isn't bad for all the food you can eat. Honestly I haven't been to a place that tops kufuya yet. Even though its not too close to were I live its worth the drive for me to come here every time. Always leave with a smile of satisfaction on my face. That and a lot of food coma.
author: Joey P.

description: Now that I have had both sushi and Shabu here I can weird a review! Both are solid in terms of taste, portion, and price. I love coming here for shabu and getting the spicy midi broth. I get the all you can eat beef and thoroughly enough stuffing my face. It's a great local place that is convenient to where I live with parking! My whole family loves this place and we have been several times. My sister and I came for sushi and got 3 rolls abs a tempura udon to share. It was so much food we had about 70% of each roll left to take home. We started with complimentary miso soup, salad and then split the tempura udon. The broth was deliciously mushroom flavored and the noodles enough to stuff two girls with the tempura too. Great spot that I recommend.
author: Annie P.

description: love this place! definitely come early for the AYCE hot pot! service can be a little slow because it gets crowded, but the quality of the meat is pretty good, and i especially like their dipping sauce. i always leave super stuffed and happy.
author: Sabrina L.

description:
the good...shabu shabu..kufuya in deep space nine outer richmond sector...full-flavored chicken broth or spicy miso....spicy miso recommended for lamb...straying from $twenty-two all-you-can-eat and a la carte smarter budget...plate of vegetables and noodles...two orders of beef slivers sharing for three...with additional rolls and sides enough to be full....chicken broth, beef, noodles and vegetables....fine play of simmer, cool and dip....tangy seasame sauce great....great broth for udon and noodles...standard beef and average....flavorful shabu shabu experience....

the bad...rolls and standard japanese sushi menu....rolls pressed hard...solid blocks of rice and fish...worst chicken karage...reminding of "popcorn chicken"...deep-fried chicken scraps....
author: Hen A.

description:
Came here for dinner with a friend of mine. I heard about this place from another yelper (thanks petri y.!). I did some light research for this place before going in, but I admit it was pretty good. Even better for all you can eat shabu for $22!

Of course, that's what we ordered - Shabu Shabu! My friend was almost going to get some sushi and a bento box, but I sweet talked her out of it. She admit it was a good call after everything was said and done.

The order came with veggies (cabbage, spinach, tofu, mushrooms), noodles (udon and soba) and, of course, beef and lamb shabu, some green onion garnish and 'Crack' sauce. The beef was great. Just the right amount of fat to meat ratio. I did notice it was cut thinner than most places... if that can actually be measured. Melted like butter in my mouth. The lamb was good too, but we're not the biggest fan of lamb, so we only had one order. Was still good though. This was all in a spicy miso broth. I was very satisfied with my meal. The 'crack' sauce worked well with the meat.

Service was pretty good!! The meat kept coming out without us even asking. So cool. We had about four plates of beef, one plate of lamb and 1.5 servings of veggies. The servers were very nice, but it did slip a bit as our meal ended. A group of people (maybe friends of the staff?) came in and it took us sometime to get the check and get out. Thus four stars.

Other than that, this place was cool. Nothing too fancy, but made my day. I'd go back for sure... maybe they'll get 5 next time around. =D
author: Tim S.

description:
My bf and I came here to try shabu shabu for the first time on our anniversary. The deal was great, the food and bottomless teapot were incredible and our server was helpful, attentive, and really nice without hovering or abandoning us. 
This was a perfect experience with awesome food, great service, and no waiting.
author: Zuchinno B.

description:
I've been to a few Japanese restaurants owned by chinese and it wasn't really great. Now this place? Owner is Chinese but the point is they put in effort to make the food taste great! My friends and I had shabu shabu with both the spicy and regular soup and MY god...It is off the hook! I don't know if they add crack or whatever in it but it is much MUCH better than most shabu shabu restaurants.
Julie was very fun to chat with and very cool. She and her team provided excellent service. I can't wait to go back. Just FU#King fantastic.
author: Baylon Y.

description: I almost didn't write a review because I don't want everyone to know how good it is! I came here for my birthday dinner with friends and family, and we had a great time.  This place is really fun.  The spicy miso broth is excellent, and while the service may have been a little slow, we were 6 hungry people who would go through those plates of meat in a matter of minutes, so I don't hold it against them!  We were set up with two hotpots, two baskets of veggies/noodles and two plates of meat at a time for a table of six.  We stayed until the restaurant was closing and ate and drank very much.  The sesame sauce is very, very good.  Plus, there's parking!
author: L C.

description: Tried the Beautiful Lady Roll tonight (unagi & avocado topped with hamachi)...fantastic!! My new favorite roll! Haven't tried the shabu yet, but it's always very popular so looking forward to it soon...
author: Peachez Z.

description:
Best EFFIN place for Shabu Shabu in town!!!!
Great Service
Good prices
I just come here for Shabu Shabu and booze so dont know how the other stuff tastes and dont care
Shabu 4 life !!! WestSide!!!
author: Eric S.

description:
This is definitely a better deal that Shabu House.  For $22 you can eat all the beef or lamb you can possibly eat.  

The beef is fresh and the service amazing.  They got me set up in a matter of minutes from ordering and the round of beef were never-ending.  By the time I grab the last slice, another plate takes it place.   After 5 plate, I had to wave the white flag.  

Good food, good service for a good price.
author: Jessica T.

description:
My roommates got the shabu shabu, I did not...but they left quite full!
I got the dinner bento box filled with chicken katsu, potstickers and beef teriyaki, soup, rice and salad and a large Sapporo...all for about $20! Pretty delicious and filling. The service was great and on the big screen they were showing the A's vs. Giants game...

Watching the A's dominate the Giants with good people and eating delicious fried things...they knew exactly what I wanted!
author: Lauren S.

description: Overpriced, but if you can get past that then they have an extensive menu, good food and great service. I'm a big fan of the beef udon.
author: Chancelor D.

description:

The day before I went I called and asked what time they open for lunch on Saturday, they said 11:30 A.M.  On Saturday my father arrived early and saw what he thought was the owner and asked what time are you opening, he said in 5 minutes.  I arrived minutes after that.  My father and I then tried the door and it was locked.  So we waited til almost noon, knocked to no response.  At 12:15 I called the restaurant and asked when are you opening for lunch, he said not yet.  At 12:45 I called again and asked when are you opening for lunch, the response was NOT YET rudely.  My father and I waited til 1:30 to no luck.  The reason we waited so long was because I am in a wheelchair due to an amputation of my right leg, which makes getting around very difficult so we waited.  I am going to tell people not to patronize this place!  Kharma will come back to bite you in the a**.
author: Robert G.

I felt like we were being kinda rushed, with only 2 servers.  Im here with 20+ ppl and they brought us sesame sauce but no more ponzu? For a group of 20+ they only gave us 3 bowls of ponzu. Normally at other hot pot or shabu places would no doubt provide all the sauces. I love extra sauce. Also why do they serve sesame sauce out of a Gatorade plastic bottle? Don't they know you are not allowed to reuse plastic bottles like that? I'm just saying. Overall this place was great, but maybe if you don't come with a large group.
author: Harry T.

description: The price for all you can eat shabu shabu is affordable and quality is not bad. They have this brown dipping sauce which is a cross between ponzu and peanut/seasame sauce. I am not that big of a fan of the sweet peanut sesame sauce so i was hesitant about this place. But their sauce is so well balanced and flavorful! Not sweet at all..just deliciousness! But they also offer the traditional ponzu if you like as well. This place definitely satisfies my shabu craving if i can't make it to mums.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I must come here at least one or twice a month for their Shabu. 
Great prices, great service and very nice people.
author: Jenn T.

I never pick this place usually my friend jason  tells me to meet him here.

author: DOM d.

description: All you can eat shabu? Amazing meats? Good Service? What's not to love. Been here a couple of times with my girlfriend and we honestly love this place. The service was pretty amazing. Every time we would finish anything they would immediate come over and ask us if we wanted more. The prices were very reasonable for an all you can eat shabu house and the food was spectacular. Honestly, I would come back again in a heartbeat.
author: Michael N.

description:
Kufu-ya is not a Japanese restaurant I would go for sushi only because I've never had sushi there and according to my fellow Yelpers reviews on the restaurant's sushi wasn't impressive or even encouraging. My friend brought me to Kufu-ya for the Japanese shabu-shabu dinner. We walked in on a Thursday evening and the restaurant was almost empty. That's usually not a good sign for any restaurants, but we were there for shabu-shabu and we went for it anyway.

We ordered the all-you-can-eat (not buffet) shabu-shabu for two and chose the spicy miso as our soup base. Our other choice was the chicken broth. The server took no time to get us setup with a table top portable stove and all the shabu-shabu utensils and condiments of miso based dipping sauces, minced garlic, scallions, finely grated daikon and slices of tiny Thai chili peppers. She then turned around and came back with two handful of platters filled with food. 

For $22, we got (2 rounds of the below):
- a huge pot of spicy miso soup that is rich, flavorful and hearty
- a huge platter of thinly sliced beef (about 15 slices)
- a plate of thinly sliced lamb (about 15 slices)
- a large bowl of napa cabbage, spinach, tofu cubed, button and shiitake mushrooms, udon and vermicelli noodles. 

All the ingredients were very fresh, the meats are bright red and the vegetables items were clean. They also give you their homemade dipping sauce which was really delicious. As soon as the soup started boiling, we dove right in and cooked away. We may be two skinny girls, but we ordered a second round of everything and ate it all. Did I mention $22 p/p is all-you-can-eat? 

A shabu-shabu dinner is nothing fancy, but it sure is a lot fun to be able to cook your own food table top and while you wait for your food to be cooked, you catch up with friends on the latest gossips. It is especially tasty on a cool SF night and you get a good dinner that warms you up and send you home full and happy. The only thing missing in this meal is desserts, but we were so full that we could do without it. I definitely recommend Kufu-ya for the Japanese shabu-shabu.. After all, how can one go wrong with this $22 all you can eat meal?
author: Gourmet Princessa L.

description: After coming back here for probably another 10 more times, I must say that the service has improved a lot. The workers are super friendly and attentive. Whenever I do AYCE shabu they never let us run out of food unless I tell them I'm full. It's still one of my favorite shabu place after years of coming. I think it's fair to update this restaurant with a 5 star now.
author: Connie T.

description: This is by far my favorite place to get hot pot. The customer service is excellent and the food is always delicious. I love the dipping sauce and the broth.The people working there are very friendly and always seem to be laughing or smiling. I've been here many times and never have been disappointed by the food or the customer service.
author: Stephanie G.

description: If I could give them 10 stars I would!  I love this place, best Shabu Shabu out of all the ones I tried !  I purposely went out and tried Shabu places all around and used Kufuya as the basis for my expectations. I swear to you NONE come close to the combination of absolute Best Homemade Shabu sauce, and perfectly cut beef ohhh the most tender out there~!  Julie Lisa and their Brother"uh oh I forgot his name haha sorry....They have also the BEST service out there!!!  A++++ from me !!!
author: Damien F.

description:
Never had shabu shabu before coming to this place. Wasn't really sure what to expect since I'm not exactly a fan of having to work to eat my food. However I was pleasantly surprised!  Got the spicy miso broth as our base and loads of veggie, noodles, beef and lamb.  The sauce was really excellent as well!  I felt that it truly enhanced the flavor of the food. 

2 thumbs way up!! I plan on patronizing this place many times in the future!
