author: jason g.

description: They have all you can eat shabu shabu for $22. The food was not bad. Service was okay. They didn't really do a good job refilling our drinks.
author: Forest T.

description:
The Occasion: My boyfriend's friend's birthday

The whole restaurant was reserved for his guests. Service was good! We were catered by these young and friendly waitresses. They kept our veggie + sliced beef on the roll. Everyone had Shabu Shabu. It's similar to hot pot, but the Japanese version? Comes with broth + veggie plate (spinach, napa cabbage, udon, clear noodles, shitake mushroom, regular mushrooms) + thinly sliced rib eye. Not too much variety, but I thoroughly enjoyed the food. Their sauce is actually THE thing that makes everything tastes super delicious? Maybe I was too buzzed and too hungry to care. I think I chowed down like 6-7 bowls. The chilled Sake was good. I've never taken that many sakes before. I was buzzed, but not drunk. Good stuff though. We had a great time!

Why 3 stars? I asked myself, if I would come back here. Though the food was good, but lacked variety of what we can put into our Shabu Shabu, that covers under the buffet cost. I think I'd go to Hot Pot place (paying just a couple buck more) to get all you can eat seafood! Beside vegetables and noodles aren't expensive. The only expensive item was the thinly sliced rib eye.
author: MT D.

description:
I'm a big fan of shabu house and their all you can eat all you can drink option. So when my friend decided to have his b-day party here, I was a little apprehensive. 
Given that the price of all you can eat shabu here is $22 (you can get all you can eat sushi on top of this for 6 more dollars) and that the price of shabu house all you can eat is $30, its definitely a good deal here. The shabu shabu was still very tasty. They only let you have beef and lamb however. I could kind of tell that the quality wasn't AS good as shabu house as far as the meat goes (pretty fatty!), but the spicy miso broth was still very good! Its kind of strange they don't serve you rice, but that just means more room for meat, right? Even though the sauce that they give you is pretty good, I'm used to getting the two different sauces. Overall, the shabu was very good and I would come again. I still think shabu house tastes better. 
The service is very nice and they helped us store cake/cupcakes for the birthday surprise. Oh, and its less busy so that's also a plus. They have a parking lot right behind the restaurant as well which is very convenient.
author: Tim B.

description:
The food gets a 3.8....What puts this place on the 4 Star mark is the restaurants parking lot, which is very hard to find on GEARY for any type business in SF and they deliver!!!!! 

Their Roll Fantasia menu is a no brain-er and though I have never had the Shabu Shabu it looks incredible and seems like that's what everybody  sitting around you is partaking in.

This is no hot-spot nor is there a dress-code, it is a I feel like good  sushi Sunday night kinda place.
author: Frankie F.

description: I'll all for family owned restaurants. I enjoyed the shabu shabu, service was a bit slow and the all you can eat sushi was okay, we only ended up eating one roll each but the idea of it was a lot of fun! will try it again.
author: Tiff W.

description: First time here.  It started with great tasting green tea, but went downhill from there.  Mediocre bento dinners.  You can get better bento dinners elsewhere and cheaper.  I was expecting more at $11.  Chicken and beef teriyaki are soft and tender but could use more flavor. But includes soup and salad at least.   Service is sub par from the beginning to end.  Our tea was not kept filled quickly enough and even took a while just to get the bill when requested.
author: Ronald K.

description: Thinly sliced beef, melts in my mouth, very tender and fresh. Love the dipping sauce, perfect amount of tangy and spicy. Spicy miso broth base is the way to go, pairs with the sauce perfectly. Lamb is not as tender as the beef, but still very fresh and thinly cut. Veggie choices are low, but $22 for AYCE beef, lamb, veggies, and noodles is a great deal. Large bottle beer only $5 too. I would come back again for a casual homy shabu outing in a heartbeat
author: Hao L.

description:
Ok, regardless of the quality of food (its all you can eat folks), cmon now, for $22 (or an extra $10 for all you can drink added), its definitely worth the price. Now, don't get me wrong, I'm typically anti-buffet/allyoucaneat, but I definitely had an enjoyable time here. Heres a tip, have a few sake shots/beers before you start eating and all will be well. I think the food is typical for an all you can eat, a veggie plate that includes leafy greens, noodles/udon, mushroom, and tofu, and then you can have beef and lamb slices. Again let me reiterate the $10 all you can drink on top of the food. 

While the food was what I expected for this type of joint, the reason I really enjoyed this place was the service. Our waitress was so much fun, she kept bringing out food/drinks. Typically, for all you can eats, they are somewhat stingy, but not here. Great attitude, and even drank with us. The waitress (I think her name was julia) even spilled beer on me and while unpleasant, I was fine with it because she was so interactive with our group. They eventually kicked us out long after their official close, but were very accommodating in letting us stay past hours and bringing us food/drinks to the extent the kitchen could provide (they were closed by the time we were done and trying to close their register). 

This was my first time here and while I didn't try anything outside their normal shabu, I would highly suggest getting the all you can eat shabu and definitely adding the all you can drink for an enjoyable time. I would prefer this over Shabu House, which I've been to several times, because its cozy with great service and the food is just as good.
author: Lawrence T.

description: Great place. Great shabu. Awesome price! Love the people here and the shabu sauce that they make. so YUMMY! If I could, I would come here every week to eat shabu. ;)
author: Jo L.

description: Best shabu & great prices! Must get the lamb!! The staff is super friendly and attentive which makes the whole experience a must repeat
author: Case B.

description:
shabu shabu is great! waiters are great!!
i have a 3 year old and it's nice b/c the restaurant is small and it's a little bit noisy, so if my daughter gets loud, it ok. 
the price is very reasonable.
parking is ok, not great, but they make it work.
author: Rumi P.

description: We came because Shabu House had 0 openings on Saturday night and I wasn't willing to wait for god knows how long for a table. It's further out in the Richmond and parking is a bit difficult since it's so residential. Everyone inside was speaking Cantonese, so I don't think it is Japanese owned. They have all u can eat shabu for $22 and sushi and bentos. The spicy miso broth is not as spicy as Shabu House. Their veggie selection is not as great at Shabu House, but for the price, you can't really go wrong!
author: Natalie S.

description:
I'm excited that fall is coming back b/c I love the cold weather...cold weather = shabu weather! Now if only it would stay cold & rainy, rather than rainy, wet, cold, warm, hot -_- I'm so irritated by the weather change!

And what better place to indulge in shabu than at Kufuya. Now they offer lamb in addition to the beef, the option to choose spicy miso broth or regular chicken broth. But what's still good is the sauce..ohyah..and some chopped garlic w/the sauce rocks too!


*sigh*
author: Jocelyn W.

description:
Shabu shabu all you can eat is 22 per person, and with the quality of their thinly sliced beef, lamb, house special dipping sauce, and soup base, it is very cheap in my opinion.
The service is fine. I had really enjoyed my time there. Also, it is nice to have a private parking lot around the corner.
author: Mike S.

description:
The four stars is really for the shabu shabu  only. Their sushi is decent. Their udon is...scant. I ordered the udon once and the udon had like a total of 12 noodles in it. And it cost $8! It's really a 3-star restaurant if you take into account their other items, but since I only go here for shabu I'll give them four. 

All you can eat shabu for $20! Authentic, ShmAuthentic, I haven't found a better deal in the city than that! All you can eat beef, veggies/tofu, and noodles. They're pretty attentive about bringing out the plates of meat. We try to eat at least 5-6 to get our money's worth. They also give you a dipping sauce that's so tasty that you have to ask for sauce refills. 

Parking is also not bad. If there's no street parking, they have a little lot to the side on 34th Ave. You might have to block in somebody else's car in the lot b/c the lot isn't very wide but two cars can fit "stacked" into each space. But everybody's really cooperative about it and  I think it works out just dandy. 
-1 star for such a limited all you can eat selection, but hey it's cheap!
good shabu, cheap, near my house, parking available = 4 stars!

oh and you WILL smell like shabu after you eat there.
author: Jessie C.

description: The food is good and the staff is AMAZING. Julie and Lisa always make us feel welcome - even when it's a full house and our toddlers are dumping rice on the floor!
author: Edith S.

description:
WORST SERVICE EVER!!! We went with a group of 10 people and the waitress seemed like she did not know how to handle a big party at all. We even called several days in advance to make reservations to let them know such a big party would be coming in.  Food came out one at a time.  Several of my friends did not even get their meal until more than 1hr and a half later.  We had to constantly remind them of what we ordered, even though they wrote everything down.  We had to request for tea and chopsticks a couple of times before they returned with the items.  The waitress was rude and gave attitude when we tried to get her attention.  She asked us to speak louder if we wanted to be heard.  

A lot of us ordered the dinner box special which comes with SOUP AND SALAD, but was not given to us until we asked about it AFTER we finished our dinner boxes.  The waitress's only response was "oh i forgot".  Several of my friends who sat at another table did not even get theirs at all.  

To top it off, at the end of the night, 2 and a half hours later, when everyone finally got their meal and was ready to pay and leave, the waitress asked for the payment minutes after she gave the bill to us.  Can she have been any more rude?!?  We really wish we didn't have to pay the gratuity which was already included in the total because of our large party.  

The service was BAD, the food was not that great, and came out way too SLOW!!! The wait was ridiculous, considering it wasn't even a full house!!!  I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE (especially if that RUDE waitress is working there).

However, you may feel free to check it out on your own, but I know my friends and I won't be returning there.
author: D C.

description:
I would give this place 6 stars if i could.  The service was impeccable and the food was DELICIOUS!  

I'm a big shabu shabu fan and this place really does it for me.  The meat is tender and they give you lamb if you ask for it as well.  It's the perfect blend of sesame/ponzu, daikon, chili, green onion, and garlic.  

They don't skimp on anything.  The beef always comes as soon as your plate is empty.  The servers are very attentive and extremely friendly.  My only gripe is the parking situation.  You have to double park in small parking lot which is a pain but it is WELL WORTH IT!  

The drive, the wait, the anticipation.  It's definitely one of the best meals I've ever had in San Francisco.
author: Kristie G.

description:
My friends and I decided to stop by this place for our usual Friday night dinner since it's close to a mutual friend's place and one of us knows the people who run the place. I figured it'd be worth a shot since I was in the mood for some Japanese food. I think the unfortunate part was that although they were nice enough to reserve a table for us, there was a rather large birthday party in session.

Because of that, the service was moderately slow, but we were fairly patient. Besides, we understood what was going on. Still... one of my friends didn't receive his order for another ten or fifteen minutes after we all got ours, and when we got the (rather expensive) bill we realized they had botched it up and we almost wound up paying about $20 more than we were supposed to. Good thing we caught it.

To be fair, the food here is pretty good. Between the six of us we got a bit of everything - sushi, donburi, udon, and combination bento boxes, all of which was well made and tasted authentic. The price was a bit much for the quantity though, in my opinion. Definitely not a place I'd want to come on a daily basis, less it burns a hole in my wallet.

In terms of the space, it's very well designed, with a wide open central area and a few semi-enclosed spaces for hot pots and smaller groups. It looks like it's recently been remodeled too; either that or they just keep everything in really nice condition. The decor is pretty quaint as well.

I'm sure I'd be willing to give Kufuya another shot, especially considering the testimony of my friends who've been here multiple times, as well as some of the positive reviews on Yelp. My experience was probably unfortunate rather than purely a bad one, but I can't justify giving them more than three stars for now. Sorry!
author: Will C.

description: Finally had the opportunity to try this place and I was pleased with their shabu. AYCE yeeee! The spicy miso broth was a bit spicy but good.  I just wished they had regular ponzu dipping sauce. Rather than one(i believe it was the peanut sauce but i cant be sure) The meat was not consistent, there were times where we had very thinly sliced beef slices but then i guess they were busy so the meat was thicker and chewy.  I would come again for their shabu and perhaps even try their sushi too! P.S. parking is a bitch so you usually have to park far away.
author: Ann L.

description:
not bad. not great. 
i read the reviews and was sO excited, i was thoroughly disappointed. i think the broth wasnt that great. the beef was pretty good though. but when u dip it in a broth that tastes like nothing its not gonna get any better.. (i dont know maybe they had a bad day?) 

oysters were ok. not amazing.

all in all. not impressed. (id rather go back to shabu house)
author: Lisa N.

description:
Not quite the worst sushi I've ever had, but pretty close. First of all, there is a $25 minimum for delivery. Now, I'm a big sushi fan, but even I can't eat $25 worth of sushi in one sitting. When I finally had someone to order with, we finally ordered 2 chirashis and an A's roll. The roll was mediocre, and the chirashi was LAME-O. It was actually the lamest chirashi I think I've ever had. There was only 1 of each type of sashimi (a total of 6 or 7 peices of fish in the entire dish!), and it didn't seem very fresh. The tako tasted like it came out of a van de kamp's box.... 

I think I'll stick to Sakura. Their portions seem to be shrinking, but at least the food is good!
author: Amy B.

description:
I've been going to Kufuya for several years and its always very satisfying.
The Shabu-shabu is the specialty and it takes a little practice but is super easy once you know the tricks.  Put all the vegetables in first, then the noodles, then the beef.  That way the items that need longer to cook get done and the meat which takes a second isn't too over cooked.  Julie, who is the main waitress/hostess/manager is very good and works very hard. She and members of her extended family own the joint.  The sushi is just fine and the chicken wings are the best.  The prices are very reasonable. There's parking in the back and also, btw, down 34th Avenue at the Lincoln Golf course.  I give 5 stars because it is an all around good deal and never disappoints for what it is.
author: Sarah H.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday venue yesterday. It was crackin! Her friends knew the workers and so we had endless sake or until I buzzed out. There were 30 of us. The service was great! We had shabu shabu and there's pork, beef or spicy miso broth. We chose pork. The dipping sauce was good!! They gave us a plate of lamb meat per table, and that's how I lost my non-lamb-eating virginity..
author: Vivian L.

description:
I definitely stuffed my face with their endless plates of meat and veggies.  Very good customer service, even seeing how busy they are.  They accommodated our changing party size, random arrival times and random side orders beautifully.

Oh, and good tea.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Poor, poor Kufu-ya... a Geary sushi house pushed to the edges of Outer Richmond, when all its Inner Richmond and 20-something Ave. brothers laugh and celebrate. I feel your pain, Kufu-Ya. For those living nearby, take heart that another Japanese restaurant besides the wonderful Oyaji sits nearby. This place has some respectable food--both sushi and the cooked variety. The first few times I went here, the place was nearly empty, but tonight it was bustling--meaning I might go here more often, since I don't like eating in solitude.

Prepare yourself for salty miso soup, wonderfully sweet dressing on the house salads, chewy chicken teriyaki, butter-like salmon nigiri, average-grade tuna sashimi, splendid yet malformed california rolls, and a variety of other hit or miss items. The deluxe sushi box is $13.99 for three choices.

Hang in there, Kufu-ya.
author: Patrick G.

description:
The shabu shabu is definitely what you need to go for. I've only had the beef plate (the thinnest slices of beef I've ever had). It is delicious, especially on a cold winter day. 

Red Dragon Roll and Volcano Roll were pretty good. 

They have customer parking on 34th street (in the back of the restaurant).
author: Joyce L.

description: delicious shabu shabu, the waiter/waitress are always coming by to see if we need anything n super friendly. it was busy tonight and parking is a bitch around this area.
author: Linda A.

description:
My FAVORITE shabu place in San Francisco!  The food is fresh, price is decent and the service is fantastic!!!!!  To top it off, it has its own parking lot (doesn't hold too many cars, but still!).

This place is much better than Coriya and has more food selection than the Shabu House.
author: Karina L.

description:
First time eating here, very pleasant experience. Gone with a party of about 30, and the restaurant accommodated nicely. I was able to try raw oysters(good, but not my personal favorite thing to eat), Mountain roll(good, nice presentation), and the Shabu-Shabu.

The Shabu Shabu consists of all you can eat vegatables, noodles, and beef for the price of $22. I was really skeptical at first, because personally that's a lot of money for some beef and vegetables. However, it was absolutely delicious provided the dipping sauce!

If you've never been to a shabu shabu, TRY IT! I will definetely bring my friends here to try one day.
author: Austin N.

description:
Shabu-shabu'ed again over the weekend!
SoOOoOooOOoOOooO YUMMY AND GOOD!!! Great for the cold season. The meat's fresh, they get it daily!  The sauce, mmmmmmmm.

Parking... plus!
author: Natalie G.

description:
This place is close to my home so I love being able to walk to a sushi restaurant. It's nothing spectacular but it's got a very cozy, hole-in-the-wall feeling and the staff are incredibly sweet. Prices are good.  The shabu shabu looks really fun though i've never tried it. If you order the veggie udon as a vegetarian, get the miso broth instead of the chicken broth.

One thing, though, and maybe I'm wrong... but I think they like to put us gringos in the front corner of the restaurant, right next the door. I'm curious if other people find that too.
author: Jen L.

description:
I order from here a lot and they are SO nice and the sushi is delicious! The prices are low considering its sushi and its great. 

Fast delivery too! I've eaten inside once and its a nice quiet place but if you're looking for a "hot spot" I'm not sure this is it. Its better if you're looking for a relaxing time with awesome food. Its PERFECT if you're craving sushi at home and want it ASAP for a decent price.

I'm a big fan and you should be too.
author: Lindsay M.

description:
love this place! 

great service.
good food. 

nom nom nom!!
author: Valerie N.

description: Rinse, lather, and repeat.  When eating at Kufuya, you are dipping the same type of meat, into the same sauce, back into the same pot over and over again.  Not much variety.   Nevertheless, they were showing the Giants game so it deserves 5 stars.
author: Doug F.

description: ALL YOU CAN EAT SHABU SHABU FOR $22--hell yeah, I'm a fan.  I'm not saying the meat is high quality, but it's delish enough.
author: C L.

description:
Been going to this neighborhood joint for about 4 years now. Was first recommended by a friend.  Sushi is average, about on par with Kitaro, probably the King of these low-priced non-Japanese (owner/operator) and the many of sushi joints lined up along Geary Blvd. 

Keep coming back b/c the w/ staff members are friendly (service, which is avg but not great). They seem to remember what we like, which counts for alot in the restaurant business. The spacious is roomy and bathrooms are clean. Plus is the free parking.

I will have to say one negative experience: my sushi order, which was served to me at 6:30, was still icy cold. Just can let this stuff happen in the restaurant biz:(

What? You want perfection, go to McDonalds! 
Otherwise, that's why we love & frequent our small businesses: b/c the owners work their tails off and don't we all like different?

Anyways, wish Kufuya well!
author: will l.

description:
Came here on a Thursday evening (7-8ish). We parked in their parking lot and were seated right away. There were probably about five other parties there. 

We had the all you can eat shabu (beef and lamb) with the spicy miso broth. Two plates of beef, one of lamb and the noodles and veggies were brought out to start. We polished that off fairly quickly. After a few minutes of waiting, we had to waive a staff member over to get refills on the food. And unfortunately, had to repeat this process the entire evening. Had there been more people, I would have understood, but there wasn't. 

By the middle/end of the evening, what was once a flavorful broth turned into a pot, and bowls, of grease. We skimmed the grease the best we could, but to no avail. As the last person in our group finished eating the rest of us watched as the greasy film turned into blocks of fat. 

Overall an okay experience, but probably won't be returning too soon. Maybe I'll try a different shabu place.
author: K H.

description: This is close to my work, and me and my coworkers have been going here for years. They have good bento box options (I usually get the salmon shio with spicy tuna roll), and the staff is always really friendly and attentive. The fish seem fresh, they are quick, and our orders are always correct. I only wish they had better sushi lunch options. Have not tried the Shabu, but will have to for dinner when working late at the office.
author: Jayson J.

description:
Go for friendly service, free parking, and for the kid friendly environment. Food is good enough, not memorable but for families the atmosphere is pro-kids and this really is inviting for families.

Food-wise, as long as the sushi is not ice-cold, im a happy camper. Yes, my sushi standards are not very high, but, stuff gets expensive and who knows how far the fish in front of you has traveled.

Love sushi, but if i ate it til my heart's content, would further damage the dire condition of our fisheries!
author: w l.

description: Not sure where all the great reviews come from.  Could be that there's less competition in that block or that most folks have Shabu Shabu.  We has the salmon teriyaki (kids liked it; it was decent) and a bunch of sushi -- nigiri and rolls.  The spicy tuna was pretty awful - tasted like it was filled with the lower quality tuna mince and the rest of the sushi wasn't up to par; definitely the worst sushi we've had in San Francisco.  There's just way too many amazing places around to go here for sushi.
author: Scot G.

description:
".....oh, no."  That was the first thing I thought when I saw their sign.  You know, I can read Kanji (Chinese character read in Japanese way).  In Kanji, the sign says "FUKU_YA, but it says "KUFU_YA" in English sign.  

If you know this, do you still wanna go?  Well, I did.  I did several times.  They have a really good lunch special.  Good deal indeed.  Nothing stands out either good or bad except the price.

I haven't tried Shabu shabu there.  It sounds very good, seems like a good deal, too. Rather than that, why do I wanna go for dinner there?  No, I don't.  They are pricey for outer Richmond, especially for unauthentic Japanese restaurants.

Does anybody have a gut to tell them "you guys should be 'FUKU_YA' not 'Kufu-ya'"?
author: Mike N.

description:
Well its not the best shabu but its not bad. Great service, but I was the only one there. I was brought my second plate of beef just as I put the last piece of my first in to cook, nice.

I tried so sashmi because everyone in the reviews said it sucked. I would give it about 6 out of ten. Good but not totally fresh, 2 dollars a piece for what thats worth.

Nothing special about this place besides there lot with five double parking spaces but really i dont go to a restaurant for the parking so who cares. Basically hit it up if your crippled becuase you might get a parking space other wise skip it.
author: howard h.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!! Everyone is very friendly and food is ALWAYS FRESH!! I used to always go to Shabu house but ever since my sister introduced me to Kufuya, I never went there again (except for birthdays because I'm forced to). There sauce is amazing! Add a little lemon juice to it and then BAM you got what you came for! I love them!
author: Malisa W.

description: service was just ok.waitresses keep chit chatting and fooling around w each other. got pretty annoyed..food is ok..their sauce for shabu is different. price isnt bad for all you can eat. BUT their kobe beef is reaaallllly fatty.
author: Bombdiggity b.

description:
Been here often, love japanese food. Service was excellent. I had sushi and it was great relative to the price. My BF and his group of boys had the Sabu sabu, and they loved it.

5 star because of the taste to price ratio, and great friendly service.
author: Ce Y.

description: The best thing about this place is the cheap price for all you can eat.  The service is a bit slow and the meat not as good as Shabu House or Shabu Way, but the value is definitely there.  It's also good that the wait here isn't too bad.
author: Kryzak K.

description: First time I came here I instantly fell in love with kufuya. From then I come here like once a week with my bf. The workers there are always friendly and customer service would be a 5\5. After a long week of work and everything I always choose kufuya to go to for a nice dinner. I LOVE THEIR SAUCE! especially with alot of red peppers. It's the shizznat (: Me and my group of friends threw couple of birthday parties here. Since we go there so much the worker gave us some sushi on the house. Honestly i never tried their sushi until that day because we were so hooked on their hotpot buffet and boy those sushi was one of the best in S.F.
author: Audrey C.

description:
2 stars for effort. I came here with  my family for a birthday dinner. Half of us wanted to do the buffet that was cheaply $22, but the other half didn't so since there was 9 of us, we were thinking we would sit at different ends of the table but the lady tried explaining the situation, confusing us even more. She said we had to sit at different table at the other end of the restaurant, but we tried telling her that we were going to sit at different ends and in the end she said "if some of you want buffet then you can sit on this side, but the others can sit on the other side of the table." We were frustrated because it took a good 20 minutes trying to figure everything out when we had it right all along. ANYWAYS!

So 4 of us got all you can eat shabu and figuring out the menu was bleh. We used portable hot pot stove. It took forever for them to bring the soup out, we got our veggies and meat before the soup. We ordered the spicy miso soup. It tasted more like water than spicy miso soup. The dipping sauce was not what I was use to, but I gave it a shot and it was alright. The beef was ook, but I did stuff myself. 

The service was okay, but I think they can improve. It didn't help they had friends or family at the other table so they would sometimes ignore us and constantly go to their table to chat. 

I don't think I'll be coming back here. Definitely sticking to my favorite shabu restaurants.
author: Cindy N.

description:
I love how this place never gets too crowded, but still brings in customers throughout the week.  The gals that run the front of the house are really friendly, which brings a family touch to the ambiance.

The sushi is fresh and you can select creative rolls on the menu.  The shabu-shabu is to die for.  Only costs $20, for all you can eat veggies and meat.  It's healthy and cheap for the amount they provide!
author: Anne K.

description: Shabu Shabu, sushi rolls and triple parking. That's kufuya for you! Usually after my parents and I leave from our PT sessions, we go to kufuya. Everything is very fresh and reasonably priced. The shabu shabu is really yummy. pick of lamb or beef. so for a set price you get all you can get noddles, tofu, veggies, meat and i think i'm forgetting something else. the sushi is very tasty! It can be very crowded on saturday. the later it is, the more crowded. service is very efficient! and if you are leaving and someone is parked behind your car, just tell the hostess and they'll call out the car behind you!
author: Alicia F.

description: This isn't the best sushi place in the city, however, it is the place to go after a long days work and you want decent food that tastes good and served to you by the friendliest family you'll ever meet who remember your name.   I have been going here now for years (recommendation of another friend) for the shabu and sushi meals with friends and family.  I love Julie & Lisa who are extremely gracious and always happy to see you.  Not to mention, the secret sauce they use for the shabu is amaaaazing.  Anyone we've ever taken to Shabu Shabu here ALWAYS wants to go again.  Not to mention, they are now buying a choice cut of meat for their Shabu that's amazing!
author: Wendy C.

description: Im giving four stars cus the people working there are super nice. great for big groupss
author: Cindy L.

description:
I had came here with a friend not expecting much. They have parking in the back where its 2 car slots with instructions where it says 1 car - park anywhere (very vague). 

Not really a shabu-table ready place like Shabu House or Coriya or sorts like that.. the service started out to be really nice. Little did I know as my friend had read reviews prior to selecting this place, they only carry beef for all you can eat along with veggies and the typical things you'd get. The service was nice, however 10 minutes into eating a waitress comes asking if that car was mine. I responded yes and she says thats now how I should park the car.. and suggested nicely but offensively that I should not do that next time. I'm wondering why are you telling me this when we're the ONLY customer in the restaurant? Since that I decided to get my money's worth. Six plates of beef was how much we had.. 2 plates were not fresh at all however I still ate it just to see the results. Out of the 4 waiter/ress it took us about an avg of 5-10 mins before getting we can actually get something when there were no one in the restaurant.. I find that very displeasing and was also told to move my car halfway into my dinner... 

none the less I would not come back just because of how they treated us.
author: Ian C.

description:
3.5 stars

Ive only been here for the shabu shabu hot pot, so I can't comment about the rest of the menu.  The fresh slices of beef keep coming to enjoy in a big ass hearty pot.  The vegetables are really fresh and the different noodles go perfect with the meal.  They give you a pre-made dipping sauce (soy sauce, vinegar, sesame oil) that I personally love because its the same sorta sauce I'd make at home.  Kufuya is a little out in the boondocks, but they have their own parking lot behind the restaurant.  My only gripe is that they serve you sliced beef brisket, which is still tasty, where I'm used to sliced ribeye when I make it at home.  yes, call me spoiled.
author: david w.

description: This place is great. The staff make the restaurant feel as if you're eating in your own dining room :D
author: Claudia J.

description: good place to eat, kick back and enjoy the game on tv that night. usually go there when there is a night game (nfl or nba on tv)
author: Jw T.

description: Best Shabu ever! Sauce is amazing. Good sushi too & excellent service. Can't ask for more...
author: Mui D.

description: Pretty good shabu place. The sauce (in the gatorade bottle) is pretty good and so is the quality of the meat (most important thing for me). Was here for a birthday party over the weekend and had a good time!
author: Kristine N.

description:
this place is two blocks from house and i had been meaning to try this place out and finally 6 months later i stopped by.  i was kind of dissappointed about this place.  i hoped for more but i have had better.  their tofu salad was watery, some of there nigiri was not very fresh. 
i might go back just to try their shabu shabu, one last chance.
author: junie k.

description: This time, i ordered the same pork bone broth, but now it is tasteless. It was like water now. The waitress are all different. They are still quickly at resupply food when there are nobody at the restaurant. When place get stuffed, it was really hard to call them over to resupply food. I was going here with my son which are two people. Right now, they CHARGED tips, which i don't like because they are not as good as the last time i visited. NOT going there anymore.
author: Sandra C.

description: I always have a blast here.  Food is great, Their secret sauce is even better.  Thanks Lisa!
author: Delon N.

description:
my first shabu shabu experience

-$22 all you can eat beef or lamb! came here with 3 other people, so we had 2 pots, one miso soup and one chicken broth. it was delisssssh. their sauce..."crack sauce" is CRACKIN!!

-downfaults: service was slow, small bathroom, called to make a reservation but they didn't take my name? had to call again to...basically remake a reservation cause i was sure they didn't put me down on the list, and... well youre basically cooking your food so i wouldn't wear anything really nice cus the smell will stick to you
author: Crystal K.

description: I came here with friends last night for my bday dinner and they were very accommodating for our large group (16 people).  I usually come here with the wife to do shabu, and that's what we did with our large group. Wait staff was very attentive as we went through numerous plates of beef.  Highly recommend it . Kudos on their fantastic (and addicting) shabu-sauce and parking lot in the back.
author: Jeff T.

description: I have been here several times for their shabu shabu and never leave disappointed. For $20 you get all you can eat beef, noodles and veggies. It's all so yummy. The service is quick and friendly. My friends and I never had to ask for more food. It just kept on coming. I just wish they would give you some kind of dessert at the end to top it all off.
author: Jennie N.

description: I love their sauce!  It's such a good deal too.  All you can eat beef, veggies, clear noodles, and the udon.  We always come with a group of friends and always have a really good time.  I like how there's parking in the back too.
author: Jen L.

description: This place might not look as fancy as the other shabu places in S.F., but for 22 dollars, the all-you-can-eat is amazing. All-you-can-eat is the TRUE way to eat shabu shabu or any other culturally different hot pot style meals. Meat is thin, but who cares? It's all you can eat. It also means you can cook it a bit faster with 2-3 swirls in the broth. I love this place, it's the only shabu shabu place I'll go to if I had to pick, unless I find another place in the future...
author: Collins L.

description:
i think shabu shabu is pretty easy to do, but it comes down to the sauce that they serve along with it....the sauce kufu-ya seves is fantabulous!

i like that the establishment keeps the meat coming even when you don't ask for more, they are on top of everything....and for $25/person all worth every penny....the veggies/noodles/tofu plate they serve alongside with the meat to put into the pot is all fresh 

i'm not so sure about the sushi...although we didnt order it, it did not look good...we'll just stick to the shabu when we come back, which we will for sure!
author: Alice K.

description:
I love this place and the veggie tempura comes with so much that I couldnt eat anymore! I love that they have vegetarian options but I guess since it is in norcal and not socal that its a must.
My girlfriends grandpa lives on the same street as this place so that is a bonus. Also, her mom is really good friends with all the servers....
Even though I cant comment on the shabu shabu, people always order it and seem to love it!
give this place a chance....
author: marty m.

description: Awesome place. Get the bento boxes for dinner and usually soup for lunch.  With bento boxes you get three options which is awesome.  Food is great and the green tea they serve is probably one of the best i've ever had.
author: D n.

description: this place is great and very well priced. you can either do the hot pot which is pretty good or you could do sushi.  The food here is pretty good. I eat here any time i am in the neighborhood.  The service is friendly and the price for hot pot is a steal compared to all of these other shabu places popping up all over the city.
author: Art N.

description:
it was really ma ma.  the family was gathered around eating pizza while the old dudes played cards.  the lil ones were playing with their bratz dolls.  the pizza smelled really good and savory.
the waitress was happy and pleasant. 
the food was fine.
nothing at all was terrible, but i won't go back.  just kinda ghetto. 
heck, i wanted to leave and get some pizza at gaspares down the street.
the menu was standard japanese restaurant stuff.  teriyaki, big ass rolls, combo boxes gyoza etc. etc.
 at least my curiosity is satisfied.
author: yayoi s.

description:
i have only eaten the shabu shabu here
and its actually pretty good. for $20 its even better
they are very attentive, when they see that you are done with your dish of meat/veggies  they will swiftly come and replenish it.
also they have a parking lot
author: Tashi. O.

description: This place is decent for the area I have been here twice 4 lunch and once for dinner. I say stick 2 the lunch menu for the price you get an okay portion and the people are friendly which is always a plus. It was cute there grade school age daughter opened the door and waved goodbye to customers while carring here baby sister. I would eat lunch here again.
author: Kim R.

description: Pretty decent sushi!!! Great oysters, yum!!! The pricing is average for a local sushi place! But the service is awesome!!! The owners are so sweet
author: yana Z.

description: It's a cute little place owned by Chinese people. I have nothing more to say.
author: Alex Y.

description:
i couldn't believe it when they re-opened.  i think i started going to them when they first opened, on clement/12th.  they closed for a couple of years, but kept the name and reopened in a larger place that can accomodate more events.

it's a totaly family business, with the parents/grandparents in the back and 3 sibs as the waitresses/sushi chefs.  it's now expanded to include significant others and the kids.

their food has always been good, whether their old place or new.  the rolls are varied and the fish is very fresh.  they have very good udon, which is my go-to dish.  the rice boxes are also very good, and feature quite a bit of food.

the larger place has allowed them to do shabu shabu, which is a really good deal.  the sauce is wonderful and the food keeps coming, at least until you fall asleep.
author: JM Y.

description: Its traditional and ordinary...my boyfriend and i go here when we want good sushi and dont want to break that much bread.  But if you dont mind adding $30 more dollars to your bill Ariake is down the street.  $60 more dollars go to Sushi Bistro
author: Steph S.

description: I was a little worried when I walked in and saw that the restaurant was empty on a Saturday night at peak dinner hour but ... the service was fast and friendly, and most importantly, the fish was fresh and tasty.  The portions are small, but so is the price.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description: It is weird that this place was almost totally empty on a Saturday evening, but it was really nice not to have to wait and to have a quiet and relaxing dining experience. They serve BIG cups of hot tea and the sushi rolls were nice. I'm not sure I've had enough sushi in my life time to be a good critic, but I thought they were quite good. (I had a rainbow roll and some unagi maki.) The prices were quite decent and the waitress was really nice. It was probably because the restaurant was empty, but she kept serving us tea even after we'd paid the bill and probably would have let us sit and talk until closing. Good experience, all in all. Nice little place to have in the neighborhood.
author: Caitlin H.

description: love their mountain roll and tempura ice cream. great service great food. definitely need to try this place (at least once) be sure to get the mountain roll and eat it warm!!!
author: Vicky T.

description:
I think this place is one of the best for cheap sushi and shabu shabu.

Usually not crowded and has parking in the back. The atmosphere is not the greatest but it is also not the point. The service is very friendly and the food is good. 
This isnt a special occasion restaurant - it is a good place in the Outer Richmond to get very resonably priced japanese food. 

Sure there are alot of rolls with imitation crab (not my style) but they do have a 'spider roll' with a real crab in it that is delicious.

I do agree with the other review about the 'white people' seating section ... but that might be a little paranoid because I have always felt very welcome here.
author: Aaron F.

description: i went there last week with my friends. we oreded uni, but we can tell its not so fresh
author: Jun S.

description: it may be a hike for a lot of us to get out to kufu-ya, but it's worth it. jon m. and i went last night and had the best 'chilly night dinner'. while jon's vegetable udon was just mediocre, my chirashi was fresh and filling, but it was 2 of the rolls off of their 'roll fantasia' section that were outstanding. the volcano is a spicy and sweet piping hot lightly fried tuna roll and the mountain was a rich serving of baked crab and eel topped with baked salmon, fresh masago, and what i can only describe as a hollandaise-like sauce. inventive and warm...mmm...make the trip
author: Joanna R.

description: Friendly service!!!Teriffic shabu shabu!!! Good prices!!! For sure RE-PEAT customer when-ever i'm back in town!!
author: Phong T.

description: all I can say is YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!!!!  Very friendly staff.  The waitress was very attentive to what we wanted.  Our tea was always full and hot and the meat just kept on coming.  The meat was sliced thin enough so that I can get my money's worth!  Overall, I think I would come here at least once a week.
author: eric t.

description: Don't know what's the hype about this place. My sister kept saying how much she enjoys coming here. I finally came to try. We went on a Friday night so business was a little busier than usual. The whole place was packed with people ordering pretty much the same thing - shabu shabu. We ordered the same, in hopes to fill up our empty stomaches with the all you can eat meat. The conclusion? Yes, it was filling but the beef was disappointing. First the soup base - I think it's a miso soup base. It was bland, tasted just like a pot of hot water combined with soy sauce. Then, the dipping sauce, it's supposed to be the house's special sauce. But again, didn't feel like it enhanced the food any better. Lastly, the beef. The beef was dry and the texture was coarse. I can imagine it to be sliced thinly from a piece of rough meat. The only pro about this place is our waitress is pretty friendly. She even gave us a 10% discount at the end because our food wasn't delivered in a timely manner. I've tried other shabu places and this one definitely belongs on the bottom of the list.
author: Bon T.

description: Just happen my friend was from LA for few days, thought i will try this new place , after this one time i will not recomend anyone to go there.  Compared to the proper Shabu House on the other side of Geary , no competition.. The Shabu House was the best in the bay area, everything was clean, fresh and well placed on the dish....This Kufuya place was really sucks, i asked for lamb they will give u only a small plate, vegetable dish wasnt fresh and hardly any udon in it, not like Shabu House, everything was perfect..Service was terrible, never see if we need another plate of beef, lamb when we finished, ask for more garlic, never came until we ask for the second time, gas ran out never replace till we ask, spill tea accidentally , my friend ask for more napkins, the waitress said "What u say?"  to my friend in a very bad tone and manner, they were lucky i even gave them 10% tips.  There was no service what ever...let me put it this way, it was bad service never was treated as guests......
author: Aries C.

description: Great food. close to my friends house. good for dinner. i love the tray. its good.
author: Kenny N.

description: Overall....the place was nice, clean, and the service was fair.  It wasn't super special, but the waitress wasn't having attitudes or being a jerk like some restaurants.  The only problem is that they don't know how to make japanese food...i thinks it's partly because they're chinese chefs (I'm not trying to be racist, but I just couldn't taste authenticity).  Bottom line, I can get better japanese food elsewhere.
author: Karen C.

description: decent food, decent prices WITH a parking lot... wat more can i say???
author: Will M.

description: this restaurant the worker  was so nice and so friendly!!! ok we try the shabu shabu omg is only $22!!!!well the beef was so tasty  and the sauce omg so damn good ... this place the shabu sauce is better than other shabu place "FOR SURE"... also  we order some sushi too and the fish quality look so fresh and good so yeah we all have a nice dinner at KUFUYA Restaurant.... very support A++++++++ THANK!!! hope you guy come and enjoy it.... THANK!!!
author: Pok L.
